description: Application of skills and theories of adolescent mentoring taught in the classroom to a supervised, structured mentoring field experience.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: CRJU
name: Women and Crime
description: Impact of gender-based relations on crime and the criminal justice system.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: CRJU
name: Crime Over the Life Course
description: Development of criminal and delinquent behavior over time.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: CRJU
name: Race, Crime, and Criminal Justice
description: An historical overview of the intersection between issues of race, crime, and justice. The impact of the criminal justice system on minority groups.

subject: CRJU
name: Organized Crime
description: Origins and modern day activity of organized crime in the United States and internationally will be investigated. Attention is given to problems of criminal activity and the present day transnational character of criminal organizations.

subject: CRJU
name: The Death Penalty
description: Overview of the history and evolution of the death penalty. Identification of key legal developments in death penalty jurisprudence.   FS: 04/05/2023.

subject: CRJU
name: Law and Criminal Justice Policy
description: Legal and policy responses to crime and criminal justice issues.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: CRJU
name: Computer Applications in Criminal Justice
description: Computing, database systems, and software applications in research and professional practice.

subject: CRJU
name: Selected Topics in Criminal Justice
description: A seminar for advanced students. Individual topics to be announced by title. May be repeated once with the consent of the advisor.   CL: 2020.

subject: CRJU
name: Law and Justice
description: Examination of law as an instrument of criminal justice policy, social control, and the protection of civil liberties.   GC: 10/25/2021.

subject: CRJU
name: Criminology
description: The major theories of the etiology of criminal behavior, including biological, environmental, and other causative factors.   GC: 10/25/2021.

subject: CSCE
name: Introduction to Computer Concepts
description: History, application, and social impact of computers; problem-solving, algorithm development, applications software, and programming in a procedural language.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: General Applications Programming
description: Introduction to systematic computer problem-solving and programming for a variety of applications.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Algorithmic Design I
description: Problem-solving, algorithmic design, and programming. Three lectures and two laboratory hours per week.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Algorithmic Design II
description: Continuation of CSCE 145. Rigorous development of algorithms and computer programs; elementary data structures. Three lecture hours and two laboratory hours per week.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computing in the Modern World
description: An introduction to the field of computing: trends in computing technology, the profession, and careers; subdisciplines in computing; the nature of research and development.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Introduction to Computer Security
description: Introduction to the theory and practice of computer security, including security policies, authentification, digital certificates, firewalls, malicious code, legal and ethical issues, and incident handling.   FS:  4/5/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Program Design and Development
description: Fundamental algorithms and processes used in business information systems. Development and representation of programming logic. Introduction to implementation using a high-level programming language.   FS: 3/1/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Business Applications Programming
description: Introduction to computer applications in business. Programming exercises in COBOL.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Scientific Applications Programming
description: Introduction to computer applications in science and engineering. Programming exercises in a high-level language.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: UNIX System Administration
description: The Unix programming environment: I/O programming, Unix processes, fork, exec, pipes and signals, and tools.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Special Topics in Computer Programming
description: Programming and application development using selected programming languages. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.

subject: CSCE
name: Computer Hardware Foundations
description: Number representation, data formats, CPU and memory organization, assembly language, I/O and peripherals, computer networks. Students may not apply both CSCE 210 and CSCE 212 to any minor or major program of study.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Digital Logic Design
description: Number systems, Boolean algebra, logic design, sequential machines.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Introduction to Computer Architecture
description: Computer architecture, components. and organization; memory addressing; Input/Output; instruction sets; interrupts; assembly-language programming. Students may not apply both CSCE 210 and CSCE 212 to any minor or major program of study.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: UNIX/Linux Fundamentals
description: UNIX operating system, user-level system commands, and programming tools. UNIX scripting languages.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Advanced Programming Techniques
description: Pointers; memory management; advanced programming language structures: operator overloading, iterators, multiple inheritance, polymorphism, templates, virtual functions; Unix programming environment.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Client-Server Computing
description: Web technologies to support client-server computing. Implementation of client-server applications.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: CSCE
name: Object-Oriented Programming Techniques
description: Advanced object-oriented concepts and techniques; multiple inheritance; memory management; operator overloading; polymorphism; performance issues.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Software Engineering
description: Fundamentals of software design and development; software implementation strategies; object-oriented design techniques; functional design techniques; design patterns; design process; source control; testing.    FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Robotic Applications and Design
description: Design and control of robots. Interactions between robots, sensing, actuation, and computation.   FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Applied Problem Solving and Programming
description: Systematic problem definition, solution formulation, and computer implementation for business and related areas. Internet and database applications. Programming exercises in a high-level programming language.

subject: CSCE
name: Operating Systems
description: Operating system structure and function; process implementation, scheduling, and synchronization; memory management; security; naming protection; resource allocation; network file systems.   FS:  12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Embedded Systems
description: Fundamentals of embedded systems: hardware components, software components, hardware/software interface design, and hardware/software co-design.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computer Systems Engineering
description: System-level modeling and evaluation of computer systems: requirements elicitation and specification, architectural design, reliability and performance evaluation, Markov modeling, life-cycle cost analysis, project management.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Programming Language Structures
description: Formal specification of syntax and semantics; structure of algorithms; list processing and string manipulation languages; statement types, control structures, and interfacing procedures.   FS: 09/14/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Techniques for representing and processing information, including the use of lists, trees, and graphs; analysis of algorithms; sorting, searching, and hashing techniques.   FS: 12/07/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Foundations of Computation
description: Basic theoretical principles of computing as modeled by formal languages, grammars, automata, and Turing machines; fundamental limits of computation.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Professional Issues in Computer Science and Engineering
description: Professional issues in the information technology professions; history and social context of computing; professional responsibilities; privacy; intellectual property; risks and liabilities of computer-based systems.   FS: 04/02/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Mainframe Systems
description: Introduction to the large scale computer systems used by businesses to support thousands of simultaneous users and process millions of transactions.    FS: 4/4/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Introduction to Computer Networks
description: Concepts and components of computer networks and the Internet; network applications; network protocol stack.   FS: 10/5/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Capstone Computing Project I
description: Major team-based software design project to be undertaken in a student’s final year of study; project planning, software requirements analysis, design, and specification. Written reports and oral presentations in a technical setting.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Capstone Computer Engineering Project
description: Advanced computer systems engineering. Team projects. Written reports and oral presentations in a technical setting.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Capstone Computing Project II
description: Continuation of CSCE 490. Computer system implementation, testing, verification and validation of results. Written reports and oral presentations in a technical setting.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: CSCE
name: Independent Study
description: Individual investigation or study of special topics. At most three credits may be applied toward a degree.  Approval of project proposal by instructor and department advisor.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computer Programming and Applications
description: Concepts and properties of algorithms; programming exercises with emphasis on good programming habits.  Credit may not be received for both CSCE 500 and CSCE 145. Open to all majors. May not be used for major credit by computer science and engineering majors.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: System Programming
description: System software such as command language interpreters, client-server applications, debuggers; mail systems, browsers, macroprocessors, and revision control systems; file systems, processes, threads, and interprocess communication.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: System Performance Evaluation
description: Measuring, modeling, analyzing, and predicting performance of computer systems and networks; bottleneck analysis; Markovian queuing systems and networks; use of operational and probabilistic models.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computer Architecture
description: Design methodology; processor design; computer arithmetic: algorithms for addition, multiplication, floating point arithmetic; microprogrammed control; memory organization; introduction to parallel architectures.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computer Network Programming
description: Computer networks and communication protocols; socket programming; interprocess communication; development of network software; case studies.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computer Networks
description: Structure, design, and analysis of computer networks; ISO/OSI network architecture.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computer Crime and Forensics
description: Structure, design, and analysis of computer networks; ISO/OSI network architecture.   FS: 12/07/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Ethical Hacking
description: Fundamental principles and techniques of ethical hacking, including penetration testing life cycle, planning and scoping, identifying targets and goals, active and passive reconnaissance, enumeration and scanning, exploitation, post-exploitation, and results reporting.   FS: 12/07/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Database System Design
description: Database management systems; database design and implementation; security, integrity, and privacy.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Information Security Principles
description: Threats to information resources and appropriate countermeasures. Cryptography, identification and authentication, access control models and mechanisms, multilevel database security, steganography, Internet security, and intrusion detection and prevention.   FS: 09/14/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Service Oriented Computing
description: Cooperative information systems and service-oriented computing. Techniques for achieving coordinated behavior among a decentralized group of information system components. Distributed databases, multiagent systems, conceptual modeling, Web services, and applications.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Compiler Construction
description: Techniques for design and implementation of compilers, including lexical analysis, parsing, syntax-directed translation, and symbol table management.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Mobile Application Development
description: Development of mobile applications, including user interface design for mobile, local and cloud data storage techniques, and application architectures.   FS: 11/2/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Windows Programming
description: Object-oriented methods and tools for application programming with graphically interactive operating systems.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Building Secure Software
description: Construction of software systems resistant to vulnerabilities and attacks. Cryptographic tools. Language, operating system, and network security. Case studies. Development of best practices through programming assignments.   FS: 09/14/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Theory of Computation
description: Basic theoretical principles of computing as modeled by formal languages and automata; computability and computational complexity   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computer Game Development
description: Design and development of computer games, with emphasis on the technologies used. Hands-on development of computer games.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Algorithms in Bioinformatics
description: Concepts, algorithms and tools for important problems in Bioinformatics, including nucleotide and amino acid sequence alignment, DNA fragment assembly, phylogenetic reconstruction, and protein structure visualization and assessment.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Data Analysis in Python: Application to Neuroscience
description: Hands-on introduction in Python to the analysis of neuroscience data (human neuroimaging and cellular electrophysiology), including various aspects such as data wrangling, statistics, classification, and visualization.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: CSCE
name: Introduction to Cryptography
description: Design of secret codes for secure communication, including encryption and integrity verification: ciphers, cryptographic hashing, and public key cryptosystems such as RSA. Mathematical principles underlying encryption. Code-breaking techniques. Cryptographic protocols.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Numerical Analysis
description: Interpolation and approximation of functions; solution of algebraic equations; numerical differentiation and integration; numerical solutions of ordinary differential equations and boundary value problems; computer implementation of algorithms.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Systems Simulation
description: Computer simulation of real systems; principles of system organization; random number generation; programming exercises in a simulation language.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Computational Science
description: Parallel algorithms; scientific visualization; techniques for solving scientific problems.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Introduction to Computer Graphics
description: Graphics hardware; graphics primitives; two-dimensional and three-dimensional viewing; basic modeling.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Visualization Tools
description: Scientific visualization tools as applied to sampled and generated data; methods for data manipulation and representation; investigation of visualization techniques.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Parallel Computing
description: Architecture and interconnection of parallel computers; parallel programming models and applications; issues in high-performance computing; programming of parallel computers.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Critical Interactives
description: Foundational techniques in multidisciplinary software development, specifically of applications designed to present sensitive, sometimes controversial, materials in ways to engender empathic awareness of the interactor.      FS: 11/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Human-Computer Interaction
description: Interdisciplinary approach to interaction design, user-centered design, human abilities, survey development, experimental study methodology, heuristic evaluations, usability testing, universal design, and accessibility.   FS: 10/5/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Robotics
description: Design and application of robotic systems; emphasis on mobile robots and intelligent machines.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Text Processing
description: Text and natural language processing; formal models and data structures appropriate for text processing; selected topics in computational linguistics, stylistics, and content analysis.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Artificial Intelligence
description: Heuristic problem solving, theorem proving, and knowledge representation, including the use of appropriate programming languages and tools.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Trusted Artificial Intelligence
description: AI Trust – responsible/ethical technology, fairness/ lack of bias, explanations (XAI), machine learning, reasoning, software testing, data quality and provenance, tools and projects.   FS: 02/01/2023.

subject: CSCE
name: Bayesian Networks and Decision Graphs
description: Normative approaches to uncertainty in artificial intelligence. Probabilistic and causal modeling with Bayesian networks and influence diagrams. Applications in decision analysis and support. Algorithms for probability update in graphical models.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Machine Learning Systems
description: Design and implementation of machine learning systems, Deep learning systems stack, machine learning platforms, scalable and distributed machine learning.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Big Data Analytics
description: Foundational techniques and tools required for data science and big data analytics.  Concepts, principles, and techniques applicable to any technology and industry for establishing a baseline that can be enhanced by future study.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Topics in Information Technology
description: Reading and research on selected topics in information technology. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Strategic Management of Information Systems
description: Strategic management and use of information systems in organizations.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Advanced Digital Design
description: Design techniques for logic systems; emphasis on higher-level CAD tools such as hardware description languages and functional modeling.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: VLSI System Design
description: VLSI design process models, introduction to EDA tools, HDL modeling and simulation, logic synthesis and simulation, benchmark design projects.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Fundamentals of VLSI Chip Design
description: Design of VLSI circuits, including standard processes, circuit design, layout, and CAD tools. Lecture and guided design projects.

subject: CSCE
name: Analysis of Algorithms
description: Algorithm design techniques; algorithms and data structures for sets and graphs; time and space complexity; sorting and searching; NP-complete problems.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Robotics Systems
description: Design and operation of robot systems; dynamics, control, and motion trajectories of manipulators; visual, auditory, and tactile sensing systems; planning and learning.   CL: 2020.

subject: CSCE
name: Topics in Information Technology
description: Reading and research on selected topics in information technology. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

subject: CYBR
name: Special Topics in Cyber Intelligence
description: Selected topics in the field of Cyber Intelligence. May be repeated once.   FS: 04/07/2021.

subject: CYBR
name: Special Topics in Cyber Policy and Governance
description: This course explores the policy and governance implications of inhabiting worlds both shaped and created by digital/cybernetic technologies. May be repeated as content varies.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: CYBR
name: Special Topics in Cyber Society and Ethics
description: This course explores the ethical and social implications of inhabiting worlds both shaped and created by digital/cybernetic technologies. May be repeated as content varies.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: CYBR
name: Special Topics in Global Cyber Cultures
description: This course explores the emergence of cybercultures around the world. In addition to touching each inhabited continent and the specific cybercultures that can be found in each of these places, the course introduces students to key issues in the emergence of cultures that are produced and/or mediated by digital infrastructure. May be repeated as content varies.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: CYBR
name: Independent Study in Cyber Policy and Ethics
description: An independent study in Cyber Policy and Ethics provides students an opportunity for independent and intensive study of specific topics with support and supervision from a qualified faculty member.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: CYBR
name: Internship: Global Experience in Cyberintelligence
description: A supervised internship experience related to cyber policy and ethics outside the U.S. context.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: CYBR
name: Internship: Cyberintelligence
description: A supervised experience to assist the student in real life cyberintelligence experiences. This course will allow real world experience for the student in the cyberintelligence profession along with opportunities to receive feedback and reflect on the experience.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Appreciation
description: An eclectic survey of various dance forms including primitive, historic, ballet, modern, and Broadway musical.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Ballet Technique I
description: A beginning study of ballet with emphasis on alignment, classical historical traditions, and combinations or movement.   This course is for dance majors.  May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Ballet Technique I
description: A beginning study of ballet with emphasis on alignment, classical historical traditions, and combinations or movement.   This course is for dance minors and non dance majors.  May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: The Dancer's Body
description: Anatomy and movement analysis for dancers.

subject: DANC
name: World Dance I
description: World Dance is dance experience in diverse world dance forms. This course is for dance majors and minors.  May be repeated up to six times for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: World Dance I
description: World Dance is dance experience in diverse world dance forms. This course is for non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Contemporary Dance Technique I
description: An introduction to modern dance with the beginning practice of movement technique. This course is for dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Contemporary Dance Technique I
description: An introduction to modern dance with the beginning practice of movement technique. This course is for dance minors and non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: World Dance II
description: World Dance is dance experience in diverse world dance forms. This course is for dance majors and minors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: World Dance II
description: World Dance is dance experience in diverse world dance forms. This course is for non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Introduction to Dance
description: Introduction to dance as art, communication, and cultural expression as it applies to a career in dance. Open to non-majors.   FS: 09/11/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Improvisation and Composition
description: An introductory course on dance composition and the creative process. Exploration and improvisation of different dance forms; specific choreographic tools. This course is for dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Improvisation and Composition
description: An introductory course on dance composition and the creative process. Exploration and improvisation of different dance forms; specific choreographic tools. This course is for dance minors and non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Ballroom Dance I
description: Introduction of six major dances (Foxtrot, Waltz, Tango, Cha Cha, Swing, and Rumba) to students with no dance experience. The emphasis will be on learning dance figures and patterns.

subject: DANC
name: Ballroom Dance II
description: Intermediate steps will include challenging choreography or patterns. The emphasis in technique will be based on developing speed and elegance while dancing complex patterns.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Company I
description: This course is designed for rehearsals leading to dance performances; and including student choreography, on stage productions, the dance touring ensemble and components of dance production. Repeat seven times.

subject: DANC
name: Jazz Dance Technique I
description: A beginning level class focusing on coordination, rhythm, alignment, jazz vocabulary, and jazz dance positions. May be repeated up to six times for credit.

subject: DANC
name: Ballet Technique II
description: Second level of classical ballet technique facilitating skill in allegro and adagio work. This course is for dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Ballet Technique II
description: Second level of classical ballet technique facilitating skill in allegro and adagio work.  This course is for dance minors and non dance majors.   May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Pointe II
description: Pointe technique and skills on pointe, an extension of ballet technique at the foundational level. May be repeated four times.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Contemporary Dance Technique II
description: A second level of contemporary technique, with emphasis on skill refinement and aesthetic elements. This course is for dance majors.  May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Contemporary Dance Technique II
description: A second level of contemporary technique, with emphasis on skill refinement and aesthetic elements. This course is for dance minors and non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Laban Movement Analysis
description: An examination of Laban Movement analysis – a language for understanding, observing, describing and notating all forms of movement. Experiential, analytical and performance teaching methods will be used.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Education I: Introduction to Dance Education
description: An overview of state and national standards, theoretical and philosophical perspectives that shape current practices for teaching dance in K-12 environments, and arts/dance education advocacy.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Pilates I
description: Innovative system of exercises for the mind and body. Teaching posture, body awareness, and easy graceful movement at a beginner’s level.

subject: DANC
name: Jazz Dance Technique II
description: An intermediate level class focusing on coordination, rhythm, alignment, jazz vocabulary, jazz dance positions, and expanded knowledge of theatrical jazz dance. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance History I
description: Overview of the development of dance through the 19th century.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance History II
description: Development of dance from the 20th century to the present.    FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Music for Dancers
description: Rhythmic analysis, reading and metric patterns, construction and use of scores from musical theatre to symphonic orchestration with exercises to enhance the knowledge of relationship between dance and music.

subject: DANC
name: Ballet Technique III
description: Third level of classical ballet technique. This course is for dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Ballet Technique III
description: Third level of classical ballet technique. This course is for dance minors and non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Pointe III
description: Pointe technique and skills on pointe, an extension of ballet technique at the intermediate level. Study and execution of female variations from classical repertory. May be repeated four times.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Intermediate Tap Dance
description: Advanced fundamentals of tap dance, including intermediate/advanced rhythmic structure and incorporation of alignment and style.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: West African Dance I
description: The history and practice of indigenous West African dance.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Analysis and Criticism
description: Theoretical practices and cultural perspectives of dance making.    FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Contemporary Dance Technique III
description: A third level technique with refinement skills, and complex combinations. This course is for dance majors.   May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Contemporary Dance Technique III
description: A third level technique with refinement skills, and complex combinations. This course is for dance minors and non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Choreography I
description: An intermediate level choreography and composition course designed to create and adapt work in different dance forms in modern, jazz, and ballet.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Education II: Creative Dance
description: An introduction to motor development, movement concepts, elements, and skills that contribute to lesson planning, instruction, and assessment of creative dance in K-12 education.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Pilates II
description: Innovative system of exercises for the mind and body. Teaching posture, body awareness, and easy graceful movement at an intermediate level.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Historic Dance
description: A course open to all students interested in gaining knowledge of early dances from the 15th Basse, Pavanne and Gaillarde of the Renaissance era to the Baroque dances from the court of Louis XIV.

subject: DANC
name: Jazz Dance Technique III
description: Advanced-level jazz dance technique. May be repeated up to six times for credit.

subject: DANC
name: Movement and Dance for Musical Theatre
description: Styles of movement and dance in musical theatre from the ‘20s, ‘30s, and ‘40s to modern contemporary musical theatre. Choreographing for musicals, cultural forms of dance, staging for vocal pieces.

subject: DANC
name: Dance History
description: A survey of dance from ethnic and social to professional dance, from the time of the Greeks through the twentieth century.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Body Conditioning/Gyrokinesis Method
description: Body conditioning technique designed to increase strength, flexibility, and coordination, enhancing the dance students’ performance ability and body awareness.

subject: DANC
name: Men's Ballet
description: Study of the art of classical ballet for men with increased emphasis on facilitating skill in allegro and adagio work specific to male technique.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Studio Operation
description: Advanced training methods and techniques in all forms of dance. Emphasis on recent research in dance curriculum and operational technique. For experienced dance teachers.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Independent Study and Research
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Ballet Technique IV
description: Intensive fourth level of classical ballet technique. This course is for dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Ballet Technique IV
description: Intensive fourth level of classical ballet technique.  This course is for dance minors and non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Pointe Variations for Intermediate/Advanced Ballet
description: Pointe technique, an extension of ballet technique skills on pointe. Study and execution of female variations from classical repertory. May be repeated four times.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: West African Dance II
description: Study of the development of West African music and dance, emphasizing cultural, social, and physical influences. Exploration of the relationship between dancer and the drummer at an intermediate level.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Contemporary Dance Technique IV
description: Intensive advanced level contemporary dance technique. This course is for dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Contemporary Dance Technique IV
description: Intensive advanced level contemporary dance technique. This course is for dance minors and non dance majors. May be repeated up to six times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Teaching Methods of Ballet
description: The foundations of ballet technique are analyzed systematically. Students will learn to teach ballet technique and organize course work for all levels.   Recommend students to have completed at least four semesters of ballet technique.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Teaching Methods of Contemporary Dance
description: The foundations of contemporary dance technique are analyzed systematically. Students will learn to teach contemporary dance technique and organize course work for all levels.  Recommend students to have completed at least four semesters of contemporary dance technique.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Pas de Deux (Partnering)
description: Study of the art of classical ballet pas de deux for men and women. Special attention will include adagio work from classical ballet repertory and contemporary dance.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Musical Theatre Workshop
description: Intensive musical theatre training in areas of song interpretation, musical theatre, dance, voice and acting.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Choreography II
description: An intermediate level choreography course to further examine choreographic construction methods.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Education III: Dance Pedagogy for Middle and High School
description: Intensive study of content and strategies for teaching dance in middle and high school with particular emphasis on curriculum development, instruction, and assessment.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Synthesis of Dance Education Constructs (pre-internship seminar)
description: Seminar allows students to synthesize content and skills from all previous dance and education coursework in conjunction with their student teaching experience.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Inner Mastery Through Movement
description: A mind/body integration course designed for performing artists.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Production Design for Dance
description: Technical theatre functions, the structure and purpose of production design, and stage production as it relates to the whole of dance and theatrical performance.

subject: DANC
name: Integrated Approaches in Dance Education
description: Study and application of strategies for teaching diverse learners, implementation of instructional technology in the dance classroom, and dance/arts integration.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: DANC
name: Teaching Internship in Dance Education
description: Practical demonstration of pedagogical knowledge, skill, and dispositions necessary to effectively teach in K-12 dance education as defined and measured by CAEP and ADEPT standards.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Body Conditioning/Gyrokinesis Method II
description: Body conditioning technique that simultaneously stretches and strengthens the body at an intermediate level. Gyrokinesis teaches complete freedom of movement through exercises synchronized with corresponding breathing patterns enhancing aerobic and cardiovascular stimulation and promoting neuromuscular awareness. Restricted to dance majors/minors only.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Senior Capstone Dance Project
description: Culmination of the performance/choregraphy dance emphasis. Senior project encompassing a choreographic work or research thesis.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Selected Topics in Dance
description: A series of courses, each lasting one-third of a semester. Topics and required courses are announced in the class schedule for each semester.

subject: DANC
name: Dancer's Workshop
description: Individual advanced training in movement, improvisation, flexibility, and precision in dance styles including modern and ballet.    CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Dance Performance
description: Rehearsal, choreographic analysis, and dance performance. All components of dance production--including music, costume, lighting, and scenery--will be considered.

subject: DANC
name: The Articulate Body
description: Theoretical and experimental exploration of the major body systems and development movements to bring more articulation to the body and more awareness and physical ease in performance.   CL: 2020.

subject: DANC
name: Special Topics in Dance
description: Reading and research on selected topics. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated once as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

subject: DMSB
name: Financial Accounting in the Global Environment
description: Basic role of financial accounting in business organizations and in the global economy. Focus is on understanding and using financial statements.

subject: DMSB
name: Quantitative Methods in Business
description: Decision analysis techniques taught in the context of making business decisions. Includes basic statistics, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, decision theory, simulation, optimization, and project management.

subject: DMSB
name: Leading Teams and Organizations
description: Provides an in-depth understanding of principles of leadership and organizational behavior. Topics include: leadership style/self awareness, worker motivation and attitudes. Individual decision-making, team processes, conflict management organizational culture, and change management.

subject: ECHE
name: Introduction to Chemical Engineering
description: Introduction to engineering, with emphasis on chemical engineering. Problem-solving techniques, including the use of computer tools. Basic engineering design methods.

subject: ECHE
name: Exploring the Chemical Engineering Workplace
description: Identification of career interests and active exploration of careers in chemical engineering.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Research in Chemical Engineering
description: Introduction to research in Chemical Engineering, effective literature search, communication of results, lab safety, and research ethics.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical Process Principles
description: Material and energy balances in the chemical process industry. Properties of gases, liquids, and solids. Two one-hour lectures and one three-hour laboratory period devoted to problem solving.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Introductory Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics
description: First law and second law of thermodynamics. Thermodynamic properties of single component systems. Analysis of power and refrigeration cycles.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics
description: Mass, energy, and entropy balance analysis of chemical engineering systems; evaluation of thermodynamic property changes of pure materials; solution thermodynamics of single-phase multicomponent systems; phase and chemical reaction equilibrium.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical Engineering Fluid Mechanics
description: Fluid statics and dynamics with emphasis on chemical engineering applications.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ECHE
name: Heat-Flow Analysis
description: Theory of heat transmission; mechanism, generation, distribution, and measurement; use of theory in practical equipment design.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Mass Transfer
description: Molecular diffusion in fluids; diffusion in laminar and turbulent flow; momentum, transport analogies; interfacial mass transfer; design applications including humidification and absorption.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Introduction to Materials
description: Overview of the fundamental chemical aspects of materials; role of materials in applications in modern society by case studies of advances in new materials and processes.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Special Topics in Chemical Engineering
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated as topic varies.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical Engineering Kinetics
description: Concepts of chemical kinetics, batch and flow reactors, catalysts and reactor design.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ECHE
name: Separation Process Design
description: Design of stagewise chemical separation cascades; analysis of binary and ternary systems; multicomponent separations, plate and column specification procedures; distillation, crystallization, extraction, and leaching.   FS: 12/07/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Adsorption Fundamentals and Processes
description: Basic principles of adsorption and adsorption processes including adsorbents, thermodynamics, kinetics, fixed bed adsorption and cyclic adsorption processes.   FS: 11/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Computational Methods for Engineering Applications
description: Introduction to advanced computational tools for the analysis of chemical engineering systems. Initial and boundary value problems related to heat and mass transfer, reaction engineering, and parameter estimation.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical Engineering Laboratory I
description: Review of technical-report writing and presentation techniques; topics in heat transfer, fluid mechanics, and thermodynamics; verification of theoretical results and determination of design parameters.  One lecture and six laboratory hours.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical Engineering Laboratory II
description: Continuation of ECHE 460; topics in mass transfer, kinetics, and process control.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical-Process Analysis and Design I
description: Economics of chemical engineering projects related to typical corporate goals and objectives; process-flowsheet development techniques; review of shortcut design techniques; selection of profitability criteria.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical-Process Analysis and Design II
description: Continuation of ECHE 465; computer-aided design of chemical processes; written and oral presentation of a comprehensive design project.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ECHE
name: Thesis Preparation
description: Completion of the thesis requirements for the departmental undergraduate research track. A maximum of three credits may be applied toward a degree.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Topics in Chemical Engineering
description: Reading and research on selected topics in chemical engineering. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated two times as topics vary. Pass-Fail grading.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Special Problems
description: Individual investigation or studies of special topics. A maximum of six credits may be applied toward a degree. Advance approval of project proposal by advisor and instructor.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical Engineering Fluid Mechanics
description: Multi-phase pressure drop, phase contacting, flow through porous media, fluidization, mixing, and turbulence.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ECHE
name: Computational Fluid Dynamics for Engineering Applications
description: Introduction to the use of computational fluid dynamics codes to analyze flow, heat, and mass transfer problems of practical engineering applications.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ECHE
name: Intermediate Chemical Engineering Kinetics
description: Intermediate concepts of chemical kinetics, batch and flow reactors, catalysts and reactor design, including non-ideal systems.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Intermediate Separation Process Design
description: Intermediate level design of stagewise chemical separation cascades; analysis of binary and ternary systems; multicomponent separations, plate and column specification procedures; distillation, crystallization, extraction, and leaching.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical-Process Dynamics and Control
description: Fundamental physical and chemical principles in mathematically modeling the dynamic response of chemical processes; feedforward and feedback control systems; design of control schemes for selected chemical processes.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Process Safety, Health and Loss Prevention
description: Reliability, availability, and fault-tree analyses, risk indices, hazard evaluation, vapor cloud modeling, toxicology, material safety classification and regulations, individual/corporate ethical responsibilities.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: ECHE
name: Corrosion Engineering
description: Basic principles of corrosion engineering developed from a chemical engineering approach to thermodynamics, kinetics, mass transfer, and potential theory.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ECHE
name: Polymer Processing
description: Industrial polymers with emphasis on their characterization and on the modeling of the major polymer fabrication processes.      CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Next Energy
description: An examination of energy technologies that will enable society to move from an economy based on fossil fuels to one based on sustainable energy.

subject: ECHE
name: Combustion
description: Fundamental process and applications related to the broad field of combustion and energy generation including emissions control technologies.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ECHE
name: Engineering of Soft Materials
description: Introductory overview of fundamental concepts in science and engineering of soft materials; the relation between microstructure and macroscopic behavior in a variety of soft matter systems; key applications in chemical and biomedical engineering.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ECHE
name: Special Advanced Topics in Chemical Engineering
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated as topic varies.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Chemical Process Analysis
description: Quantitative analysis of industrial chemical operations. Equilibrium relations, material and energy balances, and reaction kinetics principles are used to analyze a variety of chemical processes and systems.

subject: ECHE
name: Advanced Mass Transfer
description: Diffusive and convective mass transfer. Applications of the Stefan-Maxwell equations, prediction of diffusion coefficients, convective mass transport, correlations for mass transfer coefficients, and combined mass transfer and reaction modeling.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECHE
name: Heterogeneous Catalysis – Synthesis, Characterization and Evaluation
description: Catalyst synthesis methods; experimental characterization approaches; correlating synthesis/characterization with catalytic performance.   GC: 11/22/2021.

subject: ECHE
name: Industrial Catalysis
description: History of catalysis; industrial applications of catalysis; development of catalytic reactions from lab to pilot to production scale.   GC: 11/22/2021.

subject: ECHE
name: Research
description: Individual research to be arranged with instructor.

subject: ECIV
name: Introduction to Civil Engineering
description: Fundamental concepts in each of the disciplines of civil engineering are discussed. Critical thinking skills are formally fostered by hands-on experiences and group discussions.   FS: 11/5/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Introduction to Engineering Graphics and Visualization
description: Principles and practice of visualization and graphical representation using modern computer-aided design tools.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Statics
description: Fundamentals of engineering mechanics. Equilibrium of particles and rigid bodies. Free-body diagrams, analysis trusses and frames. Distributed forces, centroids, centers of gravity, and friction.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Computational Methods for Civil Engineering
description: The use of computational tools and techniques for solving civil and environmental engineering problems. Overview of numerical methods including roots of equations, systems of linear equations, interpolation, and integration. Analysis of civil and environmental systems.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Dynamics
description: Kinematics of particles and rigid bodies. Vector representation of force and motion. Free-body diagrams, application of energy and momentum methods to solve problems. Rigid body and central force motion.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Mechanics of Solids
description: Concepts of stress and strain; stress analysis of basic structural members. Vectors, free bodies, equilibrium and elastic behavior. Combined stress, Mohr’s circle. Beams, columns, torsion, and rotation.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Civil Engineering Measurements
description: Theory and application of plane surveying and mapping techniques. Lecture plus laboratory.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Civil Engineering Materials
description: Mechanical and thermal properties of mineral aggregates, cements, concrete, timber, asphalt, metals, and plastics.   FS: 12/2/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Civil Engineering Materials Laboratory
description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations to accompany ECIV 303.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ECIV
name: Professional Development for Civil Engineers
description: Regulatory permits and scheduling of construction projects.  Engineering responsibility and liabilities.  Reporting of engineering designs and analysis.  Cost estimation of engineering projects including present or future net value.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Structural Analysis I
description: Equilibrium, shear and moment diagrams, and influence lines for statically determinate trusses, beams, and frames. Energy principles and other methods for displacement calculations. Introduction to indeterminate structural analysis.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Structural Steel Design
description: Behavior and design of steel beams, columns, and tension members; strength and stability; design of connections using welded, bolted and riveted construction.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Reinforced Concrete Design
description: Behavior and design of reinforced concrete beams, columns, continuous beams and one way slabs, and footings.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Introduction to Geotechnical Engineering
description: Engineering properties of soil and rock; hydraulic conductivity, flow nets, drainage design; consolidation theory, shearing strength of soil.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Geotechnical Laboratory
description: Laboratory associated with ECIV 330. Soil mechanics experiments, exercises, and demonstrations. Three contact hours per week.   FS: 12.2.2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Introduction to Transportation Engineering
description: Transportation design, planning, and operational analysis, including roadway, airway, and railway systems; transportation elements, including traveled way, vehicle, control, terminals, and advanced technology; traffic data collection, interpretation, and analysis.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Transportation Engineering Laboratory
description: This course covers the principles of distances, elevations and angles that pertain to roadways, basic theories in engineering measurements and surveying calculations, and an introduction to mapping, for transportation engineering applications. Three contact hours per week.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Introduction to Environmental Engineering
description: Concepts of environmental engineering, including air and water pollution, solid and hazardous waste disposal, and noise pollution. Qualitative and quantitative development of engineering techniques for pollution control.   FS: 12/04/2019

subject: ECIV
name: Introduction to Environmental Engineering Laboratory
description: Physical, chemical, and biological analysis of water and wastewater. Three laboratory hours per week.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Fluid Mechanics
description: Principles of fluid statics and dynamics. Conservation of mass, momentum, and energy. Similitude and dimensional analysis, open channel flow, lift and drag forces, and introduction to turbulent flow.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Introduction to Water Resources Engineering
description: Application of fluid mechanic principles to water resources engineering problems; pipe systems, pumps, open channel flow, peak runoff, seepage, hydraulic structures.   FS:  12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Introduction to Water Resources Engineering Laboratory
description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations on flow in pipes and open channels, pumps, flow measurement, seepage, and infiltration. Three contact hours per week.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: ECIV
name: System Applications in Civil Engineering
description: Systems approach to analysis and design; application of engineering economic principles to the evaluation of design alternatives; deterministic modeling and optimization emphasizing civil engineering applications.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Structural Design
description: Design of steel structures including elastic and plastic design concepts. Design of concrete structures including continuous members and long columns.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Civil Engineering Design
description: Application of hydraulic, geotechnical, and structural principles in design; project scheduling; cost estimation; ethics; environmental and social impact; design drawings; report documents.   FS:  12/02/2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Special Topics
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by course title.  May be repeated as topic varies.  A maximum of twelve credits may be applied towards a degree.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Fundamentals of Engineering Preparation
description: Preparation for the Fundamentals of Engineering Exam. Will cover general engineering and civil engineering specific areas. Restricted to Civil Engineering Seniors. Pass/ Fail Grading.

subject: ECIV
name: Independent Study in Civil and Environmental Engineering
description: Individual investigation or studies of special topics.  A maximum of six credits may be applied toward a degree.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Life Cycle Assessment of Civil and Environmental Engineering Systems
description: The steps of conducting and interpreting an environmental life cycle assessment of engineered systems.  Fundamentals associated with conducting a life cycle assessment, including goal and scope, inventory analysis, impact assessment and interpretation.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: ECIV
name: Structural Modeling and Experimental Methods
description: Introduction of structural modeling; strain gauge instrumentation; force, displacement, acceleration, pressure, temperature measurements; concrete and steel modeling; size effects; analysis of experimental data.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Structural Analysis II
description: Advanced methods of structural analysis with emphasis on matrix methods. Development of the generalized matrix force and matrix displacement methods of static analysis, with applications to trusses and frames.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Numerical Methods in Mechanics
description: Numerical modeling of typical engineering problems. Numerical solution of linear and nonlinear, boundary and initial value problems. Introduction to optimization.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Structural Vibrations
description: Response of single- and multiple-degree of freedom structurally dynamic systems to impact, harmonic, wind, and seismic excitations.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Timber and Masonry Design
description: Basic engineering properties of timber and masonry materials, design methods and philosophies for timber and masonry structures. Particular attention is paid to current codes, specifications and analysis.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Foundation Analysis and Design
description: Subsurface investigation procedures. Theoretical and practical aspects of the design of earth retaining structures, spread footings, and pile foundations.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Design of Earth Structures
description: Geotechnical engineering problems associated with the behavior of earth masses. Soil shear strength, lateral earth pressure, design of retaining structures, slope stability, water flow through soils.    FS: 9/13/2017.

subject: ECIV
name: Geosynthetics and Geotechnical Design of Landfills
description: Principles for the design, construction, and performance of waste containment systems. Characterization of barrier materials; geosynthetics; design of liner and leachate collection systems; stability and deformation analyses of landfills.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Geotechnical Engineering in Transportation
description: Remote sensing and engineering geology. Field and laboratory testing. Design and maintenance methods for flexible and rigid pavements. Topics in tunnel design and buried conduit.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Experimental Methods in Geotechnical Engineering
description: Overview of transducers, signal conditioning and data acquisition; test control methods, data analysis and measurement errors; testing systems to measure soil strength, stiffness, and hydraulic conductivity; laboratory projects and examinations.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Transportation Systems Planning
description: Fundamental interactions between supply and demand in transportation systems. Modeling transportation demand and trip-making behavior. Evaluation of alternatives for decision making.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Highway Design
description: Design of transportation facilities using relevant tools and guidelines with emphasis on physical and operational aspects of arterials, freeways, intersections, and interchanges, including geometry, capacity, control, and safety.   FS:  12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Traffic Engineering
description: Capacity analysis of freeways and arterials. Traffic flow characteristics and basic relationships among traffic flow parameters. Signalized and unsignalized intersection control and signal timing design.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Traffic Safety Analysis
description: Research concepts and methodologies to enable students to identify the underlying reasons and factors that contribute to traffic crashes and determine appropriate countermeasures.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Elements of Water and Wastewater Treatment
description: Unit operations and processes employed in the physical, chemical, and biological treatment of water and wastewater. Design of water and wastewater treatment systems.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Principles of Municipal Solid Waste Engineering
description: Fundamentals and engineering principles of solid waste generation, characterization, collection and transport, source reduction and recycling, and physical, chemical, and biological treatment strategies.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Air Pollution Control Engineering
description: Introduction to the sources of air pollution and the engineering principles used for control and prevention.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Sustainable Construction for Engineers
description: Instruction to sustainable engineering design alternatives and principles for construction and site development from preconstruction through design and the construction phase.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Environmental Engineering Process Modeling
description: Modeling fate and transport phenomena in environmental processes with applications in engineered unit operators and natural systems.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Open Channel Hydraulics
description: Steady and unsteady flows in single or multiple-channel systems.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Engineering Hydrology
description: Applications of hydrologic techniques to design problems; stormwater simulation models; urban stormwater.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Subsurface Hydrology
description: Hydrologic cycle, subsurface physical properties, equations of groundwater flow, well flow, well design, groundwater resource development, design of dewatering systems, groundwater contamination.    FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Land Development for Engineers
description: Fundamentals of designing and permitting the conversion of land to new or altered states, including environmental issues, traffic and parking, utility resources, site engineering, ADA, safety, planning, and zoning requirements.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Railway Engineering I
description: Introduction to the analysis and design of the railway infrastructure for freight and passenger systems to include track and track support systems, grade crossings, special trackwork, construction, inspection, assessment and compliance.   FS:  11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Operation and Logistics of Railway Systems
description: Principles of rail operations; Network management; Best practices for train planning, performance management and delivery of service; technical elements of a railway from an operations perspective (train controls, signaling, communications, yards, tractive power etc).   FS: 06/01/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Design of Railway Bridges and Structures
description: Introduction to railway infrastructure; Structural design considerations and criteria of railway structures; Bridge types and components; Planning and preliminary design of modern railway bridges; Loads and forces; Structural analysis and design of steel railway bridges and components.   FS: 6/7/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Intermediate Special Topics
description: The content of this course varies, and the topics are selected by the faculty.  The aim of this course is to expose upper-level undergraduate students and graduate students to a contemporary issue, not covered in any Civil and Environmental Engineering course.  Possible topics include intelligent infrastructure, sustainable construction, and monitoring and improvement of poor and degrading infrastructure.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: ECIV
name: Management of Engineering Projects
description: This course focuses in studying the life-cycle of a project using a systems engineering approach. Industry standards for engineering companies as well as practical considerations are studies through the semester.    CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Advanced Soil Mechanics
description: Course covers the mechanical properties of soil; analysis of the field and laboratory tests to determine soil properties required for foundation analysis and design; consolidation theory; and settlement analysis.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECIV
name: Research in Civil Engineering
description: Credits to be designated upon registration.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: The American Economy
description: Basic concepts, institutional foundations, structure of the private and public sector, labor markets; major economic problems.

subject: ECON
name: Principles of Microeconomics
description: The study of supply and demand, pricing and cost concepts, firm and consumer decision-making, market structure, and government policies.   FS: 09/10/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Principles of Macroeconomics
description: The study of gross domestic product, business cycles, economic growth, inflation, unemployment, and monetary and fiscal policy.   FS: 09/10/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Introduction to Economics
description: Introduction to economics principles for non-majors. Basics of supply and demand and government and monetary policy are covered in a non-technical manner. Not open to business or economics students. Credit not granted for both ECON 223 and ECON 221 or ECON 222.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Introduction to Economics
description: The study of supply and demand, markets, household and firm decision-making, gross domestic product, inflation, unemployment, and government policies. Open to all students except business administration and economics majors.   FS: 09/10/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Money and Banking
description: The role of money in the market economy. Commercial banks, the Federal Reserve System, and monetary policy.  Cannot be used to satisfy major requirements.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: The International Economy
description: Survey of international economic issues and institutions, including trade and protectionism, global and regional trade agreements, trade balances and exchange rates, Japan, NAFTA, and the European Union.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Issues in Economics
description: The nature and causes of major economic problems facing the nation and its communities, and policy alternatives designed to solve them. The philosophy and methodology of economics in social problem solving.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Intermediate Microeconomic Theory
description: Analysis of the economic behavior of households and firms. Production, consumption, price determination, and the degree of competition in markets.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Intermediate Macroeconomic Theory
description: Analysis of the national economy as a whole. Money, output, employment, inflation, and international economic linkages.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: American Economic History
description: Growth and development of the American economy; applications of economic theory to economic history.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Introduction to Data Science for Economists
description: An introduction to the various types and sources of data used by economists and how to interpret such data to answer economic questions and support economic theory. Includes the uses of survey data, cross-sectional, time series, and panel data.   FS: 02/01/2023.

subject: ECON
name: Business Finance
description: The procurement and management of wealth by privately owned profit-seeking enterprises.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Financial Institutions
description: A study of the functions and operations of financial institutions and their relationships to the commercial banking system and the general economy. Attention is devoted to savings institutions, insurance companies, rural and urban real estate credit, consumer credit, and associated topics.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Government Policy Toward Business
description: An analysis of public policy toward business in the United States. Emphasis is on the desirability of various policies in light of their consequences for the general welfare.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and undergraduate division head is required.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Money, Income, and Prices
description: A study of monetary standards, monetary theory, monetary policy, and the mechanism of international payments. Attention is devoted to questions of monetary problems, employment, and fiscal policy.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Labor Economics
description: A study of labor market institutions, trends in labor market activity, and the effects of government policy on the labor market. (Not open to majors in economics.)   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: History of Economic Thought
description: A survey of economics from the ancient philosophers to the present; with emphasis on the mercantilist, physiocratic, classical, Marxian, Austrian, neo-classical, and institutional schools of economics.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Economics of American Industry
description: A study of the structure of selected American industries, of the development and concentration of economic power in the American economy, and of public policy toward industry.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Business Applications of Economic Forecasting
description: Analysis of business cycles and applications of forecasting techniques to project and interpret economic trends.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Engineering Economics
description: Decision making with respect to capital goods, with emphasis on such decision making in governmental activities and public utilities. Intended primarily for engineering students, the course emphasizes the types of investment decisions that engineers are often called upon to make.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Introductory Econometrics
description: The use of statistical techniques to analyze economic relationships. The emphasis is on the application of linear regression to real-world economic data.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Foundations of Capitalism
description: Examines the foundations of capitalism and why it has prevailed over alternative systems. Topics include the justification of private property, distribution of wealth, profit motive, source of wealth creation, and others.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Internship in Economics
description: Supervised work experience of at least nine hours per week, to include one class meeting a month and individual consultation. Contract approval by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required. Cannot be used to satisfy major requirement.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Urban Economics
description: An analysis of economic forces affecting urbanization and the economic processes influencing urban form and structure. Spatial concepts are considered in addition to traditional micro-economic and macro-economic concepts. Topic coverage includes: the economic origin of cities; urban functions and the urban economic base, land-use structure and urban form, and urban efficiency.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: International Trade Economics
description: Theory of international specialization, commercial policy, customs unions, and the effects of trade liberalization and protectionism; economic growth and multinational enterprises.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: International Monetary Economics
description: Exchange rate and balance of payments determination; purchasing-power parity; optimum currency areas, absorption, elasticity, monetary approaches, spot- and forward-exchange markets.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ECON
name: International Development Economics
description: Economic theories of growth in developing countries. Use of factor resources; role of social and economic institutions; use of financial trade policies for growth.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Labor Economics and Labor Markets
description: Economics of labor demand, labor supply, wage determination in competitive markets, migration, discrimination, unemployment, and labor unions. Theoretical models and empirical knowledge will be considered.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Comparative Economic Systems
description: An analysis of the organization and operation of the world’s major economic systems.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Law and Economics
description: Economic analysis and interpretation of the law. The economic effect of current law and optimal design of law to meet social objectives.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Economics of Sustainable Development
description: Exploration of the basic theory and practice of sustainable economic development. Topics include: environmental legislation, global agreements, sustainable development indicators, and economic strategies and methods to promote environmentally sound development.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Experimental Economics
description: Exploration of the basic theory and techniques of experimental economics. Topics include: basic game theory, experimental design, and elements of behavioral economic thought.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Senior Seminar in Economics
description: Philosophy and methodology of economics, perspectives on theory and empiricism, economic policy; individualized guided research.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: The Economics of Terrorism
description: Focuses on the following aspects of terrorism: (1) its causes/determinants (historical, social, cultural, economic, political, and religious determinants); (2) the organizational and funding structure of terrorist groups; (3) the tactics and weapons of terrorist groups; (4) mobilization and recruitment within terror networks; and (5) counterterrorism methods.  Restricted to:  Business Majors and Economics Arts and Sciences Majors.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Industrial Organization
description: This course uses the tools of microeconomics and game theory to examine how firms compete and competition’s impact on industry performance. Topics include: price discrimination, product differentiation, and oligopoly behavior.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Political Economy
description: This course covers fundamental models of collective decision making, studies their empirical relevance, and considers interactions between the economy and politics.    FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: ECON
name: Economic Scholars I
description: This seminar course is designed to introduce students who have been accepted into the Econ Scholars program to economics research and real-world problem solving.   FS: 03/01/2023.

subject: ECON
name: Economic Scholars II
description: This seminar course continues the work from Econ Scholars I and is reserved for students who have been accepted into the Econ Scholars program. Students will be placed in teams and partnered with local businesses, government agencies, or economics faculty members to work on real-world projects and academic research.   FS: 03/01/2023.

subject: ECON
name: Introduction to Mathematical Economics
description: Mathematical formulation of economic theories; the use of mathematics in the development and demonstration of economic relationships.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Essentials of Economics
description: A course designed to acquaint the student with the principles of operation of the American economic system. A survey course for social studies teachers in secondary schools.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Managerial Economics
description: A study of the application of the economic theory of profits, competition, demand, and costs to analysis of problems arising in the firm and in decision making. Price policies, forecasting, and investment decisions are among the topics considered.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: The Economics of Education
description: Investment in human capital; the economic value of schooling; internal efficiency of schools; faculty compensation; equity and efficiency of school finance systems; financing higher education.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Health Economics
description: Applications of economic analysis to health care. Structure and behavior of health-care markets. Description of health care policy issues.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ECON
name: Environmental Economics
description: An analysis of the economics aspects of environmental decay, pollution control, and natural resource use. Analysis of the ability of the market system to allocate resources efficiently when economic activity is accompanied by environmental damage. Discussion of alternative public policy approaches to pollution control and natural resource conservation.   FS: 11/04/2015.

subject: ECON
name: Game Theory in Economics
description: Game theory as used to understand decision making in business, economics, politics and other real-world environments.  Topics covered include: basic terminology; strategic, extensive, and combinatorial models; and equilibrium strategy.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Public Finance
description: Theory and practice of taxation: public revenue, expenditure, and debt.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Topics in Economics
description: Individual topics to be announced with title.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Introduction to Econometrics
description: Statistical and economic tools applied to analysis of business and economic problems with the aid of computers.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
