name: Survey of Contemporary Economic Theory
description: Neo-classical value and distribution theory combined with income and employment theory.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Quantitative Foundations for Business and Economics I
description: Calculus and classical optimization methods applied to problems in business and economic analysis; matrices, derivatives, and integrals in the analysis of both univariate and multivariate business and economic models.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Quantitative Foundations for Business and Economics II
description: Statistics and probability theory applied to problems of business and economic analysis.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Quantitative Methods I
description: Probability and statistics necessary for graduate study in economics and business administration; estimation, hypothesis testing, regression, analysis of variance, and nonparametric methods.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Quantitative Methods II
description: A study of decision models useful in business administration. Topics covered include linear programming, sensitivity analysis and duality, network models, integer programming, determinate and stochastic dynamic programming, inventory, and queues.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Applied Macroeconomics
description: The modern theory of income determination. Inflation, unemployment, and interest rates in an open economy setting. Emphasis on economic policy.   CL: 2020.

subject: ECON
name: Public Finance II
description: An analysis of budgets and budget policy; tax incidence and effects; debt and debt management.

subject: EDCE
name: Career Planning and Development
description: Introduction to the career planning and development process through an understanding of one’s own career journey.  Overview of how counselors assist individuals in the career decision process.    FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: EDCE
name: Counseling Through a Multicultural Lens: Understanding Self and Others
description: Introduction to counseling aspects and counseling skills that focus on the understanding of self and others from a multicultural perspective.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: EDCE
name: Interpersonal Communication Skills
description: Introduction to effective interpersonal communication skills.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: EDCE
name: Introduction to the Counseling Profession
description: Overview of and introduction to areas of the counseling profession.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: EDCE
name: Family Counseling
description: A comparative study of the major theories in the field of family counseling.

subject: EDCE
name: Educators in Industry
description: The course is designed to provide counselors, teachers, and administrators with increased awareness of a wide variety of work experiences.

subject: EDCE
name: Introduction to Counseling
description: Orientation to the profession of counseling including its historical, social, and cultural foundations.  Declaration of the minor in counseling or admission to the Ed.S. in Counselor Education.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDCE
name: Wellness and Mental Health
description: An overview of the characteristics of optimal holistic wellness and human functioning. Practical application of theoretically and empirically supported wellness models and interventions to enhance social, emotional, mental, physical, and spiritual well-being.    FS: 03/06/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDCE
name: Theory and Practice of College Mentoring
description: Emphasis on current professional approaches to college mentoring and development of leadership and mentoring skills. Students must participate in Minority Assistance Program.  Upper division undergraduate standing or admission to a graduate program and consent of instructors.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDCE
name: Seminar in Counseling
description: A seminar focusing on current professional issues in counseling.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: EDCE
name: Communication Skills in Counseling
description: Human relations principles applied to the counseling interview.

subject: EDCE
name: Counseling Student Athletes
description: Issues facing student athletes regarding their personal and career development beyond athletics.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: Inquiry into Early Childhood Education
description: Inquiry into the roles, programs, history, and culture trends in early childhood education.

subject: EDEC
name: Play and Early Learning
description: Theory and practice related to children’s play and early learning in family, community, and educational settings.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: African and African Diaspora Literacies in the Early Childhood Classroom
description: Pedagogical methods for introducing young children in prekindergarten-to-third grade classrooms to perspectives on African and African Diaspora literacies (Peoples, histories, and contributions to the world’s knowledge).   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: EDEC
name: Culturally Relevant Pedagogy in Early Childhood Classrooms
description: A study of the theoretical and practical foundations of effective teaching in diverse classroom environments. Ethnicity, gender, social class, religion and other issues are considered from multiple perspectives.

subject: EDEC
name: The Young Child: Development, Care and Education (Birth to 3 years)
description: Infants’ and toddlers’ development and care from an ecological perspective. Assessment of children in various settings is emphasized.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: The Young Child: Development, Care and Education (Birth to 3 years) Practicum
description: Practicum in infants’ and toddlers’ development and care observed and assessed from an ecological perspective. Includes service learning.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: The Young Child: Development, Care and Education (3-8 years)
description: Study and practicum in culturally relevant child development, ages 3-8, and applying this knowledge as foundational in early childhood assessment and practice.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: The Young Child: Development, Care and Education (3-8 years) Practicum
description: Practicum in development, assessment, and education of young children with an emphasis on mathematics, science, and social studies.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: Supporting Linguistic Pluralism Across Content Areas
description: Introduction to issues, ideas, practices and policies in support of learning and teaching in multilingual classrooms, pre-K to grade 12 for undergraduate early childhood education majors. Early Childhood Majors Only.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: Teaching Reading in Early Childhood Education I
description: Theory and practice in the teaching of reading for children from birth through age eight for undergraduate majors in early childhood.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: Community of Learners and Classroom Management in Early Childhood
description: Methods of building a community of learners including child guidance and group management that foster the development of self-control and learning.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: Parent/Family Dynamics in Early Childhood Education
description: Principles, practices, and content of family dynamics, including practicum/service learning.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: Teaching Mathematics in Early Childhood
description: Methods and materials in teaching and assessment in early childhood mathematics (prekindergarten-grade 3).   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: Teaching Science in Early Childhood Education
description: The study and practice of science education for pre-school and primary students focusing on appropriate content, goals and methods.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: Internship in Integrated Curriculum in Early Childhood Education
description: Internship in developmentally and culturally appropriate content and pedagogy in language and literacy, mathematics, science, social studies, and fine arts for young children through grade 3.  Admission to internship in early childhood education.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: Teaching Social Studies to Early Childhood Education
description: The study and practice of Social Studies education for undergraduate majors in early childhood education. Early Childhood Majors Only.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: Teaching Writing in Early Childhood Education
description: Theory and practice in the teaching of writing for children from birth through age eight. For undergraduate majors in early childhood education including literacy practicum.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: Seminar on Teaching in Early Childhood
description: Exploration of the principles and theories about teaching and learning as they apply to early childhood education in the context of schools in democratic societies.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EDEC
name: Internship in Curriculum, Assessment, Teaching, and Professional Roles
description: Internship for practice in classrooms appropriate to the level of certification sought (early childhood) related to professional roles.  Admission to the Professional Program in Early Childhood Education.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: Parent/Family Dynamics in Early Childhood Education
description: Principles, practices, and content of family dynamics, including practicum/service learning.

subject: EDEC
name: The Young Child: Behavior and Development in Early Childhood
description: Service-learning and seminar experiences addressing intellectual, physical, social, and emotional development, prenatal through grade three, within an ecological context. Child’s critical thinking, creative expression, and diagnosis/assessment emphasized.

subject: EDEC
name: Education of Young Children: An Ecological Approach
description: An ecological study with emphasis on home-school relations, parent involvement, and community resources. Multicultural perspectives and needs of exceptional children addressed.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: Field Problems: Teaching Mathematics Using Manipulative Materials, Grades K-3
description: Instructional approaches and materials for teaching elementary school mathematics, grades K-3.

subject: EDEC
name: Internship in Environments for Teaching and Learning
description: Internship for practice in classrooms appropriate to early childhood education related to curriculum design and assessment.  Admission to the professional program in early childhood education.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: Seminar on Teaching in Early Childhood
description: Exploration of the principles and theories about teaching and learning as they apply to early childhood education in the context of schools in democratic societies.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEC
name: Parent Involvement in Early Childhood Education
description: Analysis of programs and practices for involving parents in early childhood educational settings. Emphasizes objectives, methods, techniques, and materials for program development. Community resources for supporting programs for children in various instructional settings.

subject: EDEL
name: Nature and Management of Elementary Classrooms
description: The learning environment to include diversity of students, instructional materials, classroom management, and communication patterns.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Culturally Sustaining Pedagogy for the Elementary Classrooms
description: Theoretical and pedagogical approaches to Culturally Sustaining Pedagogy (CSP)—curriculum design tools and instructional strategies that reflect the diversity of students’ cultural  backgrounds and languages in elementary classrooms.

subject: EDEL
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Practicum in Elementary Education
description: Sequence of supervised field experiences in an assigned school setting.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Elementary Mathematics Instruction
description: Approaches, materials, and methods for teaching mathematics in elementary grades.  Restricted to students in the BA program in elementary education.   FS: 03/02/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Introductory Elementary Internship
description: Field experience requiring students to gradually assume the responsibilities of teaching in an assigned classroom under the guidance of an experienced teacher.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Elementary Science Instruction
description: Instructional approaches and methods for teaching science in elementary grades.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Elementary Social Studies Instruction
description: Instructional approaches, materials, and methods for teaching social studies in elementary grades. Restricted to students in the B.A. program in Elementary Education.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Directed Teaching in the Elementary and or Middle Schools
description: Teaching and related experiences, including seminars and workshops. Admission to professional teacher certification program and completion of the elementary education core.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Internship in Environments, Planning, and Motivation for Teaching and Learning
description: Internship for practice in classrooms appropriate to elementary education related to curriculum design and assessment. Field experiences emphasize planning lessons that actively engage students in learning.      FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Internship in Elementary Education
description: Internship for practice in elementary classrooms (grades 2-6) related to curriculum design, assessment, interactive teaching, and professional roles.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Internship in Curriculum and Assessment
description: Internship for practice in elementary classrooms (grades 2-6) related to curriculum design and assessment.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Internship in Teaching
description: Internship for practice in elementary classrooms (grades 2-6) related to interactive teaching.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Internship in Professional Roles
description: Internship for practice in elementary classrooms (grade 2-6) related to professional roles.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Seminar on Teaching
description: Exploration of the principles and theories about teaching and learning as they apply to the field of practice in the context of schools in democratic societies.   FS: 03/02/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Inquiry Practicum: The Elementary School
description: Identifying and understanding the various components of the elementary environment through the practice of inquiry through field-based experiences.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Integrated Curriculum in Elementary Schools
description: Examining and practicing a variety of approaches that connect the content of different elementary school subjects.

subject: EDEL
name: Inquiry Practicum: Roles of Elementary Teachers
description: Identifying and understanding the roles of elementary teachers through the practice of inquiry through field-based experiences.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Teaching Second Languages to Young Children
description: To assist prospective teachers of young children in the development of a second language and multicultural learning activities. Practicum sessions are an integral part.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Science in the Elementary School
description: Reinforces the science background of prospective and practicing elementary teachers. Innovations are examined. Emphasis is placed on methods, materials, community resources, and evaluation procedures.

subject: EDEL
name: Modern Approaches to Mathematics Teaching
description: Curriculum and pedagogy for mathematics topics taught in grades 3 through 8.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Field Problems: Teaching Mathematics Using Manipulative Materials, Grades 4-6
description: Instructional approaches and materials for teaching elementary school mathematics, grades 4-6. This course cannot be applied to a graduate degree in the elementary education program.

subject: EDEL
name: Social Studies in the Elementary/ Middle School
description: Fundamentals of social studies education in the elementary/middle school.

subject: EDEL
name: Internship in Environments for Teaching and Learning
description: Internship for practice in classrooms appropriate to elementary education related to curriculum design and assessment.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Internship in Planning and Motivation
description: Field experience that emphasizes planning lessons that actively engage students in learning.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEL
name: Teaching Mathematics to Young Children
description: Analysis of a developmental approach to teaching children under the age of 9.

subject: EDEL
name: Diagnostic Teaching of Arithmetic
description: Analysis of the concepts and skills of arithmetic in the school mathematics curriculum; exploration of diagnostic-prescriptive teaching methods.

subject: EDEL
name: Language Arts in the Elementary and Middle School
description: Examine the content, goals, and methods of teaching language arts in elementary and middle school.

subject: EDET
name: Introduction to Design Thinking and Computer Science Education
description: A survey of design thinking and computer science education topics and skills. Students will (a) use design thinking to solve problems and develop products and (b) explore a variety of technologies and their applications in the workplace, with hobbies, and within PK-12 schools.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EDET
name: Design and Development Tools I
description: Study of multimedia elements (e.g., graphics, animation, audio, and video) including the creation and editing of materials. Instructional applications, copyright issues, and technology limitations will be explored.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDET
name: Internship in Educational Technology
description: Supervised field-based experiences in the design, development, evaluation, and implementation of technology-based instructional and training projects.   GC: 11/27/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDET
name: Design and Evaluation of Games and Simulations
description: Application of instructional design criteria to computer and noncomputer interactions. Analyses include requisite cognitive processes, affective outcomes, and ethical standards. Design and formative testing of interactive exercises.

subject: EDEX
name: Understanding the Foundations of Disability
description: The role of historical events, politics, media, race, gender, and other issues in shaping how disability is viewed. A critical framework for understanding how disability is viewed in Western culture and the effects of those views on individuals with disabilities.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Students with Autism
description: Introduction to autism including definition, characteristics, causes, and evidence-based practices.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Applied Behavior Analysis in Special Education
description: Introduction to the principles of behavior and their application to improving educational and behavioral outcomes of students with disabilities.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Functional Behavioral Assessment and Behavior Interventions
description: Introduction to procedures used in school settings for reducing challenging behaviors through conducting a functional behavioral assessment and writing and implementing a behavior intervention plan.    FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Assessment in Special Education
description: Introduction to concepts and methods of assessment in special education with emphasis on administering, scoring, and analysis of standardized educational tests.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: EDEX
name: Collaborative Partnerships in Special Education
description: Knowledge and skills critical to special education practitioners in fostering healthy and productive relationships with fellow professionals, students, and families.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: EDEX
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: EDEX
name: Internship I in Special Education
description: Experience in the observation and teaching of Pk – 12 students with exceptionalities across settings appropriate to special education teaching certification.  Admission to Internship I in Special Education required.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: EDEX
name: Seminar in Special Education
description: Synthesis of the knowledge and skills acquired through course work and field experiences during special education teacher preparation.  Admission to Internship II in Special Education required.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Inclusion of Students with Mild Disabilities
description: Inclusion strategies and accommodation planning for students with mild disabilities in general education classrooms.

subject: EDEX
name: Internship II in Special Education
description: Application of effective teaching techniques and organization of instructional settings for exceptional learners in special education.  Admission to Internship II Special Education required.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Exceptional Children
description: Overview of the field of education for exceptional children. Basic course for those entering the field of special education.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: The Nature of Orthopedic and Special Health Problems
description: Symptomatology, behavioral manifestations, and resources for care and treatment of orthopedic conditions and other types of health problems in children and youth.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Early Childhood Special Education
description: An overview of early childhood special education for young children with disabilities and their families.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Nature of Students with Specific Learning Disabilities
description: Children with average/above average intelligence and specific learning impairments; diagnostic and remedial techniques. Offered by both the College of Education and the Department of Psychology.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Nature and Needs of the Gifted and Talented
description: Types and characteristics of the gifted and talented.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Direct Instruction in Reading for At-Risk Learners
description: A study of the skills and knowledge required to implement direct instruction procedures when teaching reading, with opportunity for application of skills. Research and theoretical foundations will also be evaluated.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Teaching Reading in the Content Area to Adolescents with Reading Disabilities
description: Research, theory, and instructional practices related to providing reading instruction in content areas for youth with disabilities, with a focus on developing disciplinary literacy in inclusive settings.    FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Teaching Mathematics to Students at Risk
description: Research, theory, and instructional practices related to mathematical readiness and instruction for children and youth at risk for mathematical difficulties.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Instruction of Students with Severe and Multiple Disabilities

subject: EDEX
name: Curriculum and Language Instruction for Students with Severe and Multiple Disabilities
description: Design, development, adaptation, and implementation of curriculum, language and communication instruction for students with significant disabilities.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Instruction of Students with Specific Learning Disabilities
description: Theory and application of current evidence-based procedures for teaching children with specific learning disabilities.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Nature of Students with Intellectual Disabilities
description: Nature and causes of intellectual disabilities, behavior, and potentialities of persons with intellectual disabilities.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Educational Procedures for Early Childhood Special Education
description: An initial course in educational procedures focusing on intervention strategies for serving young children with disabilities in inclusive environments.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Nature of Students with Emotional and Behavior Disabilities
description: Characteristics, etiology, and major theoretical models for children experiencing emotional and/or behavioral problems in school; special education curriculum, programming alternatives, assessment, and issues concerning this population.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Managing Problem Behavior in the Classroom
description: The development of a workable approach to classroom management through an examination of a research-based synthesis of current knowledge in classroom and behavior management.

subject: EDEX
name: Social/Emotional Development and Guidance for Young Children with Developmental Delays
description: DEC Practices in Early Childhood Special Education, Assessing and Monitoring Children's Challenging Behavior, and Preventive Strategies for Challenging Behavior.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Advanced Procedures for Assessment in Early Childhood Special Education (ECSE)
description: Advanced assessment methods for serving young children with and without developmental delays and their families.    FS: 04/03/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Nature of Students with Multi-categorical Disabilities
description: Personal, social, and educational implications of a mild to moderate multi-categorical disability (emotional/behavioral, intellectual, and learning disabilities) throughout the lifespan of an individual.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Instruction of Students with Multi-categorical Disabilities
description: Theory and application of current evidence-based procedures for teaching children with mild to moderate multi-categorical disabilities.    FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Braille
description: Basic course for mastery of the literary braille code. Transcription of instructional materials in literary braille.

subject: EDEX
name: Nature of Students with Visual Disabilities
description: The psychological, social, and educational implications for persons with visual disabilities; definitions, incidence, characteristics of, and rehabilitative and educational programs for persons with visual disabilities.

subject: EDEX
name: Introduction to Deafness
description: Educational implications of philosophy, theory, and research about deafness.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Communication Systems for Students who are Deaf or Hearing Impaired
description: Knowledge and basic skills of finger-spelling and sign forms for communication.

subject: EDEX
name: Collaborative Partnerships in PK-12 Special Education
description: Communication and collaboration skills and strategies for creating and maintaining effective partnerships with a variety of stakeholders involved in educating students with disabilities in PK-12 settings.   FS: 04/15/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDEX
name: Partnerships in Early Childhood Special Education
description: Strategies for collaborating and communicating with families and other professionals as members of multidisciplinary teams in Early Intervention and Early childhood Special Education.

subject: EDEX
name: Educational Procedures for the Gifted and Talented
description: Emphasis on methodologies and materials involved in the teaching of gifted and talented children and youth.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDFI
name: Schools in Communities
description: Social, political, and historical aspects of diverse educational institutions in American culture with an emphasis on families, schools, and communities.  Sophomore standing.   FS: 02/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDFI
name: Dynamics of American Public Education
description: Extensive treatment of the social, political, economic, and philosophical influences that have shaped public education. Analysis of the financial, organizational, and legal aspects of education. Library assignments provide a working knowledge of professional standard references and journals.   Junior or higher standing.   FS: 02/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDFI
name: Antiracist Education
description: Basic concepts, issues, and practices of antiracist education. Topics include individual and institutional racism, overt and covert racism, curriculum, textbooks, power relationships, teacher-student relationships, and privacy.    FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDFI
name: Sociology of Education
description: Analysis of educational institutions, organizations, processes, and their effects in contemporary society.   FS: 11/07/2018.

subject: EDFI
name: Comparative and International Education
description: Understanding of schooling in a global society. An introduction to comparative and international education and its major theories practices and research methodologies with an examination of educational issues, levels and system in a variety of cultural contexts and countries.   FS: 12/04/2019.

subject: EDFI
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.   FS: 02/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDFI
name: Historical Foundations of American Educational Thought
description: A survey of the history, philosophy, administration, and legal bases of American education.   GC: 12/09/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDFI
name: Southern Educational History
description: Development of educational institutions in Southern society with special attention given to South Carolina.   GC: 12/09/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDHE
name: Special Problems in Higher Education and Student Affairs
description: The course is designed to provide opportunities for the study of special topics in higher education and student affairs administration.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDLP
name: Law and Policy Studies in Education
description: Policy issues affecting public and private educational institutions across the PK-20 continuum (pre-school through higher education).   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: EDLP
name: Law and Policy Studies in Education
description: Policy issues affecting public and private educational institutions across the PK-20 continuum (pre-school through higher education).   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDLP

subject: EDLP

description: An introduction to educational technology, its increasing importance in the total school program, and its relationship to learning theories and communication.

subject: EDLP

description: Use of theory and research to understand and improve classroom teaching. Emphasis on teacher reflection and decision-making. The administrative role in enhancing effectiveness is highlighted.

subject: EDML

subject: EDML
name: Foundations in Reading
description: Reading foundations, curriculum, and assessments for teaching young adolescents across academic disciplines.   FS: 06/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDML

subject: EDML
name: Internship A in the Middle School
description: Application of effective teaching techniques and organization of instructional settings for middle school students.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: EDML
name: Internship B in the Middle School
description: Application of effective teaching techniques and organization of instructional settings for middle school students.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: EDML
name: Methods and Materials for Teaching Science in the Middle Grades
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction appropriate to science teaching in the middle school.

subject: EDML
name: Methods and Materials for Teaching Social Studies in the Middle School
description: A study of goals, content, methods, and materials of instruction in middle school social studies.

subject: EDML
name: Middle Level Literacy Assessment
description: Introduces literacy assessment for individual and small groups or middle level students.

subject: EDML
name: Methods and Materials for Teaching English/Language Arts in the Middle Grades
description: Introduces goals, content, and methods of teaching language arts at the middle level.

subject: EDML
name: Methods and Materials for Teaching Mathematics in the Middle Grades
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction appropriate to mathematics teaching in the middle school.

subject: EDML
name: Middle School Internship Seminar
description: Inquiry into the issues that arise during internship B experiences including classroom management, adolescent development, legal/professional responsibilities, multicultural perspectives, and needs of exceptional children.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDML
name: Internship A in the Middle School
description: Application of effective teaching techniques and organization of instructional settings for middle school students.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDML
name: Internship B in the Middle School
description: Application of effective teaching techniques and organization of instructional settings for middle school students.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDPY
name: Introduction to Child Growth and Development
description: Basic course designed to familiarize the prospective teacher with the patterns of social, emotional, physical, and intellectual growth of the individual. Development of these growth patterns from the prenatal stage to the onset of adolescence.

subject: EDPY
name: Introduction to Adolescent Growth and Development
description: Basic course designed to familiarize the prospective junior and senior high school teacher with the pattern of social, emotional, physical, and intellectual growth of the individual during his adolescent years. Recommendation of the advisor(s) required.

subject: EDPY
name: Introduction to Educational Psychology
description: Applications of the psychology of learning and development. Special attention to basic statistics and the behavior of the school child.

subject: EDPY
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: EDPY
name: Learners and the Diversity of Learning
description: Overview of psychological theories and research as it applies to education, including theories of learning, child and adolescent development, cognitive processes, classroom practices, individual differences/student diversity, and motivation.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDPY
name: Practicum: Learners and the Diversity of Learning
description: Field experience integrated with course on lifespan development and learning with an emphasis on individual and group diversity.

subject: EDPY
name: Free-Choice Learning and Informal Learning Environments
description: Examines free-choice (or informal) learning and the characteristics of settings and activities outside of formal schooling that effectively promote learning and development.

subject: EDPY
name: Human Growth and Development
description: Overview of the contributions of the biological and social sciences to an understanding of the mental, emotional, social, and physical development from infancy through adulthood. Study of behavior problems.

subject: EDRD
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: EDRD

description: Examination and implementation of the key concepts, content, goals, and strategies in teaching reading and the language arts in the elementary school. Students will work with elementary children in a school setting to learn literacy concepts and instructional strategies.   Admission to the B.A. program in elementary education, children’s literature course. Designated for undergraduate students seeking initial certification.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDRD
name: Reading Assessment
description: Seminar and supervised one-on-one field experience focused on reading assessment of and instruction for individual children and groups of children.   Restricted to: Undergraduate students pursuing teacher certification.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDRD
name: Content Area Literacy PK-12
description: A survey of research and practice which facilitates students' literacy skills in the content areas.  For K-12 content area teachers of art, dance, physical education, foreign language, music and theatre.   FS: 06/05/2019.

subject: EDRD
name: Teaching Reading to Adults I
description: Diagnostic and prescriptive modes of teaching reading to adults, based on the physical, psychological, intellectual, and social characteristics of the adult learner.

subject: EDRD
name: Teaching Reading to Adults II
description: Preparation of materials for teaching basic reading skills to adults and practicum experiences in teaching adults to read.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDRD
name: Teaching of Reading in the Elementary School
description: Study of the various phases of reading in their relation to a modern program of education and the place of reading in the curriculum. Emphasis on modern practices in the classroom teaching of reading.

subject: EDRD
name: Reading in the Secondary School
description: The place of reading instruction in high schools, the programming of special services in reading instruction, methods of teaching basic and developmental reading skills, and case studies of programs. Demonstrations of tests and devices.

subject: EDRD
name: Foundations of Reading Instruction
description: An overview of reading and its curriculum implications: grades K-12 and adults. Emphasis is placed on current trends and issues and related methodologies.

subject: EDRD
name: Teaching  Reading Through A Literature Emphasis
description: Integrating appropriate literature into traditional and alternative reading programs. Identifying appropriate literature for classroom use and recreational reading. Use of literature as a means of developing and reinforcing reading skills.

subject: EDRD
name: Introduction to Teaching Media Literacy
description: A survey of analysis of electronic and non-print media themes and messages aimed at youth, with special emphasis on design and implementation of curricula for enhancing children’s media literacy.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDRD
name: Assessment and the Foundations of Reading/Writing

subject: EDRD
name: Teaching Reading and Writing in the Content Areas
description: Survey of the strategies and materials which facilitate students’ reading and writing skill in the content areas.   GC: 12/14/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDRM

description: Development of assessments for different content areas and grade levels, and processes for making decisions based on assessment results.

subject: EDRM
name: Introduction to Testing and Evaluation
description: The construction and use of teacher-made tests; descriptive statistics, measurement error, norms, and interpretation of scores; types of standardized instruments for use in elementary and secondary schools.

subject: EDSE
name: Introduction to Careers in Education
description: An individualized survey of careers in education, utilizing practica, seminars, and input from various disciplines to focus on personal and professional development. Pass-fail credit.

subject: EDSE
name: Practicum in Education
description: A sequence of supervised practica in various educational settings. Seminars and group discussions included.

subject: EDSE
name: Practicum in Education
description: A sequence of supervised practica in various educational settings. Seminars and group discussions included.

subject: EDSE
name: Practicum in Education
description: A sequence of supervised practica in various educational settings. Seminars and group discussions included.

subject: EDSE
name: Practicum in Education
description: A sequence of supervised practica in various educational settings. Seminars and group discussions included.

subject: EDSE
name: Practicum in Education
description: A sequence of supervised practica in various educational settings. Seminars and group discussions included.

subject: EDSE
name: Practicum in Education
description: A sequence of supervised practica in various educational settings. Seminars and group discussions included.

subject: EDSE
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: EDSE
name: Practicum in Education
description: A sequence of supervised practica in various educational settings. Seminars and group discussions included.

subject: EDSE
name: Secondary School Curriculum
description: The organization, historical context, foundations for curriculum development, process of curriculum planning, design of the curriculum, and strategy of curriculum change in the secondary school. A laboratory experience in teaching media is included. Open only to juniors and seniors or graduates completing certification requirements.

subject: EDSE
name: Directed Teaching in High School (Business Education)

subject: EDSE
name: Directed Teaching in High School (History and Social Studies)

subject: EDSE
name: Directed Teaching in High School (Distributive Education)

subject: EDSE
name: Directed Teaching in High School (Theatre and Speech)

subject: EDSE
name: Secondary Student Teaching Seminar
description: Classroom management, discipline, legal responsibilities, multicultural perspectives, and needs of exceptional children.

subject: EDSE
name: Equity and Community Engagement
description: Field-based inquiry into theories of critical multicultural education, culturally relevant and equity pedagogies with an emphasis on middle/high school students and engaging parents and the larger school community.   FS: 11/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Teachers and Teaching
description: Teaching as reflective and ethical practice. Professional standards, teacher leadership and school change, and various roles of professional educators.    FS: 12/04/2019.

subject: EDSE
name: Source Materials for Geographic Instruction
description: Introduction to selected materials available for all levels of instruction in geography. Emphasis on the substantive nature of the materials.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Middle and High School (Business Education)
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction in middle and high school business education.    ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Study of the Teaching of Business Education in the Secondary School
description: Teaching techniques and methodology related to the business education curriculum, emerging technology and software.    ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE

description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction in middle and high school English.    FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
