description: Origin, internal structure and internal processes of the earth, including plate tectonics, earthquakes, volcanoes, and mountain building. Required field trips, two lectures, and three lab hours per week. Cannot be used in MS or PhD programs in geology.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Earth Science for Teachers II
description: Surface processes acting on the earth; introduction to weather and climate, weathering, erosion, and sedimentary processes; land form evolution; ocean currents and tides, near-shore geologic processes. Required field trips, two lecture, and three lab hours per week. Cannot be used in MS or PhD programs in geology.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Middle and High School (Mathematics)
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction in middle and high school mathematics.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Middle and High School (Health)
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction in middle and high school health.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Middle and High School (Marketing Education)
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction in middle and high school marketing education.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Middle and High School (Science)
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction in middle and high school science.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Middle and High School (Theatre and Speech)
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction in middle and high school theatre and speech.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Middle and High School (History and Social Studies)
description: A study of methods, techniques, and materials of instruction in middle and high school history and social studies.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Foreign Languages in Secondary Schools
description: Current methods, techniques, and materials of instruction appropriate for secondary schools.    FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Advanced Latin in Secondary School
description: Methods and materials for teaching the Latin Advanced Placement courses in secondary school.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Middle and High School Internship Seminar
description: Classroom management, service learning, legal/professional responsibilities, multicultural perspectives and needs of exceptional children.    CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Secondary Internship Seminar I
description: Integration of content, pedagogy, and disposition knowledge learned during coursework with Internship I field experiences.    FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Secondary Internship Seminar II
description: Integration of content, pedagogy, and disposition knowledge learned during coursework with Internship II field experiences.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDSE
name: Teaching Mathematics with Manipulatives, Grades 7-12
description: Methods and materials for using manipulative devices to teach middle and high school level mathematics.

subject: EDSE
name: Graphics Calculators in High School Mathematics
description: Methods and materials for using graphics calculators to teach algebra, elementary functions, and analytic geometry.

subject: EDSE
name: Technology in Mathematics Education
description: Topics in the use of electronic technology in the teaching of mathematics at the middle and secondary school levels.

subject: EDTE
name: Introduction to Careers in Education
description: A survey of professional issues and concerns in education.

subject: EDTE
name: Practicum in Careers in Education
description: Seminars and visits to schools and classrooms.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Issues and Trends in Teaching and Learning
description: Introduces and examines current issues and trends in teaching and learning.

subject: EDTE
name: Global Citizenship and Social Responsibility through Education
description: Examining the continuing evolution of education and the direct impact on the development of social responsibility, values, and our place as global citizens.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Convergence and Divergence in African American and Jewish Relations: Historical and Contemporary
description: An examination of African American and Jewish American inter-ethnic, historical and contemporary connections and disconnections. Implications for educational, social, and social settings are considered.   FS: 04/15/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Learning Through Community Service
description: Documentation and synthesis of community service activities designed to prepare professional educators.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Teaching Internship in Foreign Languages
description: Application of effective teaching techniques and organization of instructional settings in foreign languages for K-12.

subject: EDTE
name: Directed Teaching in Foreign Languages
description: Students apply methods of curriculum and assessment, professionalism, effective teaching, and organization of instructional settings during internship in foreign language classroom.   FS: 02/05/2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Mathematics Knowledge for Teaching I: PK-8
description: Pedagogical content knowledge for teaching number concepts and operations, fraction, ratio, and proportional reasoning, and algebraic reasoning.    FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: EDTE
name: Mathematics Knowledge for Teaching II: PK-8
description: Pedagogical content knowledge for teaching number and operations, data concepts and statistical reasoning, geometry, measurement, and spatial reasoning.    FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: EDTE
name: Integrated Curriculum at the Middle Level
description: Constructing, teaching, and assessing an integrated curriculum for students in middle schools.  Upper level undergraduate students exploring middle level education.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Internship in Curriculum and Assessment
description: Internship for practice in classrooms appropriate to the level of certification sought (early childhood or elementary) related to curriculum design and assessment.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Internship in Teaching
description: Internship for practice in classrooms appropriate to the level of certification sought (early childhood or elementary) related to interactive teaching.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Internship in Professional Roles
description: Internship for practice in classrooms appropriate to the level of certification sought (early childhood or elementary) related to professional roles.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Systematic Effective Teaching
description: Application of research-supported effective teaching techniques to the teaching-learning process, including demonstration lessons, observations, and supervisory conferences.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EDTE
name: Cooperative/Team Learning in Education
description: Instructional approaches, materials, and procedures for utilizing cooperative/team learning in education.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Integrated Reading and Writing Instruction
description: Theoretical bases and techniques for teaching reading and writing in the elementary school, using multiple subject areas.

subject: EDTE
name: Whole Language: Concepts and Practices
description: Development of concepts, materials, and practices to implement a whole language philosophy.

subject: EDTE
name: Restructuring Schools: Teachers and Classrooms
description: Examination of issues related to restructuring schools based on different assumptions about teaching, learning, and assessment.

subject: EDTE
name: Integrating Character Education into Instructional Programs
description: Rationale, processes, and methodologies for integrating character education into school or school district instructional programs.

subject: EDTE
name: Service Learning for Schools, Community, and Workplace Responsibility
description: Assist school personnel in designing academic, personal, civic, and workplace responsibility.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDTE
name: Technology to Support Instruction
description: Introduction to computers, educational technology, and selected applications for instructional management.

subject: EDTE
name: Computers in Science Education
description: Use of computer technology in teaching and managing science classes and problems in grades K-12.

subject: EDUC
name: USC Teaching Fellows Leadership Seminar
description: A resource for members of the Teaching Fellows Program to successfully complete yearly program requirements. Topics include: qualities of an effective teacher, how to give constructive classroom feedback, students' needs decision making, leadership styles, valuing diversity, and factors that influence/contribute to effective teacher leadership.  Restricted to students enrolled in the USC Teaching Fellows Program. Instructor permission only.    FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDUC
name: Global and Multicultural Perspectives on Education in International Settings
description: Study abroad course in which students apply social science knowledge and analytical methods to understand the ways in which culture, society, politics, and global forces affect education and schooling in diverse international settings. May be repeated as content varies by destination.   FS: 12/05/2012.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDUC
name: Case Study in Classroom Management
description: Case study in the clinical application of pedagogy and methods related to classroom management, including relational, procedural and instructional aspects of a classroom management approach.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EDUC
name: Field Problems in Education I
description: Selected educational problems will be identified and explored, and probable solutions developed. Emphasis will be on providing practicing school personnel an opportunity to work cooperatively, under supervision, toward solutions to those problems which are of immediate concern to them. Activities will include seminars, review of literature, observations, case studies, materials development, and other applicable approaches. Emphasis will be placed on the development of a comprehensive proposal designed to alleviate or solve the problems identified.

subject: EDUC
name: Field Problems in Education II
description: Selected educational problems will be identified and explored, and probable solutions developed. Emphasis will be on providing practicing school personnel an opportunity to work cooperatively, under supervision, toward solutions to those problems which are of immediate concern to them. Activities will include seminars, review of literature, observations, case studies, materials development, and other applicable approaches. Emphasis will be placed on the development of a comprehensive proposal designed to alleviate or solve the problems identified.

subject: EDUC
name: Field Problems in Education III
description: Selected educational problems will be identified and explored, and probable solutions developed. Emphasis will be on providing practicing school personnel an opportunity to work cooperatively, under supervision, toward solutions to those problems which are of immediate concern to them. Activities will include seminars, review of literature, observations, case studies, materials development, and other applicable approaches. Emphasis will be placed on the development of a comprehensive proposal designed to alleviate or solve the problems identified.

subject: EDUC
name: Field Problems in Education IV
description: Selected educational problems will be identified and explored, and probable solutions developed. Emphasis will be on providing practicing school personnel an opportunity to work cooperatively, under supervision, toward solutions to those problems which are of immediate concern to them. Activities will include seminars, review of literature, observations, case studies, materials development, and other applicable approaches. Emphasis will be placed on the development of a comprehensive proposal designed to alleviate or solve the problems identified.

subject: EDUC
name: Supervision of Student Teaching
description: The theoretical and functional foundations with which an early childhood, elementary, or secondary school teacher should be familiar when supervising a student teacher in a clinical situation.    CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Electrical and Electronics Engineering
description: Introductions to: the profession of electrical engineering; the wide range of sub-disciplines that make electrical engineering so valuable in improving the human condition; the role of electrical engineers in society; and the role of electrical engineering students in the university.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ELCT
name: Electrical Science
description: Fundamentals of electrical and electronic components. Basic network laws. Mathematical and computer tools for network analysis.

subject: ELCT
name: Introductory Electrical Engineering Laboratory
description: Laboratory procedures, instrumentation and measurements, report writing, computer use in system design, testing, and troubleshooting. Integrative project-based learning environment including passive, active, electronic and electromechanical systems.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Electrical Engineering for Non-Majors
description: Fundamentals of electrical engineering for mechanical, chemical, or other engineering disciplines, including electric circuits, measurements, data acquisition, sensors, motors, and controllers.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Circuits
description: Analysis of linear ac circuits using complex variables. Nodal and mesh analysis, Thevenin and Norton transformations, linearity, superposition, use of math solvers, circuit simulators, and computer-interfaced instrumentation.   FS: 10/03/2018.

subject: ELCT
name: Signals and Systems
description: Analysis of continuous-time signals and systems in time and frequency domains, Fourier series and transforms, Laplace transforms; introduction to discrete-time signals.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Electronics Laboratory
description: Design and implementation of analog and digital electronic circuits, with emphasis on developing deep individual understanding of curriculum-spanning concepts.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Real Time Systems Laboratory
description: Team-oriented application of sensing, measurement, and real time embedded digital control for autonomous vehicular systems. Requirements analysis, system modeling, software/hardware integration, report writing, development of teaming skills.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Digital Signal Processing
description: An introduction to analysis, design and applications of discrete time systems; z- and discrete Fourier transforms; frequency and impulse responses, FIR and IIR filters.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Control Systems
description: Fundamentals of control systems. Analysis and design of control systems using physical system models. State variables, steady-state error, time- and frequency-responses, control system stability. Root locus analysis and controller design – PI, PD, PID, lead-lag compensator. Nyquist stability criterion.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Computer Modeling of Electrical Systems
description: Formulation of physics-based dynamic models of electrical or electromechanical systems. Solving dynamic equations of electrical systems in discrete time. Use of object oriented programming language (e.g., C++) and computer tools (e.g,  MATLAB, virtual test bed) for solving dynamic equations of electrical systems.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Electromagnetics
description: Basic concepts of electric and magnetic fields, including electrostatics, magnetostatics, and quasi-statics with computer applications.   FS: 06/04/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Introduction to Microelectronics
description: Properties and characteristics of semiconductor materials, p-n and semiconductor-metal junctions. Basic properties, characteristics and operation of diodes and transistors.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ELCT
name: Electronics
description: Introduction to design and analysis of electronic circuits and systems. Applications of amplifiers, op-amps, diodes, bipolar and field-effect transistors in analog and digital circuits.    FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Capstone Design Project I
description: Planning, preliminary design, and prototyping. Analysis and specification of system and subsystem requirements, measures of performance, analysis of alternatives, effective team work. Project management and scheduling. Prototype implementation and characterization. This course should be taken during student’s penultimate semester.   FS:  10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Capstone Design Project II
description: Continuation of Capstone Design Project I. Final design and implementation including design iteration, design for reliability, system integration and characterization, business case development.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Industrial Controls
description: The embedded electronics and software used in data acquisition, and process and instrument control in an industrial or manufacturing environment.   FS: 04/07/2021.

subject: ELCT
name: Fundamentals of Communication Systems
description: Introduction to communication systems, sampling theorem, modulation theory, multiplexing, phase-lock loops, and related topics.    FS: 04/07/2021.

subject: ELCT
name: Power Systems Design and Analysis
description: Electric power systems including transformer fundamentals, per-unit analysis, transmission and distribution line design, and power flow analysis.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: ELCT
name: Special Problems
description: Individual investigation or studies of special topics. A maximum of 3 credits total may be applied toward a degree.  Advanced approval of project proposal by instructor and department advisor.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Photovoltaic Materials and Devices
description: Fundamentals of photovoltaic solar cell technologies. Design and operation of solar cells, including efficiency analysis and cost benefit. Applications to green and sustainable energy systems.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Introduction to Microwaves
description: Introduction to plane electromagnetic wave propagation, reflection, transmission, antennas and antenna arrays, wireless link margin; noise, noise figure, noise temperature; switches and phase shifters; microwave modeling.​   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ELCT
name: Digital Control Systems
description: Analysis and design of discrete-time control systems, implementation of control systems using digital electronic systems. Applications to electrical systems.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: System Health Management
description: Sensing, data acquisition, and data processing for evaluation of performance and system health. Integration and implementation of health management systems.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Sensors for Biomedicine
description: Operating principles and design of bioelectric sensors and sensor systems for medical applications.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Electromechanical Energy Conversion
description: Analysis and design of electromechanical energy conversion systems, including electrical machines and electronic drives.    FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: ELCT
name: Integration of Photovoltaics in Modern Power Systems
description: Analysis and design of power systems in presence of photovoltaic generation with focus on protection systems, control, power quality.   FS: 11/1/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Special Topics in Distributed Energy Resources for Electric Energy Systems
description: Special topics in distributed energy resources for modern electrical energy systems.  Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.  May be repeated as topics vary.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ELCT
name: Wireless Communications
description: Fourier techniques and stochastic processes review, multiple access & cellular techniques, signal space representations for signals and noise, baseband modulations and optimal receivers in additive white Gaussian noise, bandpass and higher-order modulations, mobile & wireless propagation channel characteristics, effects of bandlimiting & distortion mitigation, diversity techniques.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Semiconductor Devices for Power, Communications and Lighting
description: Operational principles and characteristics of electronic and optoelectronic semiconductor devices including MOSFETs and high electron mobility transistors (HEMTs) for  power electronics, electric cars and high-speed communications, light emitting diodes and lasers for solid state lighting, displays and optical communication, solar cells for green power generation.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ELCT
name: RF Circuit Design for Wireless Communications
description: RF design fundamentals, lumped elements, transmission line theory, transmission lines and waveguides, S-parameters, impedance matching, microwave resonators.   CL: 2020.

subject: ELCT
name: Power Electronics
description: Basic analysis and design of solid-state power electronic devices and circuitry.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: ELCT
name: Semiconductor Materials and Device Characterization
description: Semiconductor material and device characterization; resistivity, carrier and doping density, contact resistance, Schottky barriers, series resistance, defects, trapped charges, and carrier lifetime.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Mechanical Engineering
description: Introduction to Mechanical Engineering; Engineering thinking; Problem-solving skills; University life and academic expectations.     FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Computer-Aided Design
description: Principles and practice of visualization and graphical representation using modern computer-aided design tools.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Statics
description: Principles of mechanics; Equilibrium of particles and rigid bodies; Distributed forces, centroids, and centers of gravity; Moments of inertia of areas; Analysis of simple structures and machines; Friction.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Applied Numerical Methods
description: Introduction and application of linear algebra and numerical methods to the solution of physical and engineering problems. Techniques include iterative solution techniques, methods of solving systems of equations, and numerical integration and differentiation.

subject: EMCH
name: Mechanical Engineering Fundamentals for Non-Majors
description: Introduction to the fundamentals of mechanical engineering for other engineering disciplines.  Excluded: Mechanical Engineering Majors.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Solid Mechanics
description: Study of forces and deformation in solids; Basic concepts of stress and strain; Elastic relations between stress and strain; Stress and strain transformations; Applications to mechanical components under axial, torsional, bending and pressure loads.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Thermodynamics
description: Definitions, work, heat, and energy; First law of analyses of systems and control volumes; Second law analysis.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Finite Element Stress Analysis
description: Introduction to stress analysis for beams, plates, shells, and solids using finite element based computer tools.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Dynamics
description: Kinematics of particles and rigid bodies; Kinetics of particles, emphasis on Newton's second law: energy and momentum methods for the solution of problems; Applications of plane motion of rigid bodies.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Machine Design
description: Design against static failure and fatigue failure of structural members and machine parts; Design and selection of components including: fasteners, welds, shafts, springs, gears, bearings, and chain drives.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Mechanical Vibrations
description: Analysis of forced and damped one-degree-of-freedom systems. Rotating unbalance and vibration isolation. Introduction to two-degrees-of-freedom systems.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Kinematics
description: The application of vector and graphical analysis for the determination of positions, velocities and accelerations of planar linkages used in modern machinery.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Heat Transfer
description: One- and two-dimensional steady and transient heat conduction; Free and forced convection; Boiling and condensation; Radiation; Heat exchangers.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Fluid Mechanics
description: Applications of fluid statics and dynamics; Conservation of mass, momentum, and energy; Similitude and dimensional analysis; Open channel flow, lift and drag; Introduction to turbulent flow   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Laboratory I
description: Basic concepts of instruments, measurements, and experimental data analysis; Statistical analysis of experimental data and uncertainty analysis; LabView control, sensors, and measurement of parameters in mechanical engineering systems; Technical writing and presentation.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Laboratory II
description: Basic concepts of hypothesis, simple design of experiments to demonstrate principles and applications of fluid dynamics, manufacturing, mechanical properties, heat transfer, and vibration analysis through a series of lab experiments.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Mechanical Engineering Laboratory III
description: Experiments directly related to advanced mechanical engineering courses. Physical and statistical design of experiments. Written and oral reports.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Controls
description: Introduction to closed-loop control systems in Mechanical Engineering; Development of concepts, including transfer function, feedback, frequency response, and system stability; Programmable logic controllers (PLC); Control system design methods.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Mechatronics
description: Introduction to the principles of integrating mechanical, electrical and computer engineering disciplines within a unified framework towards designing mechatronic systems; Fundamental overview of mechatronics (sensors, signals, actuators, microprocessors and models of mechatronic systems); Experimental exercises using microcontrollers.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Materials
description: An introduction to the relationships between chemical bonding, crystal structure, phase equilibria, microstructure, and properties of engineering materials.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Manufacturing
description: Basics of: Deformative Manufacturing, Subtractive Manufacturing, Additive Manufacturing, Assembly Processes; Introduction to: Polymers Manufacturing, Composites Manufacturing, Computer-Aided Manufacturing.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Project Management
description: Introduction to decision making for engineering projects; Planning methods; Forecasting; Exploratory charts; Team building and leadership; Project scheduling; Project economics.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Applied Thermodynamics
description: Basics of: Fundamentals of thermodynamics, Thermodynamic properties, Energy and Mass Conservation, Entropy and the Second Law Analysis; Introduction to: Power, Refrigeration, and Heat Pump Cycle Systems for vapor cycles and gas cycles; Application of Thermodynamic concepts to determine changes of enthalpy, entropy, and internal energy related with cycle systems, psychometrics, and combustion process.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Design I
description: Open-ended design project initiation including: identifying and ranking customer and project needs, benchmarking appropriate design specifications, planning and project management, functional analysis, innovation and concept generation, learning through mockups, concept ranking and concept selection.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Design II
description: Open-ended design project continuation including: identifying and performing relevant engineering analyses, parametric design refinement, project life cycle economic analysis, product/prototype construction, testing, and evaluation of the design; Consideration of safety, reliability, sustainability, and social impact.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Automotive System Fundamentals
description: Automotive engineering systems, descriptions, and associated operating and design principles. Past, present, and future automotive systems and components.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Special Problems
description: Individual investigation or studies of special topics. A maximum of three credits may be applied toward a degree.  Advance approval of project proposal by advisor and instructor.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Design of Thermal Systems
description: Methodology of design, mathematical modeling of thermal equipment, system simulation, system optimization using digital computer, and investment economics. Requires a semester-long design project.  Two lectures and one problem session per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Fundamentals of Engineering Preparation
description: Preparation for the Fundamentals of Engineering Exam. Review general engineering and mechanical engineering-specific areas.  Restricted to seniors. May not be used to satisfy program requirements.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Engineering Analysis I
description: Engineering applications of solution techniques for ordinary and partial differential equations, including Sturm-Liouville theory, special functions, transform techniques, and numerical methods.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Engineering Analysis II
description: Engineering applications of optimization methods, calculus of variations including approximate methods, and probability concepts.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Computer-Aided Design
description: Solid modeling using commercial computer-aided design (CAD) applications package to reverse engineer-manufactured parts. Analytical curves and surfaces, transformation matrices, assembly modeling, and computer tools for analyzing parts and mechanisms.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Finite Element Analysis in Mechanical Engineering
description: Development of the fundamental concepts of finite element modeling. Matrix equation assembly and reduction. Mechanical engineering applications in structures, stress analysis, ideal flow, and heat transfer problems.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Computer-Aided Manufacturing
description: Optimizing computer-controlled machining processes, programmable logic controllers (PLCs), motion control of servomechanisms, CNC machining practices and programming, and robotics.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Control Theory in Mechanical Engineering
description: An introduction to closed-loop control systems; development of concepts, including transfer function, feedback, frequency response, and system stability by examples taken from mechanical engineering practice; control system design methods.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Technology Planning
description: Assessment of technological needs in the organization; coupling research and development to production; selection and evaluation of the technical project/program; technical planning, resource allocation, direction, and control; effective use and development of the engineering staff; the process of and barriers to technological change; technology, values, and policy. Senior or graduate standing.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Concurrent Engineering
description: A systematic approach to the mechanical design of products, requiring the concurrent design of all related processes.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Design for Manufacture and Assembly
description: Product design principles for early consideration of issues to shorten product development time and to ensure smooth transition to manufacturing, thus accelerating time-to-market.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Design of Mechanical Systems
description: Summary of mechanical design, project management, product liability and the law, intellectual property ethics and professionalism.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Product Safety Engineering
description: Design considerations and methodologies for products to ensure adequate safeguards for the prevention of accidents, failures, and injuries.   Senior standing.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Sustainable Design and Development
description: System design and development accomplished with consideration of environmental/ecological, economic, and social constraints. Students will be introduced to sustainable design and accomplish a design project.  Senior standing.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Engineering Optimization
description: Mathematical formulation of an optimum design problem, introduction to optimum design concepts and multidisciplinary design optimization.  Use of mathematical programming methods for unconstrained and constrained minimization for engineering design optimization.     FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Intermediate Dynamics
description: Kinematics and dynamics of particles and rigid bodies using Newtonian mechanics. Work/energy, impulse/momentum, 3-D motion.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Robotics in Mechanical Engineering
description: Overview of robotics in practice and research: forward and inverse kinematics, statics and dynamics, trajectory generation, control, vision, and motion planning.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Compressible Fluid Flow
description: Application of the conservation laws of a compressible fluid to isentropic flows, flow with friction, and flows with heating or cooling. Shock and expansion waves. Nozzle and diffuser design.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Nuclear Safeguards
description: International nuclear non-proliferation programs and activities, proliferation risk assessment, and nuclear materials management and safeguards, including physical protection systems, material accounting and control, monitoring, and regulatory issues.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Nuclear Energy in the Hydrogen Economy
description: The current role of nuclear energy in the US and global energy mix will be described and the potential for future growth will be surveyed, particularly in the development of the hydrogen economy.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Nuclear Engineering
description: Radioactivity and nuclear reactions; steady state and transient nuclear reactor theory.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Nuclear Fuel Cycles
description: Processing of nuclear fuel including fabrication, irradiation, and waste disposal or storage. In-core and out-of-core fuel management. Fuel cycle economics.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Intermediate Heat Transfer
description: Radiant heat exchange, combined modes of heat transfer, computer techniques in heat transfer analysis and design, environmental heat transfer.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Instrumentation for Nuclear Engineering
description: Basic operational principles of radiation detection and nuclear instrumentation systems. Selection of the proper detector to measure radiation. Statistical analysis of results.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Nuclear Instrumentation Laboratory
description: Use of nuclear radiation detection and instrumentation systems and computers. Data acquisition and analysis.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Risk Analysis and Reactor Safety
description: An introduction to probabilistic risk assessment (PRA) methods as applied to nuclear power plants but also examples from the chemical industry, aerospace, transportation, and other sectors.  Addresses failure and reliability analysis, fault trees, event trees, reactor safety, regulatory practice.     FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Radiation Shielding and Sources
description: Radiation interactions and transport, design of radiation shields, point kernel, and Monte Carlo methods. Dosimetry, buildup factors, radiation sources, and shield materials.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Systems
description: PWR and BWR reactors, reactor system designs for accident prevention and mitigation, protection systems, containment design, emergency cooling requirements, code of federal regulations, and design criteria.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Intermediate Fluid Mechanics
description: Integral and differential analysis of fluids. Potential flow. Boundary layer analysis. Flow in closed and open channels. Flow dynamics of turbomachinery. Steady and unsteady flows.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Current Topics in Mechanical Engineering
description: Special topics related to current issues in mechanical engineering. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Micro/nanofluidics and Lab-on-a-Chip
description: Basic fluid mechanics, capillary, drop and micro/nanoparticle, electrokinetics; micropump, mixer, preconcentrator, electrophoresis, microactuator and particle manipulator; sensors for pressure, velocity, concentration, temperature in environmental monitoring/biodefence, clinical diagnostics, drug discovery/delivery.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Bio Nano/Micro Electro-Mechanical Systems
description: Fundamentals of nano- and microfabrication, metrology and their applications in biomedical engineering and science. The fabrication covers photolithography, nano/microfabrication for nano/microstructures, etching and additive techniques, MEMS integration and packaging, etc. Metrology focuses on characterization of nanostructures with imaging technologies.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Mechanical Behavior of Materials
description: Micromechanisms of the deformation and fracture of structural materials; brittle versus ductile behavior; fatigue and creep; strengthening mechanisms; mechanical testing techniques; methods in analysis of mechanical failures.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Physical Metallurgy
description: Equilibrium and phase relations in metallic systems; kinetics of phase transformations; annealing and precipitation phenomena.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Nuclear Materials
description: Materials for nuclear applications; materials degredation processes occuring in the nuclear reactor environment. Restricted to Engineering Upper Division and Graduate Students.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Adaptive Materials and Smart Structures
description: A multidisciplinary introductory course addressing the engineering field of adaptive materials and smart structures.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Fundamentals and Applications of Fuel Cells
description: Study of fuel cell principles, fuel cell characterization, characteristics of the major types of fuel cells, fuel cell and stack components, fuel cell stack and system design, fuel cell applications in portable, transportation, and stationary areas, as well as the current status and future research focus of fuel cells. Restricted to: Upper division.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Aerospace Structures I
description: Static analysis of aerospace structural elements such as bars, beams, columns, plates, and shells. Topics include, but not limited to elasticity theory, simple beam theory, boundary value problems, and structural stability. Upper division or graduate status.    FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Aerodynamics
description: Fundamentals of aerodynamics, elements of compressible flow, thin airfoil therory, finite wing theory, flow through nozzles diffusers and wind tunnels, normal and oblique shock waves, elements of the methods of characteristics of finite difference solutions for compressible flows, aspects of hypersonic flow.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Mechanics of Solid Biomaterials
description: Introduction to the mechanical behavior of solid biomaterials. Structure and mechanical properties of tissue including skin, myocardium, and tendon. Mathematical treatment of anisotropic elasticity, nonlinear elasticity, linear and quasi-linear viscoelasticity, muscle activity.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Advanced Mechanics of Materials
description: Topics in stress analysis, including unsymmetrical bending, three-dimensional stress-strain; torsion; rotational stress; thick-walled pressure vessels; beams on elastic foundations; and stress concentration.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Composite Materials
description: Introduction to fiber reinforced polymer (FRP) composite materials, manufacturing methods and processes.  Micro-Mechanics and properties of orthotropic laminated and woven composites.  Analysis of composite structures (Mechanics and Synergistic environmental effects). Structure/property relationships.  Characterization of modern composite materials.  Design considerations.     CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Experimental Stress Analysis
description: Stress analysis utilizing experimental techniques including transmission and scattered light photoelasticity, strain gauges, and brittle coatings. Introduction to modern concepts of coherent optics in stress analysis with emphasis on engineering applications.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Introduction to Combustion
description: Chemical thermodynamics, reaction kinetics, and combustion phenomena in energy production. Application to the modeling of coal combustion, incineration, and combustion engines.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Solar Heating
description: Solar radiation; review of heat transfer and radiation characteristics of relevant materials; flat plate and focusing collectors; energy storage models for design of solar heating systems; system design by computer simulation; direct conversion by solar cells.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: EMCH
name: Thermal Environmental Engineering
description: Vapor compression and absorption refrigeration systems. Heat pumps. Properties of refrigerants. Cryogenic refrigeration. Heating and cooling of buildings. Solar heating and cooling systems.   CL: 2020.

subject: EMCH
name: Viscous and Turbulent Flow
description: Viscosity. The Navier-Stokes equation, its formulation and its properties. Exact solutions of the flow at low Reynolds number. Flow at high Reynolds number. The momentum theory of boundary layer. Turbulent flows.

subject: EMCH
name: Aerodynamics & Flight Mechanics
description: Aerodynamics of wings and bodies in aircraft and the static and dynamic analysis of airplane flight mechanics. Topics include fundamentals of potential flows, thin airfoil theory, finite wing theory, laminar and turbulent boundary layers, trajectory analysis, and stability and control of an airplane.

subject: ENCP
name: Introduction to Engineering I
description: Engineering problem solving using computers and other engineering tools.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: ENCP
name: Introduction to Engineering II
description: Principles and practice of visualization and graphical representation using modern computer-aided design tools.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ENCP
name: Exploratory Topics in Engineering and Computing
description: Introduction to new, contemporary, and emerging issues in engineering and computing that are not regularly included in lower division courses.  Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Professional Development and Ethics in Engineering and Computing
description: Introduction to the field of engineering and computing in a seminar format.  Open to first-year students only.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Statics
description: Introduction to the principles of mechanics. Equilibrium of particles and rigid bodies. Distributed forces, centroids, and centers of gravity. Moments of inertia of areas. Analysis of simple structures and machines. A study of various types of friction.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Introduction to Applied Numerical Methods
description: Introduction and application of linear algebra and numerical methods to the solution of physical and engineering problems. Techniques include iterative solution techniques, methods of solving systems of equations, and numerical integration and differentiation.

subject: ENCP
name: Dynamics
description: Kinematics of particles and rigid bodies. Kinetics of particles with emphasis on Newton’s second law; energy and momentum methods for the solution of problems. Applications of plane motion of rigid bodies.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Introduction to the Mechanics of Solids
description: Concepts of stress and strain; stress analysis of basic structural members; consideration of combined stress, including Mohr’s circle; introductory analysis of deflection; buckling of columns.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Thermodynamic Fundamentals
description: Definitions, work, heat, and energy. First law analyses of systems and control volumes. Second law analysis.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ENCP
name: Introduction to Vibrations
description: Theoretical and experimental analysis of systems involving one degree of freedom, including measurement methods. Introduction to free vibrations in systems with two degrees of freedom.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Fluid Mechanics
description: Basic principles of fluid statics and dynamics; conservation laws of mass, momentum, and energy developed in the context of the control volume formulation; application of dimensional analysis, dynamic similitude, steady-state laminar viscous flow, and turbulent flow.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ENCP
name: Sustainable Development in Engineering
description: An examination of political, social, technical, and economic issues associated with sustainable development.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Special Topics in Engineering and Computing
description: Emerging topics in engineering and computing. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated up to 8 hours as topic varies.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Project Management
description: Estimating project time and resources, scheduling, Gantt and pert charts, budgeting, monitoring and tracking results.  Upper-division standing,   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Capstone Design Project I
description: Major team-based design project to be undertaken in a student’s final year of study; project planning.  Consent of advisor and instructor.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Capstone Design Project II
description: System implementation, testing, verification and validation of results. Written reports and oral presentations in a technical setting.  Consent of instructor.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Interdisciplinary Technical Elective
description: Investigation or studies or special topics, typically in an interdisciplinary team-based environment. A maximum of three credits may be applied toward a degree.  Advance approval of proposed project by instructor and academic advisor.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Cases in Technology Feasibility Analysis
description: Technology innovation, exploitation of intellectual property, and technology feasibility analysis.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ENCP
name: Legal Aspects of Engineering & Innovation
description: Contracts, products liability, intellectual property including patent, trade secrets, copyrights and trademarks, and business torts relating to product design.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ENCP
name: Developing and Launching New Ventures in Science and Technology
description: Processes, strategies and tools to analyze and facilitate the emergence of science and technology oriented ventures.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ENCP
name: Innovation and New Venture Analysis
description: Entrepreneurial perspective and planning, market preparation, business model analysis, business planning and fundraising.   FS: 12/07/2022

subject: ENCP
name: Environmentally Conscious Manufacturing
description: Design for the environment; life cycle analysis; environmental economics and global competitiveness; legal and regulatory affairs; and management of technological change. Interdisciplinary collaboration of engineering, science, math, and business majors.  Graduate student standing or consent of instructor.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Introduction to Engineering Design for Teachers
description: An introduction to computer-aided design with solid modeling for pre-service and in-service teachers. Design process, professional communication and collaboration methods, design ethics, and technical documentation.  Non-engineering and computing majors only.    Prerequsite: college algebra with trigonometry.   FS: 02/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Gateway to Technology for Teachers
description: Addresses the development of knowledge, skills, and understanding of modern technology. For preservice and in-service teachers. College of Engineering and Computing majors are excluded.   GC: 05/26/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENCP
name: Principles of Engineering for Teachers
description: Introduces technological processes employed in engineering and engineering technology for K-12 teachers. For pre-service and in-service teachers.   College of Engineering and Computing majors are excluded.   GC: 05/26/16.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: The International Student in the University: Foundations
description: Academic and socio-cultural survival skills for students with high-intermediate English proficiency in the first semester of the Extended Accelerator Program.  Restricted to:  Extended Accelerator Program.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: Topics in Professional Development and Analytical Skills for International Graduate Students
description: Field-specific professional development and analytical skills for graduate students in the International Accelerator Program.  Restricted to: Graduate Students in the International Accelerator Program.    FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: Topics in Advanced Professional Development and Analytical Skills for International Grad Students
description: Advanced field-specific professional development and analytical skills for graduate students in the International Accelerator Program.  Restricted to Graduate Students in the International Accelerator Program.    FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: English for Academic Purposes A
description: Essential English integrated skill building for students at a high intermediate level of English language proficiency; production and comprehension skills and strategies related to accessing academic content.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: English for Academic Purposes B
description: Essential English integrated skill building for students at a high intermediate level of English language proficiency; production and comprehension skills and strategies related to accessing academic content; second in a two-part sequence ENFS 091, ENFS 092.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: Technology for Academic Purposes
description: Technology skills for non-native speakers of English for accessing course content, typing on an English keyboard, formatting and submitting university level assignments, and improving accuracy through online proofreading tools. Restricted to Students in the International Accelerator Program.    FS: 03/02/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: Course Supplement
description: Strategic competence skill building for low-advanced learners of English; designed to enable students to access course materials and complete university-level assignments successfully.  Restricted to: Students in the International Accelerator Program.   FS: 09/14/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: Special Topics in Graduate Communication A
description: Integrated English for Specific Purposes for graduate students in the Masters Accelerator Program; part one of a two-part subject-specific course sequence; IELTS 6.0 or equivalent English language proficiency is required. Restricted to Graduate students in the International Accelerator Program. ENFS 096 and ENFS 097 are normally taken in the same semester as consecutive 8-week courses.    FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENFS
name: Special Topics in Graduate Communication B
description: Integrated English for Specific Purposes for graduate students in the Masters Accelerator Program; part two of a two-part subject-specific course sequence; IELTS 6.0 or equivalent language proficiency is required.  Restricted to Graduate Students in the International Accelerator Program.   ENFS 096 and ENFS 097 are normally taken in the same semester as consecutive 8-week courses.    FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: ENFS
name: Topics in Advanced English for Specific Purposes
description: Advanced, field-specific, Integrated English for Specific Purposes for graduate students in the Masters Accelerator Program; IELTS 6.5 or equivalent language proficiency is required. Restricted to Graduate Students in the International Accelerator Program.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: ENGL
name: Critical Reading and Composition
description: Instruction in strategies for critically reading and analyzing literature and non-literary texts; structured, sustained practice in composing expository and analytical essays.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Rhetoric and Composition
description: Instruction and intensive practice in researching, analyzing, and composing written arguments about academic and public issues.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Creative Writing, Voice, and Community
description: Workshop course on creative writing with a focus on values, ethics, and social responsibility.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: World Literature
description: Selected masterpieces of world literature from antiquity to present.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Literature and Society
description: Fiction, poetry, drama and other cultural texts engaged with questions of values, ethics and social responsibility.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ENGL
name: Special Topics in Fiction
description: Special topics in fiction from several countries and historical periods, illustrating the nature of the genre.  May be repeated for credit.  Content varies by title and semester.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Special Topics in British Literature
description: Special topics in British literature exemplifying persistent themes of British culture.  May be repeated for credit.  Content varies by title and semester.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Drama
description: Drama from several countries and historical periods, illustrating the nature of the genre.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Special Topics in American Literature
description: Special topics in American literature exemplifying persistent themes of American culture.  May be repeated for credit. Content varies by title and semester.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Poetry
description: Poetry from several countries and historical periods, illustrating the nature of the genre.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: American Literature
description: An introduction to American literary history, emphasizing the analysis of literary texts, the development of literary traditions over time, the emergence of new genres and forms, and the writing of successful essays about literature. Designed for English majors.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: English Literature
description: An introduction to English literary history, emphasizing the analysis of literary texts, the development of literary traditions over time, the emergence of new genres and forms, and the writing of successful essays about literature. Designed for English majors.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Teaching Writing in One-to-One Sessions
description: The study of theories and pedagogy of individualized writing instruction with intensive writing practice including hands-on one-on-one sessions. Recommended for prospective writing teachers.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Literature and Law
description: Introduction to the interdisciplinary study of literature and law.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Literature and Medicine
description: Introduction to the interdisciplinary study of literature and medicine.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Introduction to Comics Studies
description: Scholarly study of the formal and aesthetic evolutions of graphic novels, comic books, and other related forms.     FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Creative Writing
description: Workshop course on writing original fiction, poetry, drama, and creative nonfiction.   FS: 06/06/2018.

subject: ENGL
name: Introduction to Professional Writing
description: Overview of concepts, contexts, and genres used in professional communication. Intensive practice in analyzing, emulating, and creating textual and multimedia documents for a variety of professional, non-academic purposes (including commercial, informative, persuasive, and technical).   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Language in the USA
description: Linguistic examination of the structure, history, and use of language varieties in the U.S., with a particular focus on regional and sociocultural variation and relevant sociolinguistic issues.   FS: 11/7/2018

subject: ENGL
name: Literature and Film of the Holocaust
description: Film, poetry and literature created in response to the Holocaust as the means for a decades long cultural discussion, in European and American societies, of the moral and religious implications of the Holocaust on our self-understandings as religious and moral beings.   FS: 10/06/2021.

subject: ENGL
name: Epic to Romance
description: Comprehensive exploration of medieval and other pre-Renaissance literature using texts representative of the evolution of dominant literary forms.   FS:  10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The Renaissance
description: Literature of the Renaissance, in its cultural contexts, explored through representative works.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The Enlightenment
description: Literature of the Enlightenment in its cultural contexts, explored through representative works.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Romanticism
description: Literature of Romanticism, in its cultural contexts, explored through representative works.   FS: 11/7/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Realism
description: Literature of Realism in its cultural contexts, explored through representative works.   FS:  10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Modernism
description: Literature of Modernism in its cultural contexts, explored through representative works.   FS:  10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Postmodernism
description: Literature of Postmodernism in its cultural contexts, explored through representative works.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Introduction to Rhetoric
description: Theories of human communication useful for understanding and informing the everyday work of writers. Emphasis on intensive analysis and writing.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: History of Literary Criticism and Theory
description: Representative theories of literature from Plato through the 20th century.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The English Language
description: Introduction to the field of linguistics with an emphasis on English. Covers the English sound system, word structure, and grammar. Explores history of English, American dialects, social registers, and style.   FS: 11/7/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Great Books of the Western World I
description: European masterpieces from antiquity to the beginning of the Renaissance.   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: ENGL
name: Great Books of the Western World II
description: European masterpieces from the Renaissance to the present.   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: ENGL
name: Great Books of the Eastern World
description: Classical and contemporary poetry and prose of the Middle and Far East.   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: ENGL
name: Postcolonialism
description: Literature of Postcolonialism in its cultural contexts, explored through representative works.     FS: 09/14/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Classical Drama
description: Representative plays by Greek and Roman dramatists.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: ENGL
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Early English Literature
description: Major works of Old and Middle English literature (excluding Chaucer).   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Chaucer
description: Chaucer’s works, with special attention to The Canterbury Tales.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Tudor Literature
description: English non-dramatic poetry and prose of the 16th century.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The 17th Century
description: Poetry and prose of major 17th-century writers (excluding Milton).   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: English Drama to 1660

name: Shakespeare's Tragedies

subject: ENGL
name: Shakespeare’s Comedies and Histories
description: Shakespeare's Comedies and Histories.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Milton
description: Milton’s works, with special attention to Paradise Lost.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The Restoration and 18th Century
description: Poetry and prose from 1660 to the later 18th century.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: British Romantic Literature
description: Poetry and prose of the English Romantic period.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Victorian Literature
description: Poetry and prose from the 1830s to the end of the century.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Modern English Literature
description: Poetry and prose of the 20th century.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: English Drama Since 1660
description: Major dramatists from the Restoration to the present.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The English Novel I
description: A study of the novel from the beginnings through Walter Scott.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The English Novel II
description: A study of the novel from Walter Scott into the 20th century.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Topics in English Literature
description: Intensive study of selected themes, topics, currents of thought, or interdisciplinary concerns. May be repeated for credit under a different course title.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ENGL
name: American Literature to 1830
description: Colonial, Revolutionary, and early Romantic poetry and prose.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: American Literature 1830-1860
description: Poetry and prose of the American Romantic period.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: American Literature 1860-1910
description: Poetry and prose from the Civil War to the early modern era.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Modern American Literature
description: Poetry and prose of the 20th century.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: American Drama
description: Representative plays from the 18th century to the present.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The American Novel to 1914
description: Representative novels from the 18th century to World War I.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The American Novel Since 1914
description: Representative novels from 1914 to the present.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: American Poetry
description: Representative works from the 17th century to the present.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Southern Literature
description: Representative works of Southern writers.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: African-American Literature I: to 1903

subject: ENGL
name: African-American Literature II: 1903 – Present
description: Representative works of African-American writers from 1903 to the present.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Topics in American Literature
description: Intensive study of selected topics. May be repeated for credit under a different title.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ENGL
name: Topics in African American Literature
description: Intensive study of selected topics. May be repeated for credit under a different title.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL

description: Examines contemporary children's literature. Students will become knowledgeable about the history and diversity of children's literature and central issues and controversies in the industry of children's book publishing and children's literature scholarship.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ENGL

description: Examines contemporary picture books primarily for audiences of children, but also for young adult and adult readers. Emphasis will be on text and on the interplay between text and image. Students will become knowledgeable about the history and diversity of children's literature and central issues and controversies in children's book publishing and children's literature scholarship.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ENGL
name: Young Adult Literature
description: Examines contemporary young adult literature. Students will become familiar with current issues and controversies in the world of young adult literature, including prizes, censorship, gender, race, authorship, the politics of publishing, and social justice.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ENGL
name: Special Topics in Children’s and Young Adult Literature
description: Intensive study of a genre, historical period, geographical regions, author, or theme in Children's or Young Adult Literature. May be repeated as content varies by title.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Environmental Literature

subject: ENGL

subject: ENGL
name: Science Fiction Literature
description: Representative masterworks of science fiction from the beginnings of the genre to the present.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Women Writers
description: Representative works written by women.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: South Carolina Writers
description: Authors and literary forms representative of South Carolina.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Scottish Literature
description: Authors and literary forms representative of Scotland.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL

subject: ENGL

subject: ENGL
name: Caribbean Literature
description: Authors and literary forms representative of the Caribbean.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Selected Topics
description: Intensive study of selected themes, topics, currents of thought, or interdisciplinary concerns. May be repeated for credit under a different course title.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Principles of Modern Literary Theory
description: Major 20th-century approaches to texts, from New Criticism to the present.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Global Contemporary Literature
description: Studies in twentieth- and twenty-first-century global Anglophone literatures.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: LGTBQ+ Literature
description: This course will examine  LGBTQ+ (lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, queer, and other nonnormative sexual identities) literatures and cultures.   FS: 12/04/2019

subject: ENGL
name: Special Topics in Theory
description: Approaches to criticism, such as feminism, Marxism, semiology, deconstruction, New Historicism, cultural materialism, and others; or genre, such as narrative, poetry, drama, and others.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: English Grammar
description: Major structures of English morphology and syntax; role of language history and social and regional variation in understanding contemporary English.   FS: 11/7/2018.

subject: ENGL
name: Development of the English Language
description: History of English from the earliest Old English texts through Middle English to Contemporary English. No previous knowledge of Old or Middle English is required.   FS: 11/7/2018.

subject: ENGL
name: Language in Society

subject: ENGL

description: Linguistic examination of the structure, history, and use of African-American English, as well as literary presentations, language attitudes, and issues relating to education and the acquisition of Standard English.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Advanced Writing
description: Extensive practice in different types of nonfiction writing.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: The Teaching of Writing

subject: ENGL
name: Technical Writing
description: Preparation for and practice in types of writing important to scientists, engineers, and computer scientists, from brief technical letters to formal articles and reports.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Business Writing
description: Extensive practice in different types of business writing, from brief letters to formal articles and reports.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Poetry Workshop
description: Workshop in writing poetry.    FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Fiction Workshop
description: Workshop in writing fiction.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Internship
description: Supervised professional experience writing in a workplace or community agency, including analysis and production of documents.  Internship contract and department permission required. 6 is the Maximum number of credit hours if course can be taken multiple times.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Topics in Rhetoric
description: Intensive study of selected topics. May be repeated for credit under a different title.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Digital Writing
description: Emphasis on writing in digital environments, exploring critically and creatively what it means to compose in emerging genres and media. Students will create multimedia texts that may include digital video, audio podcasts, social networks, and/or blogs and wikis, among other digital modes of expression.   FS: 09/14/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Creative Nonfiction
description: Explores the various subgenres and techniques of creative nonfiction, such as collage, memoir and literary journalism by reading polished examples and by responding to writing exercises designed to prompt ideas and hone skills.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Rhetoric of Science and Technology
description: Rhetorical study of science and technology in contemporary culture, emphasizing the ways scientific texts and technologies make their persuasive appeals.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Rhetoric and the Ancient Roots of Modern Life
description: Classical rhetoric and its ongoing influence in the modern world, emphasizing how the study and use of language in ancient Greece and Rome continue to shape modern communication.

subject: ENGL
name: Rhetoric and Popular Culture
description: Rhetorical study of popular culture, using the methods and theories of cultural analysis to examine how various popular cultural forms work as persuasion.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: History of Cinema II
description: Survey of the international cinema from 1945 to the present.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Women’s Rhetoric
description: Study of rhetoric by and about women as manifested in speeches, essays, and other rhetorical artifacts.    FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: African-American Rhetoric
description: African-American rhetoric as manifested in speeches, essays, and other rhetorical artifacts.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Black Women Writers
description: An examination of literature by and about black women, including fiction, poetry, drama, and autobiography. This study will focus on issues that emerge from the creative representations of black women and the intersections of race, gender, sexuality, and class that interrogate what is both particular and universal experiences.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Topics in Advanced Study
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated as topics vary.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Advanced Poetry Workshop
description: Students will study poetry writing at an advanced undergraduate level through close readings of professional poetry, composition of original work, and regular practice in the evaluation of peer work.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Advanced Fiction Workshop
description: Students will study the art and craft of writing literary fiction at an advanced level through close readings and the composition of original short stories.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Advanced Creative Non-Fiction
description: The art and craft of writing creative nonfiction at the advanced level.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Advanced Professional Writing Workshop
description: An advanced workshop on the genres, practices, and contexts of professional writing for experienced writers.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Thesis
description: Directed research resulting in a project of substantial length. Upper-level English majors; permission of undergraduate director and supervising faculty member.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Advanced English Grammar
description: Practical survey of the syntactic structures of English; usage, social and regional variation emphasis on data.   FS: 09/09/2015.

subject: ENGL
name: African American Theatre
description: The major movements, figures, plays, and critical strategies that have marked the development of African American theatre in the 19th, 20th, and 21st centuries.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Special Topics in U.S. Film and Media
description: Intensive study of a specific topic in U.S. film and media studies. May be repeated as content varies by title.   FS: 09/10/2014.

subject: ENGL
name: Seminar in Verse Composition
description: First half of a year-long course in the writing of poetry taught by a contemporary poet. Limited to 15 students.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Seminar in Verse Composition
description: Second half of a year-long course in the writing of poetry taught by a contemporary poet. Limited to 15 students.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Fiction Workshop: Short Story
description: Instruction in the writing of short fiction taught by a contemporary prose writer. May be repeated once for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Non-Fiction Prose Workshop
description: Instruction in the writing of the nonfiction essay taught by a contemporary prose writer. May be repeated once for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Seminar in Composition for the Visual Media
description: Writing for the visual arts, the student will write a treatment (prospectus) and one or more multimedia scripts; or one or more teleplays; or a feature-length screenplay. Limited to 15 students.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Seminar in Composition for the Visual Media
description: Writing for the visual arts, the student will write a treatment (prospectus) and one or more multimedia scripts; or one or more teleplays; or a feature-length screenplay. Limited to 15 students.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Playwriting Workshop
description: Instruction in playwriting taught by a contemporary playwright. May be repeated once for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Fiction Workshop: Book-Length Manuscript
description: Instruction in the writing of book-length manuscripts taught by a contemporary prose writer. May be repeated once for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Writing the Longer Nonfiction Project
description: Instruction in the writing of a book-length nonfiction memoir or literary journalism project taught by a contemporary prose writer.  May be repeated once for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Writing Poetry: Traditional and Modern Forms
description: The writing of traditional and modern poetic forms. Exercises will give practice in composing metered and free verse. Representative masterpieces of traditional and modern poetry will also be studied.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Writing the Full-Length Play
description: Instruction in the writing of a full-length, two-act play for publication or production. May be repeated once for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Academic and Professional Writing
description: A workshop course in the development and revision of writing for academic and professional audiences.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Writing Children’s and Young Adult Literature
description: Critical study and practical crafting of literature for children and/or young adults, exploring the demands of these genres both through the reading of representative works and relevant secondary sources and through the writing of creative works.  Undergraduate students must receive permission of instructor.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Computer Methods for Humanistic Problems
description: Introduction to data processing concepts suitable for research interests in non-numerical areas such as the humanities.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Laboratory for Computer Methods for Humanistic Problems
description: Broad but intensive introduction to computer systems and programming for students in the humanities. No mathematical or scientific background is presumed. Laboratory experience with data-processing equipment; introduction to elementary digital computer programming in an appropriate language.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Special Topics in Literature
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Survey of Linguistics
description: Survey of core areas of linguistics and extensions to closely related disciplines. Introduction to the linguistic component of human cognition. Formal description and analysis of the general properties of speech and language, the organization of language in the mind/brain, and cross-linguistic typology and universals.

subject: ENGL
name: Special Topics in Composition
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ENGL
name: Teaching of Literature in College
