description: Coastal zones of South Carolina and neighboring states, including geologic history, geomorphology, stratigraphy, hydrogeology, shoreline processes, environmental issues, and effects of man. Not available for geological science or marine science major credit. Three lecture hours each week plus optional field trips.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: GEOL
name: Coastal Environments of the Southeastern U.S. (Laboratory)
description: Exercises examining coastal ecology, geomorphology, hydrogeology, shoreline processes, environmental issues, and human impact. Not available for marine science major credit. Two laboratory hours per week. Scheduled field trips required.    Prerequiste or Corequisite: D or better in GEOL 215 or MSCI 215.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: GEOL
name: Geology of the National Parks
description: Examination of the geologic setting and scientific significance of selected National Parks.  Three lecture hours.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Rocks and Minerals
description: Chemical and physical processes of mineral formation in earth systems including an overview of igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rock-forming processes. Includes laboratory. Field trips required.   FS: 06/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Earth Systems through Time
description: Survey of earth history, the evolution of continents and oceans, the history of life, and geological dating methods.  Includes laboratory and recitation. Required field trips. Taught alternate years.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Surface and Near Surface Processes
description: Overview of groundwater, surface water hydrology, sediment transport, river systems, and coastal processes.  Includes laboratory and recitation. Required field trips.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Field Studies in Geology
description: Directed field studies of extraordinary geological locations in North America.  Requires a seven- to nine-day field trip during spring break.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Stratigraphy and Sedimentary Basins
description: Overview of sedimentary basins, sediment transport, sedimentation, depositional environments, stratigraphy, seismic stratigraphy, eustacy, and sedimentary petrology.   Includes laboratory and recitation. Required field trips.   FS: 03/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Processes of Global Environmental Change
description: The science of global change, its relation to the hydrosphere, atmosphere, lithosphere, and biosphere. Global system science, biogeochemical cycles, paleoclimatology, glaciation, and eustacy.   FS: 12/4/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Igneous and Metamorphic Processes
description: Origin and significance of igneous and metamorphic rocks, and relation to tectonic processes.  Mineralogy, geochemistry, volcanism, plate tectonics, isostasy, heat flow.   Includes laboratory and recitation.  Required field trips.    FS: 06/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Structural Geology and Tectonics
description: Geologic structures and deformation of Earth materials.  Stress and strain, deformation mechanisms, P-T-t paths, geologic maps, and structural regimes in plate tectonics.    Includes laboratory and recitation. Required field trips.   FS: 06/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: A View of the River
description: Introduction to terrestrial and tidal river morphology and processes, with case studies of South Carolina.  Field trips required.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: GEOL
name: Undergraduate Research
description: Student research on problems of regional and fundamental significance, supervised by a faculty member of the student’s choice. Emphasis is on the development of critical thinking and lucid scientific report writing.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Undergraduate Research
description: Student research on problems of regional and fundamental significance, supervised by a faculty member of the student’s choice. Emphasis is on the development of critical thinking and lucid scientific report writing.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Field Geology
description: Geological field techniques including the use of field instruments and the preparation of geologic maps. Written and oral reports required.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Principles of Geomorphology
description: The process of earth denudation with emphasis on chemistry of weathering, stream and erosion hydraulics, quantitative analysis of land form evolution.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Principles of Coastal Geomorphology
description: Geological and physical controls on the morphology, development, and stability of coastlines. Analysis of waves and erosional processes, and coastal zone morphodynamics. Several required field trips.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Regional Stratigraphy and Biostratigraphy of North America
description: Sedimentologic, biostratigraphic, and tectonic history of North America, approached from paleogeographic considerations with emphasis on the Atlantic Coastal Plain and Continental Margin.  Three hours lecture and three hours recitation per week. Required field trips.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Climate Geoengineering
description: This course will discuss the urgent need for deploying solar radiation and carbon dioxide removal approaches at scale, including potential benefits and risks of these options.  It will also discuss regulatory and governance considerations at both the national and international level and strategizes to incentivize large-scale adoption of these approaches.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: GEOL
name: Advanced Paleontology
description: Systematic, ecologic, biogeographic, and evolutionary aspects of paleontology; lectures, practical exercises, field trips.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: GEOL
name: Marine Micropaleontology
description: Marine microfossils; distribution, ecology, paleoecology, and biostratigraphy; use of microfossils in marine sediments to study oceanographic history.   Three lectures and two laboratory hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Sedimentology
description: Modern concepts of sediment composition, sedimentary facies, depositional environments, and stratigraphy.  Includes laboratory.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Surface to Subsurface Stratigraphy
description: Surface to subsurface stratigraphic interpretation and techniques; litho- and biostratigraphy; geophysical log interpretation and subsurface presentation.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Isotope Geology and Geochronology
description: Dating techniques for Pleistocene deposits, sediments, archaeological materials, igneous and metamorphic rocks.

subject: GEOL
name: Introduction to Geochemistry
description: Investigation of low temperature chemical reactions controlling the geochemistry of the earth’s surface. Emphasis on CO2, carbonates, oxidation-reduction, thermodynamics, isotopes, biogeochemistry.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Environmental Radioisotope Geochemistry
description: Introduction to radioactivity and the use of radionuclides to study environmental processes, including age-dating and biogeochemical cycling in aquatic systems.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: GEOL
name: Igneous Petrology
description: Petrography and petrogenesis of igneous rocks; evolution of contrasting petrotectonic terranes.  Three lectures and three laboratory hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Metamorphic Petrology
description: Petrography and petrogenesis of metamorphic rocks in orogenic belts. Three lectures and three laboratory hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Plate Tectonics
description: Geological and geophysical evidence for plate tectonics, detailed development of the plate tectonics model, and present areas of research, including measurements of plate motion using satellite geodesy.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 20200.

subject: GEOL
name: Field Methods in Geophysics
description: Application of two or more geophysical field methods to a current geological problem. Independent study contract required.

subject: GEOL
name: Earth Science for Teachers I
description: Origin, internal structure and internal processes of the earth, including plate tectonics, earthquakes, volcanoes, and mountain building. Required field trips, two lectures, and three lab hours per week. Cannot be used in MS or PhD programs in geology.

subject: GEOL
name: Earth Science for Teachers II
description: Surface processes acting on the earth; introduction to weather and climate, weathering, erosion, and sedimentary processes; land form evolution; ocean currents and tides, near-shore geologic processes. Required field trips, two lecture, and three lab hours per week. Cannot be used in MS or PhD programs in geology.

subject: GEOL
name: Methods in Geoscience Education Research
description: Introduction to methods used in discipline-based education research and their application to research questions in the geosciences.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Geological Oceanography
description: A comprehensive study of the origin and development of the major structural features of the ocean basins and the continental margins. Discussion of the techniques used in obtaining geologic data and the interpretation of sedimentary processes, vulcanism, and the stratigraphy of the ocean basins.   CL:  2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Marine Geophysics
description: Introduction to the nature and structure of the ocean floor as revealed by geophysical techniques.  Two hours lecture and three hours laboratory.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Environmental Geophysics
description: Practical geophysical techniques for exploring the shallow subsurface. Seismic, resistivity, well log, gravity, magnetic method. Includes lectures and field exercises to collect and analyze data.   FS: 09/09/15.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Sedimentary Simulations and Sequence Stratigraphy
description: Problems of sequence stratigraphy resolved with graphic computer simulations. Sedimentary fill of basins by carbonates and/or clastics tracked as a function of rate of sediment accumulation, tectonic behavior, and sea level. Includes laboratory.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Marine Sediments
description: Marine sedimentary environments; physical/biological factors which control the formation and distribution of modern marine sediments.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Applied Seismology
description: Theory of seismic wave propagation. Seismic reflection data acquisition, processing, and interpretation.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Elementary Seismology
description: Basic elements of seismology. Mathematical development of seismic wave equations; measurement, description, and interpretation of seismic data.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Seismic Reflection Interpretation
description: The interpretation of geologic structure using seismic sections. Recognition of apparent structure caused by velocity anomalies, multiples, and complex reflector geometry. Application to hydrocarbon exploration.

subject: GEOL
name: Coastal Processes
description: Physical and geological processes controlling the formation and evolution of beach, barrier, and nearshore environments, including discussion of coastal management issues.   FS: 11/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Earth Resource Management
description: An approach to problems of resource management by lecture and seminar using case studies in mineral, energy, hydrogeological, and environmental science.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Environmental Field Geology
description: An introduction to field methods in sedimentology, structural geology, hydrogeology and geophysics with special reference to geological hazards and environmental problems.

subject: GEOL
name: Long-Term Environmental Change
description: Climatic changes of the past and their impact on the physical landscape, with an emphasis on the Quaternary period.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Introduction to Micrometeorology
description: Small-scale processes in the atmospheric boundary layers, including energy budget, radiation, soil heat transfer, humidity, viscous flows, turbulence, momentum and heat exchanges, evaporation, and marine atmospheric boundary layer.    FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: GEOL
name: Environmental Hydrogeology
description: Environmental considerations of the hydrologic cycle, occurrence and movement of ground water, aquifer analysis, and water well emplacement and construction. Water quality, pollution parameters, and the geochemistry of selected natural systems. The effects of environmental problems, waste disposal, and urban development upon the aqueous geochemical regime.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Soil Hydrology
description: Saturated and unsaturated water flow through soils, pore pressure development, runoff generation, and watershed response to rainfall.  Three lecture and three laboratory hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Numerical Modeling for Earth Science Applications
description: Finite difference and finite element methods for solving the diffusion equation and advection-dispersion equation, with applications in hydrogeology, geophysics, geology, and marine science.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Air-Sea Interaction
description: The physical mechanism responsible for interaction between the ocean and the atmosphere and the influence of air-sea interaction on atmospheric and oceanic dynamics and thermodynamics on a wide variety of spatial/temporal scales.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Satellite Oceanography
description: This course provides knowledge of various techniques used in satellite remote sensing of the oceans. Key skills will be developed in satellite data processing, image analysis, and hands-on research.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Estuarine Oceanography
description: Estuarine kinematics and dynamics; classification of estuaries; estuarine circulation and mixing.  Scheduled field trips are required.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Marine Hydrodynamics
description: Basic principles of fluid statics and dynamics. Conservation of mass, momentum, and energy; viscosity, vorticity, and boundary layers with examples from the marine environment. Applications to and analysis of ocean currents and waves.     FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: GEOL
name: Geology and Geochemistry of Salt Marshes
description: Geological and geochemical processes in salt marshes. Methods of geological research in marshes including instrumental techniques, sampling design, and data analysis. Two lectures per week plus four weekends of project oriented fieldwork and/or equivalent lab work. Scheduled field trips are required.

subject: GEOL
name: Senior Seminar in Geology and Geophysics
description: Advanced research topics in geology and geophysics; critical reading of literature, technical presentations, and written reports.  Senior standing.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Electron Microscopy and Microanalysis
description: SEM, ESEM, TEM, and EMPA, WDS quantitative analysis, EDS semi-quantitative analysis, EBSD, methods of sample preparation, and applications in varieties of disciplines.  Two lecture and three laboratory hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: GEOL
name: Senior Thesis
description: Senior capstone experience, research on a problem on fundamental significance, supervised by faculty member; must include field study component, written final project report, and oral presentation at departmental seminar.    CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Beginning German I
description: Introduction to grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills.  Restricted to those who have never studied German or who have placed by examination into GERM 109. Credit may be received only for one of the following GERM 109; GERM110; GERM 111; GERM 121.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Beginning German II
description: Introduction to grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills.  Credit may be received only for one of the following: GERM 109; GERM 110; GERM 111; GERM 121.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Intensive Beginning German
description: Intensive introduction to grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills. Admission only to highly motivated beginning students who obtain permission of the department. Credit may be received only for one of the following: GERM 109 and GERM 110; GERM 111; GERM 121.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Elementary German
description: Grammar and vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills. Assumes prior experience in German. Admission only by proficiency examination. Credit may be received for only one of the following: GERM 109; GERM 110; GERM 111; GERM 121.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Basic Proficiency in German
description: Practice and further development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Intermediate German
description: Further development of listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills; discussion of selected literary texts, and current issues; intensive review of basic grammar structures.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Intermediate German
description: Reading strategies, a review, and expansion of grammar structures, supplemented with materials concerning current issues.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: The Idea of Nature in Germany
description: The idea of nature in Germany from the 18th century to today. Focus on scientific, philosophical, social and political entanglements that prompt radical shifts in how German thinkers view nature.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Knights and Ladies
description: Survey of medieval romances and love lyrics of Germany.  History and culture of the High Middle Ages in Germany, especially courtly society.  The function of chivalry and courtly literature in society.   FS: 06/04/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: German Culture and Civilization
description: Survey of German cultural history from the Middle Ages to the present.  Taught in English.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Viking Mythology
description: Survey of Germanic mythological and heroic texts of the Viking Age.  History and culture of Germanic tribes, especially the Vikings. The function of myth in society.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Green Technology in Germany
description: Examination of roots and culture of environmentalism and related technological innovation in Germany. Comparison of green practices around the world to practices within Europe and U.S.   FS: 12/04/2013.    CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: German Conversation
description: Continued practice in the four skills with focus on a selected aspect of German culture and society.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: German Conversation and Composition
description: Continued practice in the four skills with emphasis on developing writing skills and with focus on a specific aspect of German culture.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Advanced German for Business and Other Professions I
description: Development of advanced language and cultural skills necessary for functioning in the professional world of German-speaking countries.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: German Kabarett Production
description: Literary-historical analysis and discussion of texts from German Kabarett, including comedic skits, political and social satire, parody, humorous poetry. Semester ends with a public performance in German.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Study of German Abroad
description: Intensive language practice and cultural studies. May be repeated for credit by permission.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Readings in German Literature
description: An introduction to the literary genres illustrated by masterpieces in German poetry, drama, and prose.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Selected Topics
description: Taught in English. Intensive study of cultural and/or literary movements in German-speaking countries. Course content varies by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: GERM
name: Practicum in Teaching German to Young Children
description: Introduction to principles of foreign language instruction and field experience planning instruction and teaching German to children in local elementary schools.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Advanced German Grammar
description: Emphasis on advanced grammar structures, with continued development of all four skills (reading, writing, listening, speaking).   FS: 12/06/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Advanced German Conversation
description: Advanced practice in correct spoken idiomatic German with special focus on issues of the 20th century and contemporary culture.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Advanced German for Business and Other Professions II
description: Development of advanced language and cultural skills necessary for functioning in the professional world of German-speaking countries. Preparation for standardized exams.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Medieval German Literature and Culture
description: Survey of German literature and culture from the beginnings to 1350, including Germanic mythology and heroic poetry, conversion to Christianity, courtly romance and love lyric, mystical writings, art and architecture.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: The German Enlightenment and its Countercurrents
description: German literature and culture of the 18th century with emphasis on the period between 1750 and Weimar Classicism. May include major works by Lessing, Goethe, and Schiller.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: German Literature and Culture from 1800-1871
description: German literary, cultural, and intellectual developments from Unification to the end of WWII, including Naturalism, Expressionism, the Weimar Republic, the Third Reich, and the exile period.   FS: 12/04/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: German Literature from 1890-1945
description: German literary, cultural, and intellectual developments from 1890 to 1945, including Expressionism, Weimar Republic, the Third Reich, and exile period.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Post-War and Contemporary German Literature
description: German literary, cultural and political developments from Post-War destruction and reconstruction, through the Cold War period of division, with examination of the reunification process.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Survey of German Culture
description: Historical survey of the German contribution to the intellectual and cultural life of Europe. Texts and films in German.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Introduction to German Linguistics
description: Structural and descriptive linguistics applied to the German language.   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: GERM
name: History of the German Language
description: Development of German in the Germanic, Old High German, Middle High German, and New High German periods. Phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and the relationship between dialects and the standard language.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Introduction to the Germanic Languages
description: Introduction to historical Germanic linguistics including a survey of the Old Germanic languages (Old English, Old Frisian, Old Saxon, Old High German, Old Norse, Gothic); comparative phonology, morphology, and syntax, typology of modern Germanic languages and dialects; and common Germanic in its Indo-European context.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: German Sociolinguistics
description: Introduction to the study of variation in Modern German. Traditional German dialectology and dialect geography, language and society, multilingualism in the German-speaking countries, German in contact with other languages.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Topics in German Film
description: Examination of recurring themes and issues or of significant periods and influential styles in German film. Course content varies and individual topics will be announced with course title.   CL: 2020.

subject: GERM
name: Intensive Readings in German
description: Intensive reading for non-majors. Graduate students fulfill their foreign-language requirement with successful completion of the course. Undergraduates may take the course as an elective only by permission of instructor. Grades S/U for graduates and undergraduates.   CL: 2020.

subject: GLST
name: Introduction to Global Studies Through Literature
description: Given that literature represents real policies and practices in the contemporary world and our ethical responsibility as global citizens, the course will focus on literature from different periods, nations, and regions across the world in order to better understand the way human experiences and different cultures relate. All literature will be read and taught in English.   FS: 04/03/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: GLST
name: Introduction to International Development
description: Critical, historical, and theoretical introduction to modern development practice. Includes extended discussions of contemporary best practices in the field.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: GLST
name: Global Media Industries
description: Provides the foundation for the study of globalized film and media industries.   FS: 11/1/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: GLST
name: History of Capitalism 1: Ancient and Medieval World
description: History of "capitalist" economic behavior and culture in various premodern societies: the Ancient Middle East, Classical Greece, the Roman Empire, early Islamic society, medieval Christian and Islamic states, the Mongol period and the era of global expansionism; evaluation of competing theories about premodern economic life and the meaning of "capitalism"   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: GLST
name: History of Capitalism From the Industrial Revolution to the Global Economy
description: A history of capitalism and its evolving definitions in Europe from the Middle Ages to the 20th Century, including its role in agriculture, mechanical industry, international trade, and colonialism and domination.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: GLST
name: Topics in Global Studies
description: Selected topics in Global Studies.  May be repeated with a change in topic. May be taken three times for credit.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: GLST
name: Global Studies Internship
description: Academic counterpart to a professional work experience in which global or international affairs play a central role. Provides an introduction to foreign affairs and intercultural interactions in a working environment. Introduction to career possibilities for a student trained in global studies.   Global Studies major with 3.0 or better GPA and completion of at least 45 credits.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: GREK
name: Elementary Ancient Greek I
description: Basic grammar and vocabulary necessary for reading Classical and Koine Greek. Assumes no prior experience in the language.   FS:09/08/2021.

subject: GREK
name: Elementary Ancient Greek II
description: Additional grammar and vocabulary necessary for reading Classical and Koine Greek.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: GREK
name: The Greek New Testament
description: Readings in the Gospels and Epistles.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: GREK
name: Plato
description: The life of Socrates based on the reading of Plato’s Apology and Crito in Greek. Supplementary reading in English from Xenophon’s Memorabilia and Aristophanes’ Clouds.   CL: 2020.

subject: GREK
name: Homer
description: Readings from the Iliad and the Odyssey in Greek. Discussion of the language, background, and composition of the poems.   CL: 2020.

subject: GREK
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: GREK
name: Herodotus
description: Readings from the Histories.   CL: 2020.

subject: GREK
name: Thucydides
description: Readings from the History of the Peloponnesian War.

subject: GREK
name: Sophocles
description: Selected plays.

subject: GREK
name: Euripides
description: Selected plays.

subject: GREK
name: Hesiod and the Homeric Hymns
description: Readings from the Works and Days, the Theogony, and the Homeric Hymns.

subject: GREK
name: Greek Seminar
description: Authors and topics not covered in other Greek language courses, chosen to meet the needs of individual students. May be repeated with the approval of the department.

subject: GREK
name: Independent Study
description: Special projects for independent study and research.

subject: GREK
name: Independent Study
description: Special projects for independent study and research.

subject: GREK
name: Intensive Grammar Review of Ancient Attic Greek
description: Intensive review for nonmajors designed to prepare them for GREK 615.

subject: GREK
name: Intensive Readings in Ancient Attic Greek
description: Intensive reading for nonmajors. A review of grammar and syntax with reading of passages from Plato’s Apology. Primarily for graduate students to fulfill the foreign-language reading requirement.    CL: 2020.

subject: HEBR
name: Elementary Hebrew
description: Grammar and practical vocabulary for fundamental communication skills. Assumes no prior experience in the language. Offered only in fall.

subject: HEBR
name: Basic Proficiency in Hebrew
description: Practice and further development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills. Offered only in spring.   CL: 2020.

subject: HEBR
name: Intermediate Hebrew
description: Review of the basic principles of grammar, with emphasis on reading, oral skills, and writing.

subject: HEBR
name: Intermediate Hebrew
description: Review of the basic principles of grammar, with emphasis on reading, oral skills, and writing.

subject: HEBR
name: Conversation and Composition
description: Practical training in the spoken and written language.   CL: 2020.

subject: HEBR
name: Selected Topics
description: Intensive study in selected and cultural topics related to Judaism. May be repeated for credit under different titles. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

subject: HEBR
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: HGEN
name: Genetic Counseling: Career for the Future
description: Introduction to the genetic counseling profession including professional literature and online resources.   Preparation for graduation education in genetic counseling.   FS: 11/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: European Civilization from Ancient Times to the Mid-17th Century
description: The rise and development of European civilization from its Mediterranean origins through the Renaissance and Reformation.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: European Civilization from the Mid-17th Century
description: European development and expansion from the mid-17th century to the present.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Introduction to South Asian History
description: Political, cultural, and economic forces that have conditioned the development of institutions and ideas in South Asia.   FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Introduction to the Civilization of the Islamic Middle East
description: An analysis which treats the major cultural elements of traditional Islamic civilization and then concentrates upon the reactions of the Arabs, Turks, and Iranians to the problems of adjusting to the modern world.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Introduction to East Asian Civilization
description: The evolution of social, political, and cultural patterns in East Asia, with emphasis on the development of philosophical, religious, and political institutions and their relationship to literary and artistic forms in China and Japan.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Introduction to African History
description: An examination of several traditional sub-Saharan African societies and of their political and economic transformation in the modern, colonial, and post-independence periods.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Introduction to Ancient Near Eastern Civilization
description: The political, social, religious, economic, military, and intellectual development of Ancient Egypt, Mesopotamia, and adjoining areas from the origins of civilization until the seventh century A.D.

subject: HIST
name: Science and Technology in World History
description: The development of science and technology and their roles in world civilizations from antiquity to the present.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Introduction to Latin American Civilization
description: A discussion of the political, cultural, and economic forces which have conditioned the development of institutions and ideas in Spanish and Portuguese America.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Conquest, Colonization, and Captivity: A Cultural History of the Americas from 1441 to 1888
description: Comparative examination of conquest, colonization, and human captivity in the history, cultural values, and social ethics of European, African, and Indigenous civilizations in the Americas, 1441-1888.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: HIST
name: United States History to 1865
description: A general survey of the United States from the era of discovery to 1865, emphasizing major political, economic, social, and intellectual developments.     FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: HIST
name: United States History since 1865
description: A general survey of the United States from 1865 to the present, emphasizing major political, economic, social, and intellectual developments.  Honors sections are available for students in the honors program.    CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: American Founding Documents
description: Introduction to Declaration of independence, Constitution, Federalist Papers, Bill of Rights, landmark Supreme Court cases and constitutional amendments; exploration of these texts’ historical context and debates about their meaning.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: HIST
name: History of the American West
description: The history and development of an American region, “the West,” through the narratives of its diverse people and the effects of its complex geography.

subject: HIST
name: The Practice of Public History
description: Introduction to the field of public history. Explores the challenges of portraying history in museums, parks, and other public history venues.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of the Devil
description: A survey of the beliefs and practices associated with the demonic and the Devil from c 500 B.C.E. to the 20th century.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of Crime and Punishment
description: An exploration of the evolution of global practices related to enforcing conformity with societal norms. Examines legal codes, philosophies, and technological devices associated with crime and punishment throughout history.   FS: 02/01/2023.

subject: HIST
name: Introduction to the History Major:  The Historian’s Craft
description: The nature of historical evidence, the formulation of historical questions, the process of historical research, and the construction of historical arguments using primary sources and secondary materials.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: HIST
name: The Ancient Near East to 323 B.C.
description: The formation of ancient Near Eastern cultures, the ultimate synthesis of these cultures and the resulting establishment of the Near East as an historical entity.

subject: HIST
name: Greek History and Civilization to 146 B.C.
description: The origins and development of Greek civilization in its political, economic, social, and cultural aspects with special attention being given to the early and late classical periods and the Hellenistic Age.

subject: HIST
name: Roman Republic and Early Empire
description: The origins of Rome and shaping of its republican government, the spread of Roman rule in Italy and across the Mediterranean, the establishment of the principate and formation of one diverse imperial society and culture.

subject: HIST
name: Late Antiquity: Imperial Rome to Islam
description: Political, social and religious transformation of the Mediterranean world, 2nd to the 8th century., including the rise of Christianity, the decline of Roman power, and the rise of Islam.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Greece and Rome in Film and Popular Culture
description: Representations of antiquity in cinema, television, and other contemporary media, with emphasis on Hollywood’s reception of Greek and Roman history.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Medieval Europe, ca. 300-1492
description: Topics include the formation of monarchies, the rise of Christianity, learning and universities, knighthood and social orders, and heresy and crusades.

subject: HIST
name: Family and Society in Europe, c. 1200-1700
description: Explores the concerns and importance of families in pre-modern Europe. Topics include household furnishings and management, social classes, gender roles, family law, marriages, business, children, feuds, and sexuality.

subject: HIST
name: Magic and Witchcraft in Europe, c. 1200-1700
description: Practices of, reactions against, and ideas surrounding magic and witchcraft during the late Middle Ages and the time of Europe's "Great Witch Craze".   FS: 11/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Age of Renaissance
description: Social, cultural, and artistic movements in Italy and northern Europe from the Black Death (c. 1350) to religious reforms and revolutions (c. 1520).

subject: HIST
name: Age of the Reformation
description: Religious, social, and political reforms from the rise of local religious protests (c. 1450) to the crisis of the 17th century. The rise of Protestantism and reactions in Catholicism.

subject: HIST
name: The Age of Absolutism, 1648-1789
description: A survey of European political, economic, and intellectual development from the age of Louis XIV to the eve of the French Revolution.

subject: HIST
name: French Revolution and Napoleon
description: The changes in France and Europe during the revolutionary decade, the rise of Napoleon, and the establishment of French hegemony over the Continent.

subject: HIST
name: The Enlightenment
description: Intellectual and cultural history of the Enlightenment with particular attention to its relationship with the colonial world and its challenges to eighteenth-century states. Readings focused on primary sources.

subject: HIST
name: Video Games and History
description: History in video games; comparison of selected games with historical scholarship, to assess the validity of the games’ presentations of historical developments and the value of games to the understanding of history.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Rise and Fall of the Athenian Empire
description: Athenian History from Persian Wars through Peloponnesian War.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: HIST
name: Nineteenth-Century Europe
description: Political, social, economic, and intellectual developments from 1815-1900, which brought European culture to its zenith and contributed to Europe's global domination.

subject: HIST
name: Contemporary Europe from World War I to World War II
description: The Great War, revolution, and reconstruction; the rise of authoritarian and totalitarian regimes and the coming of World War II.

subject: HIST
name: Europe from World War II to the Present
description: The Second World War and its origins; the Cold War; European recovery; a divided continent and Europe in the Global Era.

subject: HIST
name: The History of Great Britain I
description: A survey of the political, social, economic, and cultural development of the British Isles from pre-history to the Restoration of 1660.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: HIST
name: The History of Great Britain II
description: A survey of the political, social, economic, and cultural development of the British Isles since 1660.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: HIST
name: The British Empire
description: Examination of the British Empire, tracing various historical themes as regions of world fell under British control, with particular attention to Ireland, India, and sub-Saharan Africa (especially South Africa) in the 17th Century-20th Century.    FS: 4/5/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Slavery and Freedom in the Ancient and Medieval World
description: Exploration of varied forms of servitude in the ancient and medieval Mediterranean; examination of human bondage in the Hebrew Bible, ancient Greece, Roman society, late antique religious teachings, and medieval Christian and Islamic societies; study of ancient slavery in modern political debates, historians’ writings, and television and film.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Byzantine History: 4th to 11th Centuries
description: The political, religious, and military developments within the Eastern Empire including its influence on Western and Slavonic Europe and Islam.

subject: HIST
name: Byzantine History: 11th to 15th Centuries
description: The political and military developments within the Eastern Empire from the invasion of the Seljuk Turks to its final destruction by the Ottoman Turks.

subject: HIST
name: The Crusades
description: Holy war and realpolitik in Mediterranean East-West relations from the 10th through the 15th centuries with emphasis on the role of the crusades in the cultural formation, development, and international relations of East and West.

subject: HIST
name: Nineteenth-Century Britain
description: The political, economic, and social developments in Great Britain and Ireland during the Victorian Age.

subject: HIST
name: Modern and Contemporary Britain
description: The political, economic, and social developments in Great Britain and Ireland during the 20th century.

subject: HIST
name: Black Experience in the United States to 1865
description: The social, cultural, economic, and political life of Black people in the United States to 1865.   FS: 10/06/2021.

subject: HIST
name: Black Experience in the United States since 1865
description: The social, cultural, economic, and political life of black people in the United States since 1865.   FS: 10/06/2021.

subject: HIST
name: France Since 1815
description: A political and social history from the Bourbon Restoration to the present.

subject: HIST
name: The History of Russia from the Earliest Times to the Mid-19th Century
description: The earliest life on the steppe, the Kievan State, the foundations of Moscow, and the Russian empire to the reign of Nicholas I.

subject: HIST
name: The History of Modern Russia and the Soviet Union
description: The decline of Imperial Russia, the Revolution of 1917, Lenin, Stalin, and the Soviet Union since Stalin.

subject: HIST
name: Russian and Soviet Diplomatic History
description: Imperial and Soviet foreign and military policies in the 19th and 20th centuries.

subject: HIST
name: Stalinism
description: Political, economic, social, and cultural development of the USSR from the 1917 Bolshevik revolution until the end of Stalin’s rule.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: HIST
name: Modern Germany
description: A survey of German history including political, cultural, social, and economic developments from unification in 1871 to the present.

subject: HIST
name: The Slavs in History
description: An introductory survey of the civilization of the Slavic peoples. The historical traditions and culture of the peoples that occupy much of the Eurasian continent.

subject: HIST
name: The Fall of the Eastern European Empires
description: Nineteenth-century eastern European states and peoples; the political and social forces leading to World War I.

subject: HIST
name: Eastern Europe Since WWI
description: Survey of states in East-central and Southeastern Europe. Problems of national identity, modernization, and small state politics. Impact of WWII, the Cold war, the fall of communism, and the return to pluralism.

subject: HIST
name: The Middle East in Modern Times
description: The impact of modern civilization upon the Middle East, including the history of the Arab, Turkish, Iranian, and Israeli segments of the Middle East during the 19th and 20th centuries.

subject: HIST
name: North Africa from Colonialism to Revolution: 1830-1962
description: A survey of French North Africa (Morocco, Algeria, and Tunisia) and Libya under colonial rule. The creation, development, and triumph of the nationalist movements, with particular attention to Algeria and its revolution.

subject: HIST
name: The Contemporary Middle East and North Africa
description: Political, social, and economic history of the Middle East and North Africa in the years since World War II.

subject: HIST
name: Saving Africa: Development and Humanitarianism in Historical Perspective
description: Exploration of how and why Africa is often represented as helpless, the colonial origins of common patterns of development and humanitarianism, and other possible models for these processes.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Africa to 1800
description: Social, cultural, economic, and political developments, focusing on internally and externally generated changes.

subject: HIST
name: Africa since 1800
description: Commercial and religious revolutions of the 19th century, imposition and ending of formal colonial rule, and post-colonial issues.

subject: HIST
name: Problems in the History of Africa South of the Sahara
description: Independent readings and written papers on appropriate topics.

subject: HIST
name: Modern East Asia
description: Surveys modern development of East Asia from 1800 to the present.

subject: HIST
name: Late Imperial China
description: Political, economic, social, and intellectual transformations of late imperial China from the Ming dynasty (1368-1644) through the last empire of China, the Qing dynasty (1644-1911).   FS: 12/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: China Since 1949
description: Introduction to the major social, economic, and political changes in China from the Communist Revolution in 1949 to the present.

subject: HIST
name: Japan to 1800: Aristocrats and Warriors
description: The growth of the ancient state and the evolution of the samurai class and its political authority.

subject: HIST
name: Japan since 1800
description: The development of modern Japan: political evolution, industrial growth, social change, war, defeat, and occupation.

subject: HIST
name: Into the Wild: Global Conservation since 1800
description: Global and comparative environmental-historical investigation of the ecological, socioeconomic, and cultural significance of wilderness protection, nature conservation, national parks, and nature tourism; field excursions required.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: East Africa and the Indian Ocean World
description: East Africans’ contributions to an Indian ocean World that transcends single nation-states (stretching from Mozambique and Somalia to the Middle east, India and China) from the deep past to the present, including sections on “piracy,” Islam, slavery, race, and gender.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Gandhi and the Nationalist Movement in India
description: Development of anticolonial thought and political movements in British India from the early nineteenth century onwards. Focuses on Mohandas K. Gandhi, his critics, and Gandhi’s continuing global legacy.   FS: 09/14/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: The Caesars: Rome's First Family
description: Study of Rome’s imperial family from Julius Caesar until the death of Nero.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: HIST
name: History of Capitalism 1: Ancient and Medieval Worlds
description: History of "capitalist" economic behavior and culture in various premodern societies: the Ancient Middle East, Classical Greece, the Roman Empire, early Islamic society, medieval Christian and Islamic states, the Mongol period and the era of global expansionism; evaluation of competing theories about premodern economic life and the meaning of "capitalism"   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of Capitalism 2: From the Industrial Revolution to the Global Economy
description: A history of capitalism and its evolving definitions in Europe from the Middle Ages to the 20th Century, including its role in agriculture, mechanical industry, international trade, and colonialism and domination.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of Airpower
description: The evolution of airpower from the early 20th Century through the early 21st Century. The emphasis is on the development of various theories about the application of aerial force, and how operations in time of war have confirmed or challenged these theories from a multinational perspective.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of Modern Sea Power
description: The evolution of sea power through the development of steam navies around the globe, 1860 CE - 2020 CE.   FS: 03/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Nationalism: Myth and Reality
description: A comparative examination of the origins and development of nationalism and its impact on the modern world.

subject: HIST
name: Nazis and Fascists in European History, 1919-1945
description: German and Italian political movements; emphasis on the role of leadership, propaganda, and ideology. Fascist movements in France, Rumania, Hungary, and Great Britain.

subject: HIST
name: War and European Society, 1914-1945
description: Thematic examination of the nature and impact of total war on European society; emphasis on socio-economic, cultural, and military aspects.

subject: HIST
name: Business in Historical Perspective
description: Capitalism in the Western world; the rise of modern corporate enterprise in Europe and America since 1850.

subject: HIST
name: Urban Experience in Modern Europe
description: Social and cultural impact of urbanization in Europe since 1789 through a comparison of major cities such as London, Paris, Vienna, and Berlin.

subject: HIST
name: Women in Modern Europe
description: Survey of women in European history from the eighteenth to the twenty-first century. Focus on women’s citizenship beginning with Enlightenment idea of rights through developments in modern feminism.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of the Holocaust
description: Introduction to Nazi Germany’s systematic mass-murder of Europe’s Jews and other minorities during World War II.  Examination of forces that led to the Holocaust, including scientific racism, Nazi policy implementation, and dynamics of annihilation during war.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: The Nobel Peace Prize: Peace, War, and Politics
description: Modern history through the lens of the Nobel Peace Prize. Limitations of the Nobel as encouragement to peace.   FS: 02/05/2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of Medicine: Antiquity to the Scientific Revolution
description: A survey of the history of premodern medicine.  How Western cultures of the past approached health and illness; anatomy; nutrition; sexuality; disease and plague; mental and emotional health; and more.  From ancient Greece, through medieval and early modern Islamic, Jewish, and Christian approaches to medicine and the body.   FS: 04/15/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Jewish History I: Late Antiquity to 1500
description: The religious, cultural, social, and political conditions that shaped the Jewish experience in the Near East and Europe from Late Antiquity to 1500.

subject: HIST
name: Jewish History II: 1500 to the Present
description: Case studies of Jewish history in Europe, America, and the land of Israel, 1500 to the present.

subject: HIST
name: The Expansion of Christianity
description: Critical epochs in the spread of Christianity. Consideration of the great crises that shaped the structure and form of Christianity during the last 20 centuries: the Hellenistic world; the medieval syntheses; the breakup of Western Christian unity; the transition to worldwide mission activity in the industrial age.

subject: HIST
name: Islamic Institutions and Traditions
description: The religious, political, social and economic institutions and intellectual and scholarly traditions developed by Muslim societies throughout    Afro-Eurasia from late antiquity to the present.   FS: 12/03/2014.

subject: HIST
name: Messiahs, Mystics and Rebels in the Islamic World
description: Representative messianic movements, millenarian visionaries and apocalyptic imaginings in the Islamic world from the 7th century to the present, with attention to related developments in the Jewish and Christian traditions over the last two millennia.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Kabbalah: Science, Religion and Nature in Western History
description: Historical investigation of kabbalah, a philosophical system and mystical current common to Judaism, Islam and Christianity, from the medieval period to the present; focus on its formative role in early modern Western cosmology and science, and its ecological implications today.   FS: 11/04/2020.

subject: HIST
name: Science, Magic and Religion
description: Occultism as a link between science and religion and its central role in Western intellectual and cultural history; the historical development of the science-magic-religion continuum in the Islamo-Christian world from late antiquity to present.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Engineering in History
description: History of engineering practices, professions, and sciences, as well as development of engineered artifacts from the Middle Ages to the present.

subject: HIST
name: Information Technology: Past and Present
description: The history of the computer; how it acquired various forms through the 20th century; how information, as defined by computers, had shaped the world over the past century.

subject: HIST
name: Making Modern Science: The Physical Sciences
description: The history of physics, chemistry, geology, and related sciences since the Scientific Revolution.

subject: HIST
name: Making Modern Science: The Life Sciences
description: The study of the life from antiquity to the present. Investigates the origins of modern biology and medicine and how life has shaped scientific, political, and economic thought.

subject: HIST
name: History of the Automobile
description: Evolution of the automobile from a conceptual idea through the present-day. Emphasis on analysis of the automobile's impact on culture, economics, the environment, politics, science and technology, and society.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Plagues and Societies in World History
description: A survey of biopolitical, social, economic, and cultural aspects of epidemic diseases throughout world history.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Evolution of Warfare I
description: A history of tactics, strategy, weapons, and logistics from 500 B.C. to A.D. 1400.

subject: HIST
name: Evolution of Warfare II
description: A history of tactics, strategy, weapons, and logistics from A.D. 1400 to the present.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Sustainability in World History from Early Times to the Anthropocene
description: An interdisciplinary examination of sustainability around the world from social, environmental, technological, and economic perspectives from early times to the present.   FS: 03/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: HIST
name: Urban America in the Modern Age, 19th Century-present
description: Survey of the urban history of the United States from the 19th Century through today.   FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: The Development of the American People to 1789
description: The founding of the English colonies, their developing maturity, the events leading to the Revolution, and the creation of a new nation.

subject: HIST
name: The New Nation, 1789-1828
description: The new republic and the developing democratic spirit in politics and culture.

subject: HIST
name: The Sections and the Nation, 1828-1860
description: The three cultures of East, South, and West; their interactions and the events leading to the Civil War.

subject: HIST
name: Civil War and Reconstruction, 1860-1877
description: The political, military, and social history of the War and the reorganization which followed.

subject: HIST
name: The Rise of Industrial America, 1877-1917
description: A survey of recent United States history with emphasis on the economic, social, and literary developments from 1877 to 1917.   FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: The United States and a World at War, 1917-1945
description: The United States and a World at War, 1917-1945.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: United States History Since 1945
description: A survey of the political, economic, social, and cultural developments in the period after World War II.

subject: HIST
name: The Making of Contemporary America: United States History, the 1960s to the Present
description: This course is a survey of social, political, economic, and cultural developments since the 1960s. Students will develop a historical framework for exploring the rights revolution that began in the sixties and seventies, economic changes and transformations, trends in popular culture, the evolution of the media and communication technologies, America’s place in the world.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: HIST
name: The History of South Carolina, 1670-1865
description: A study of South Carolina origins and developments.

subject: HIST
name: History of South Carolina Since 1865
description: A survey of recent South Carolina history with emphasis on social and institutional development.

subject: HIST
name: History of Canada
description: A survey of Canadian development from colony to modern nation.

subject: HIST
name: Voices of America: U.S. History Through Biography
description: Historical exploration of the daily lives and personal stories of Americans through biographies and ethnographies.   FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Histories of Native America
description: Experiences of Native people in North America from the period before European colonization through the 21st Century.   FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Colonial Latin America
description: The establishment and consolidation of the Spanish and Portuguese empires in the Western hemisphere; interaction of Indians, Africans, and Iberians, and the formation of social, economic, and political traditions in Latin America; political independence.   FS: 06/03/2020.

subject: HIST
name: Modern Latin America
description: Traditional society in the area and problems arising from social, economic, and political changes since independence; comparative studies of national responses to these problems.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Social and Economic History of Latin America
description: The evolution of social groups and changes in economic patterns in Latin America from pre-Columbian times to the present.    CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of Mexico
description: Mexico from the pre-conquest period to the present, with an emphasis on modern Mexico.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Caribbean Race and Slavery, 1500-1900
description: The roles race and slavery played in shaping Colonial Caribbean History from the pre-Columbian Civilizations to the end of the 19th century.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: HIST
name: Everyday Life in Colonial America
description: The customs, mores, attitudes, and living conditions of men and women of the 17th and 18th centuries. Emphasis on the common people of the American colonies.

subject: HIST
name: The American Revolution
description: The causes of the Revolution; the events of the period and their implications.

subject: HIST
name: The Old South
description: Development of Southern society and of the forces that made the South a distinctive section of the United States.

subject: HIST
name: The New South
description: Reconstruction, the Bourbon era, agrarian revolt, industrial revolution, racial problems, and the changes resulting from the impact of two world wars and the New Deal (1865-1946).

subject: HIST
name: The Civil War in American History
description: The causes, events, and results of the Civil War.

subject: HIST
name: The Reconstruction of the Nation
description: The events and results of the attempt to reorder the American nation after the Civil War.

subject: HIST
name: Immigration and Ethnicity in America
description: Issues of immigration, assimilation and nativism in the United States, 1840 to 1930.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: American Empire: Policy, Society, and Culture
description: HIST 447 examines the full sweep of American history through the lens of empire, covering especially the linkages between U.S. foreign policy and American domestic culture.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: American Environmental History
description: Interaction of cultural values, economic interests, public policy, and technology with the physical environment over time.

subject: HIST
name: American Popular Culture Since 1890
description: A history of the contributions of the popular aspects of American culture and their interactions with American institutions.

subject: HIST
name: LGBTQ History in the United States
description: Exploration of LGBTQ history and communities in America from the Colonial Era to the present, using lenses of gender and sexuality to understand historical events.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: HIST
name: The History of American Medicine
description: The development of the art and science of medicine as practiced in the United States from colonial times to Medicare. Emphasis on the social history of American medicine.

subject: HIST
name: The History of Science in America
description: The development of science in America from colonial times to the present. Special attention will be given to defining those factors, scientific, economic, and social, which have raised American science to its commanding position in the 20th century.

subject: HIST
name: Technology and American Society
description: The historical development of technologies and technological systems in the American context.

subject: HIST
name: The American Civil Rights Movement
description: Examination of the origins of Jim Crow and the multi-faceted struggle against it, and other  forms of racial inequality, in the American South and the rest of the US since the early 20th century.   FS: 04/02/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: American Thought to 1865
description: The transfer and adaptation of European ideas to a new environment and the development of new patterns.

subject: HIST
name: American Thought since 1865
description: The maturation and extension of a national culture.

subject: HIST
name: Southern Intellectual and Cultural History
description: Intellectual and cultural developments characteristic of the Southern region from colonial times to the recent past.

subject: HIST
name: Jim Crow: Histories & Revivals
description: This course critically examines the continuities and discontinuities between Jim Crow and our current historical and political moment.   FS: 03/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: History of American Women
description: The social, political, and economic roles and changing status of women in America.    CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: American Diplomatic History
description: A historical survey of American foreign policy and foreign relations. First semester: to World War I. Second semester: World War I to the present.

subject: HIST
name: American Diplomatic History
description: A historical survey of American foreign policy and foreign relations. First semester: to World War I. Second semester: World War I to the present.

subject: HIST
name: American Military Experience
description: Transformation of war and of the institutions for waging war from the American Revolution to the present.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Constitutional History of the United States
description: A study of the constitutional development of the United States from the creation of the Articles of Confederation to the Civil War. It deals primarily with problems of governmental organization, judicial interpretation, and sectional politics.

subject: HIST
name: Constitutional History of the United States
description: An analysis of the growth of constitutional power from 1860 to the present, giving special attention to the constitutional problems of the Civil War period, the increasing role of the judiciary in national affairs, and the general extension of constitutional authority in the 20th century.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: HIST
name: American Jewish History
description: Examination of experiences of Jews in the United States from Colonial Period to late 20th century, especially Jewish immigration, political behavior, social mobility, religious affiliation, group identity formation, and meaning of Anti-Semitism in American and global contexts.   FS: 04/02/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Careers in Public History
description: This field-trip based course gives history majors the opportunity to learn about careers in public history through site visits and conversations with practitioners in the Columbia metro area.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: HIST
name: Historic Preservation
description: Overview of historic preservation as the practice of protecting and conserving places that tell stories about the past.   FS: 06/06/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Digital History
description: Introduction to Digital History that examines ways to engage and adapt the discipline of history to technological trends and explores new approaches and interpretive techniques.   FS: 11/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Material Culture in the Digital Age
description: Examination of material culture (objects and artifacts a society produces) as primary sources for historical research; how these sources are transformed when digitized; and the nature of born-digital resources.   FS: 04/02/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Oral History
description: Methodology, application and usage, historic and current literature, identification and examination of available resources.

subject: HIST
name: Internship in Public History
description: Professional practice in museums, archives, preservation organizations, and other agencies involved in historical research, advocacy, and preservation of historical resources and history programming for public audiences.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Topics in History
description: Reading and research on selected historical subjects. Open only to juniors and seniors with permission of the instructor.

subject: HIST
name: Topics in History
description: Reading and research on selected historical subjects. Open only to juniors and seniors with permission of the instructor.

subject: HIST
name: Topics in History
description: Reading and research on selected historical subjects. Open only to juniors and seniors with permission of the instructor.

subject: HIST
name: Senior Seminar
description: Principles of historical research and writing as applied to the seminar topic. Open to history majors or by special permission of instructor.    CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Senior Seminar
description: Principles of historical research and writing as applied to the seminar topic. Open to history majors or by special permission of instructor.    CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Senior Thesis
description: Principles of historical research and writing. A senior year thesis related to one of the advanced courses in the major program.    CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: The Middle East and the United States: 1800 to the Present
description: Political, cultural, and economic ties which have linked the Middle East to the United States. Middle Eastern views of these relationships and their impact on modern Middle Eastern history.

subject: HIST
name: Topics in History
description: Reading and research on selected historical topics. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: South Carolina History
description: South Carolina since colonization.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: The American South Comes of Age
description: Changes in the Southern region since 1940.   CL: 2020.

subject: HIST
name: Historic Preservation Field Experience--Charleston, S.C.
description: On-site introduction to historic preservation including research, interpretation, management, and economics of preservation. Offered only in Charleston during summer term.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Introduction to Health Promotion, Education, and Behavior
description: The historical and philosophical basis, current problems, career opportunities, and literature in the health promotion, education, and behavior change professions.

subject: HPEB
name: Practicum in Health Promotion
description: Practical experience in applying health promotion principles in the community or organization.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Personal and Community Health
description: Psychosocial health, stress management, leading infectious and noninfectious diseases, nutrition, physical fitness, sexuality, consumer health and health care access, environmental health, aging, and death.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Health Education for the Elementary School
description: Methods and materials for elementary schools. Integration and correlation of materials with school subjects. Sample content developed for primary, intermediate, and upper grades.

subject: HPEB
name: First Aid and Emergency Preparedness
description: Emphasis upon preparing school personnel to act responsibly in emergency situations. Includes the American National Red Cross standard and advanced first aid instruction.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Independent Study
description: Enrollment and topic to be approved in advance by advisor and instructor. Open to sophomores and above.    CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Health Education
description: Methods of teaching health in school and community settings; techniques and strategies.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Safety and Safety Education
description: Place of safety in modern life. Contributing factors to accidents, developing an awareness of the potential accident situation with special emphasis upon school setting, planning for and conduct of a safety education program.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Principles of Global Health
description: Examination of major global health topics and approaches used by governmental, non-governmental, international institutions and donor agencies to improve health in low and middle income countries.  Critical analysis and generation of intervention strategies to combat health issues in various country settings.

subject: HPEB
name: Social Determinants of Health
description: The social, cultural, economic, and political factors that influence health and its distribution within and between populations.  How society helps shape our health beliefs, behaviors, and status.   FS: 02/05/2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Food Systems
description: Multiple dimensions of food systems along multiple dimensions of theory and practice.  Restricted to Junior or Senior level standing.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: HPEB
name: Food Systems Capstone Seminar
description: Synthesis and application of content and competencies of the minor in nutrition and food systems in a practical setting with emphasis on student identified areas for professional growth.  Restricted to Senior level standing.   FS:  11/6/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Special Topics in Health Promotion, Education, and Behavior
description: A study of special topics in health promotion, education, and behavior. Individual topics to be announced in master schedule by title.    FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Human Sexuality Education
description: Planning, implementation and evaluation of effective sexuality education programs. Includes strategies for educating about a variety of sexuality topics (e.g., reproductive biology, relationships, HIV/AIDS, sexual orientation, pregnancy, childbirth, and parenting).     CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Applied Aspects of Human Nutrition
description: Application of nutrition principles including functions of food and nutrients in health and disease prevention throughout the life cycle. Applied topics include weight management, food safety, and other contemporary issues.

subject: HPEB
name: Health Problems in a Changing Society
description: Promoting individual and community health in an ever-changing society with a focus on prevention.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: HPEB
name: Southern Discomfort: Public Health in the American South
description: Investigation of the unique health and disease profile of the American South, including regional disparities that remain unresolved despite a public health revolution. Topics range from endemic diseases of the antebellum period to the current HIV/AIDS crisis, and ethics of research.

subject: HPEB
name: Race, Ethnicity, and Health: Examining Health Inequalities
description: A comprehensive overview of race/ethnicity and health. Class discussions will focus on comparing health status and health outcomes of different racial/ethnic groups in the U.S. and discussing possible explanations for inequalities from a behavioral science perspective.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: The Total School Health Program
description: A course designed to acquaint the student with the various facets of the modern school health program. Includes school responsibilities for health and safety instruction, school health services, school environmental health problems, school and community relationships, resources for health, and evaluation of programs.

subject: HPEB
name: Drug Prevention
description: Nature of drug actions, motivational factors that influence the use and abuse of drugs, and examination and evaluation of procedures to provide effective drug prevention efforts.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Tobacco Prevention and Control in Public Health
description: Examines policies and practices for tobacco prevention and control in public health.     CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Consumer Health in Contemporary Society
description: An analysis and appraisal of issues related to the production and distribution of products and services as these activities affect consumer health.

subject: HPEB
name: Behavioral Concepts and Processes for the Health Professional
description: The development of interpersonal skills in dealing with health clients in various settings.

subject: HPEB
name: Medical Anthropology: Field Work
description: Application of observation techniques, field notes, informant interviewing, and secondary data analysis to interpreting differential perceptions of health problem solving in the community and clinic.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Medical Anthropology
description: Socio-cultural factors in health, illness, healing, and in medical systems. Cross-cultural and ethnographic evidence for public health research and program applications.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Community Health Problems
description: Identification and analysis of major community health problems, their causes, the roles of individuals, community agencies, and government in affecting their solutions. Emphasis upon personal involvement and the responsibility for community health.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: HPEB
name: Managing Stress
description: Conceptualizing the nature of the stress; psychological, emotional, and spiritual aspects of stress; competency in the active management of stress and mobilizing support.

subject: HPEB
name: Cooking Up a Storm: Food, Globalization, Localization, and Health in the South
description: The role of food in defining our relationships to our family, community, nation, and world. How food underlies much of the political, economic, and social struggles throughout the world.   FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Nutrition Through the Life Cycle
description: Examination of nutritional concerns, requirements, and metabolism from pre-conception through the aging process; analysis of cultural, environmental, psychosocial, physical, and economic factors affecting nutritional status through the life cycle; and methods for assuring adequate nutrition through dietary selection, promotion of healthy eating throughout the life cycle and nutritional assessment for each state of the life cycle.

subject: HPEB
name: Maternal and Child Health
description: Public health issues, social and behavioral science, policies, programs, and services related to maternal and child health in the United States and other countries.    CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender (LGBT) Health
description: Health status and concerns of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender communities. Includes an examination of measurement issues and methodological considerations in research, as well as intervention efforts targeting LGBT populations.     FS: 10/02/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Health Promotion for Elementary and Middle School Teachers
description: A multimedia course emphasizing health education strategies for major S.C. health problems, risk factors, and concepts of positive health behavior.

subject: HPEB
name: Behavioral Economics in Public Health
description: The ways behavioral economics can help achieve goals in public health and health care.  How behavioral insights can be applied to reach promotion aims ranging from achieving weight loss to medication adherence to appointment attendance.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Nutrition Assessment and Counseling
description: Assessment of nutritional outcomes and work with research participants/patients. Methods for collection of dietary data, anthropometry, and body composition, including the use of new technologies. Nutrition counseling and interviewing techniques useful in gathering nutrition information.

subject: HPEB
name: Maternal and Child Nutrition
description: A survey of current concepts in clinical and public health nutrition which are unique to infants, children, and pregnant and lactating women.

subject: HPEB
name: Social Networks, Social Capital, and Health
description: Examination of health sciences and sociological research on social networks, social capital, and health. Theoretical and methodological foundations for network analysis of social relationships and health, design of public health interventions, and use of online social networks to promote health. Key constructs include social support, social capital, and social diffusion.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Addressing Childhood Obesity through Community Approaches
