description: Approaches for prevention of childhood obesity, using perspectives from public health, social work, exercise science, pharmacy, medicine, and behavioral nutrition.  Training to teach diet/physical activity lessons in elementary school settings.   GC/FS: 06/19/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: Laboratory Techniques in Physiological Measurement
description: Practical laboratory skills and theoretical bases of measurements in human physiology; bioelectrical potentials, respiratory physiology, energy expenditure, body composition, temperature regulation, and biochemical assays.

subject: HPEB
name: Contemporary Topics in Sexual Health
description: Comprehensive overview of contemporary topics in sexual health.   FS: 12/3/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: HPEB
name: HIV/STI Prevention
description: The role of effective behavioral interventions in preventing the spread of the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and other sexually transmitted infections (STI) among diverse populations.

subject: HPEB
name: Independent Study
description: Topics to be assigned and approved by advisor and department head.

subject: HPEB
name: Selected Topics in Health Education
description: A study of selected issues confronted in health education programs.

subject: HRSM
name: HRSM Professional Development Seminar
description: Strategies, tactics, and requisite skills for career success in the hospitality, retail, sport, entertainment, and technology industries. Course must be taken prior to HRSM internship.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: HRSM
name: Leadership Development in HRSM
description: Examination of effective techniques and practices of leadership development in the hospitality/tourism, retail and sport/entertainment industries.    FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: HRSM
name: Event Production, Evaluation, and Analysis
description: This course examines and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of events in Hospitality, Tourism, Sport, Entertainment and Fashion and Retail Management industries. Event production, evaluation, and analysis will be conducted. Detailed activities involved in event production, evaluation, and analysis will be discussed and implemented.    FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRSM
name: Internship
description: The internship is a supervised work experience in the student’s major area of study.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRSM
name: Senior Seminar
description: Integration of prior academic work through the examination of problem inquiry, conduct of research, application of a solution development and the completion of a research paper.   FS:  10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Introduction to Hospitality Industry
description: History, growth, developments, and future opportunities in the hospitality industry.

subject: HRTM
name: Breads, Pastas and Sauces
description: Hands-on training in the basic foundations of breads, pastas, and sauces.  Basic bread types, pasta shapes, pasta sauces, food safety, and new techniques to create personalized dishes.

subject: HRTM
name: Breakfast
description: Hands-on training in the basic foundations of meal preparation, simple breakfast staples, egg cookery, alternative breakfasts, basic food safety, and new techniques to create personalized dishes.

subject: HRTM
name: Cooking for Two
description: Hands-on training in the basic foundations of cooking complete dinners for two people.  Includes effective purchasing, appetizers, complete meals, proper table set-up, desserts, and special meal ideas.

subject: HRTM
name: Desserts
description: Hands-on training in the basic foundations of meal preparation, staple dessert items, basic  food safety, and new techniques to create personalized dishes.

subject: HRTM
name: Introduction to Healthy Mediterranean Cooking
description: Basic elements of the traditional Mediterranean diet, cooking techniques, and how to cook and eat to stay fit and healthy.

subject: HRTM
name: Introduction to Cooking
description: Hands-on training in the basic foundations of meal preparation, cooking basics, simple sauces, complete meals, staple dessert items, basic food safety, and new techniques to create personalized dishes.

subject: HRTM
name: Simply French
description: Hands-on training in the basic foundations of meal preparation, French cooking basics, simple sauces, complete meals, staple dessert items, basic food safety, and new techniques to create personalized dishes.

subject: HRTM
name: Simply Italian
description: Hands-on training in the basic foundations of classical Italian dishes, including sauteing, frying, and braising, basic food safety, and new techniques to create personalized dishes.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Tailgating 101
description: Hands-on training in the basic foundations of classic tailgating dishes, including grilling, frying, and braising, basic food safety, and new techniques to create personalized dishes.

subject: HRTM
name: ServSafe Sanitation
description: Food safety and sanitation in a commercial kitchen operation.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Special Topics in Culinary Arts
description: Special topics within the culinary discipline designed to give students a hands-on approach to learning special techniques, cooking styles and preparation, and practical application used in the foodservice industry. Content varies by title. May be repeated.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Purchasing and Controls
description: A study of the major foods, beverages, and supplies that are purchased in hotels, motels, and food-service establishments as well as techniques on how to control their distribution within the operation.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality Management
description: Tools available to management and their utilization in the hospitality industry.

subject: HRTM
name: Hotel Management
description: Students will gain an overview of the hotel industry by exploring each of the major sectors of this industry including lodging, food & beverage, and housekeeping.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Spa Management
description: Basic introduction to the spa segment with an overview on establishing a spa business, operations and management, business skills, and knowledge of future trends in the industry.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: HRTM
name: Quantity Food Production
description: The basics of food production from storeroom to consumer. Various techniques of storage, preparation, merchandising, and menu-planning, as well as the many aspects of service. One lecture and three laboratory hours per week.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Introduction to Beverage Management
description: Introduction to Beverage Management, is an introductory course designed to give students a broad understanding of the beverage industry.     FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: HRTM
name: Foundations of Tourism
description: Basic introduction to the social science of tourism in the US and the world, including definitional issues, motivations for travel, factors influencing demand-side and supply-side growth, the tourism product, market segmentation and marketing, socioeconomic, and ecological impacts, and destination life cycle dynamics.  May not be used to satisfy Carolina Core requirements for HRTM majors.   FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Club Management
description: Unique problems and issues associated with private club management.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality and Tourism Practicum
description: Supervised full-time work experience in an area of the hospitality and tourism industry, selected by the student and approved by the practicum coordinator. 400 hours required for 6 credit hours, 200 hours required for 3 credit hours.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: HRTM
name: Sustainability in the Hospitality Industry
description: The basic fundamentals of sustainability throughout the hospitality industry will be explored.   This includes the various segments ranging from hotels and resorts, foodservice, casinos, and cruise ships to the functional departments such as human resources or financial reporting.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Nutrition
description: The utilization of food by the body; menu planning and food production for institutions in relation to regular and modified diets.

subject: HRTM
name: Personnel Organization and Supervision
description: Recruitment, selection, utilization, and development of human resources; role of supervisors in management and personnel administration.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Software Applications for the Hospitality Industry
description: Using microcomputer software in various areas of the hospitality industry.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Physical Plant Design
description: Design, equipment, and maintenance of hospitality facilities.

subject: HRTM
name: Hotel and Restaurant Law
description: A comprehensive overview of laws and regulatory agencies governing the lodging and food services industries.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: HRTM
name: Wedding Planning and Management
description: Sociocultural, political, economic, religious, and legal influences on wedding planning and business strategies will be explored as background to practices relevant to successful wedding planning and consultancy for diverse clients.

subject: HRTM
name: Conference and Meeting Planning
description: Planning and managing conferences and meetings in the tourism industry.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Restaurant Food Production Management
description: Management techniques and operating problems in food service operations. One lecture and five laboratory hours per week.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Catering Management
description: Management techniques, including planning, production, and performance of off-premise catering.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Wine, Beverage and Culture
description: This course provides a broad base of knowledge, covering all commercially relevant beverages including origins, tradition and culture.   FS: 03/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Contract Foodservice Management
description: Issues related to the management of contract foodservice accounts.

subject: HRTM
name: Travel and Destination Management
description: Describes role of travel agencies, tour operators, tour guides, transportation providers, and attractions as critical sectors within the travel industry.   FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Travel and Tourism Law
description: This course focuses on legal issues affecting the tourism industry, including international travel law, travel litigation, liability, and topics specific to travel agencies, carriers, attractions, and destinations.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Ecotourism
description: Focuses on tourism that is nature-based and entails a learning component while being managed for environmental, economic, and sociocultural sustainability.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Cultural and Heritage Tourism
description: The effective presentation, development, management, and marketing of cultural and heritage tourist attractions, including battlefields, plantations, and pilgrimage sites.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Tourism Festival Planning and Management
description: Planning, marketing, sponsorship, budgeting, management, impacts, and evaluation of successful and sustainable special tourism festivals are discussed from both a theoretical and practical perspective.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Cruise Ship Industry
description: Organization, market segmentation, marketing, design, anatomy of experience, environmental and social impacts, health and safety, and trends within cruising.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Resort Development and Management
description: Examines effective practices in the sustainable planning, development, and management of resorts and spas, including host community relations, social effects, design, marketing, operations, finance, and recreation programming.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: International Tourism Field Experience
description: An experiential field trip where students evaluate selected tourism issues and products in an international destination.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Special Topics in HRTM
description: Concepts, issues, and trends in the hospitality and tourism industry.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head is required for undergraduate students.

subject: HRTM
name: HRTM Current Issues
description: Issues and problems concerning the hospitality industry.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality Financial Management
description: Financial decision making including ratio analysis, asset management, leverage, short, intermediate, and long-term financing in the hospitality industry.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Sustainable Foodservice Systems
description: Factors affecting the food supply in the United States and world. The class will explore the economic, political, legal, and societal forces affecting the distribution system of our food supply.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Services Management for Hospitality and Tourism
description: Management issues pertinent to quality service delivery in hospitality and tourism organizations.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality and Tourism Marketing
description: Application of marketing principles and promotional techniques to the hospitality and travel industry.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality Sales Management
description: Basic sales management policies and procedures within the hospitality industry with emphasis on sales planning, preparation, presentations and client contact within hospitality organizations.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Current Issues in Nutrition
description: Basic nutrition concepts as a foundation to address nutrition, health trends, concerns, and current nutritional issues in the modern world.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Club Cuisine and Service
description: Advanced topics in the management of production and service techniques for private clubs.   FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Wines and Spirits in Food Service Establishments
description: Management overview and operating problems of beverages in the hospitality industry.

subject: HRTM
name: Craft Beer
description: Study of craft beer through exploration of current trends, countries of origin, beer styles, flavor profiles, food flavor pairings and best business practices. Students must be 21 years old.   FS: 12/07/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Analytical Techniques in Tourism and Hospitality
description: Examination and application of analytical and research methods to tourism and hospitality problems.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Sustainable Tourism Planning and Policy
description: Principles and practice of tourism planning fostering sustainable tourism development at international, national, state, regional, local and site levels.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Tourism Economics
description: Macro- and microeconomic dimensions of tourism are considered in relation to the demand and supply of tourism products at the national, state, regional, and local levels.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Sustainable Tourism
description: Principles and practices of environmental, economic, and sociocultural sustainability in tourism are described and analyzed.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality Management Strategies
description: Students utilize knowledge gained from previous coursework combined with contemporary strategic management and leadership practices to identify, analyze, and solve problems in the highly competitive and dynamic hospitality business environment.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality and Tourism Internship
description: Structured industry practical experience in a hospitality or tourism company. 400 hours required.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality Human Capital and Talent Management
description: This course will help students learn and apply concepts comprising talent management, including the role that talent management plays in the strategic management of hospitality and tourism operations, diversity, recruitment, selection, training and development of talent within the organization, as well as performance management for hospitality supervisors and management.   FS: 11/04/2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Revenue Management in the Hospitality Industry
description: Examination of revenue management in the hospitality industry with an emphasis on the theory and dynamics of revenue management, the implementation of capacity management, forecasting and discounting.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Diversity and Inclusion in the Hospitality and Tourism Industry
description: Multicultural, multiracial, and multiethnic factors within the hospitality and tourism industry.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: HRTM
name: Theme Park and Attractions Management
description: This course will give students an overview of the theme park and attractions industry. We will explore each of the areas of this industry including: history, venues, resources, ride operations, merchandising, food service and design.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Security Management of Hotels and Restaurants
description: Individualized security programs, procedures, legal issues, and review of local, state, and federal laws that apply to the lodging and restaurant industry.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Advanced Lodging Management
description: Advanced principles of the management of hotels and resorts.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Advanced Meeting Management
description: Analysis of current issues and problems in the meetings industry with emphasis on planning, organizing, managing, and enhancing meetings.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: International Lodging Management
description: Analysis of the structure of international lodging companies, challenges of marketing U.S. lodging companies abroad, and cultural differences in international management.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Timeshare and Vacation Ownership Management
description: Management of the timeshare and vacation ownership industry.

subject: HRTM
name: Managing Food Service Operations
description: An advanced study of the food-service industry and its operations both internally and externally to the physical plant.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: The Global Business of Beverage Management
description: The Global Business of Beverage Management, exploring the global beverage industry from product management perspective, from raw materials to end user.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Advanced Topics in Wine
description: A viticultural and enological study of wine and wine regions around the world; from the vineyard to the table including grape varietals, wine regions and wine service.  Students must be 21 years old.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Franchising within the Hospitality Industry
description: This course will focus on the study of multi-unit and franchise operations within the hospitality and tourism industry.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: HRTM
name: Adventure Travel Management
description: Analysis of the adventure travel industry throughout the world, with emphasis on the management, marketing, and operation of an adventure travel business.

subject: HRTM
name: Tourism Information Technology Issues
description: Information technologies such as e-commerce, e-marketing, and e-research are examined, critiqued, and applied within a tourism context.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: HRTM
name: Advanced Club Management
description: Advanced topics in hospitality management for the club industry.   CL: 2020.

subject: HRTM
name: Special Topics in HRTM
description: Advanced concepts, issues, and trends in the hospitality and tourism industry. May be taken twice for degree credit.

subject: HRTM
name: Golf Tourism
description: Effective practices used in the planning, development, and promotion of golf tourism. Experiential learning component for evaluating selected issues, problem solving, and participating in the operational performance of a large golf tournament.  Employment with a pre-approved golf tournament or permission of instructor.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Golf Tourism Consumer Services
description: Examines superior customer service in high-quality business operations for a mega golf- tourism event; includes an experiential learning/fieldwork component.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Golf Tourism Supervisory Skills
description: Examines basic supervisory skills in high-quality business operations for a mega golf-tourism event; includes an experiential learning/fieldwork component.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Golf Tourism Leadership Skills
description: Examines management and leadership skills in high-quality business operations for a mega golf-tourism event; includes an experiential learning/fieldwork component.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Hospitality and Tourism Management Field Study
description: Immersive study of international/domestic hospitality or tourism companies in a specially chosen host country or region of the United States. Students must have a minimum GPA of 2.0; no pending or past judicial council infractions.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: HRTM
name: Global Travel and Tourism
description: Study of the economic, social, cultural, political, and environmental considerations of international tourism management and development.   CL: 2020.

subject: HSPM
name: Independent Study
description: Enrollment and topic to be approved in advance by advisor and instructor.   CL: 2020.

subject: HSPM
name: Health Economics
description: Designed to serve as an introduction to economic principles and applications used in the health sector. The role economics plays in various aspects of health care, demand-side and supply-side factors and issues, how various health care systems are impacted.   FS: 11/1/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: HSPM
name: Special Topics in Health Services Policy and Management
description: Emerging issues in Health Services Policy and Management. May be repeated for a total of 6 credit hours as content varies by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: HSPM
name: Introduction to Health Care Management and Organization
description: Provide students with overview of health services management, management techniques and the different roles and functions of the different health care services. Use of field trips and guest speakers from different health care providers.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: HSPM
name: Fundamentals of Rural Health
description: Overview of the delivery and financing of health care in the rural U.S., with emphasis on vulnerable rural populations and access to care.

subject: HSPM
name: Comparative Health Systems and Health System Efficiency, Effectiveness, Sustainability and Equity
description: Comparative health systems of the world including health system organization, management, financing, resource use and health outcomes.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: HSPM
name: Issues in Health Care Information Management
description: An introduction to data management in healthcare institutions for undergraduate students and non-HSPM major graduate students. Topics include the nature of medical data, legal protections surrounding such information, and basis strategies for managing information technology resources.   CL: 2020.

subject: HSPM
name: Introduction to Health Services Delivery and Policy
description: Overview of health services delivery in the United States, including organization and financing of health care, health insurance practices, primary and long-term care among other topics.

subject: HSPM
name: Finance in Health Administration
description: Introduction to health care finance. Course will teach reimbursement structures, regulatory mechanisms, cost control, and related factors unique to healthcare organizations.    CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Introduction to International Business
description: Provides an introduction to frameworks, tools, and factual knowledge useful for understanding the institutional and competitive environment and managerial challenges of firms engaged in international business. Restricted to business administration majors. International business majors excluded.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Globalization and Business
description: The business opportunities and threats for individuals, companies, and countries created by the growth of globalization, and how companies must operate in diverse foreign environments and engage in specialized transactions.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: IBUS
name: International Financial Management
description: The financial management of a multinational business enterprise.   FS: 03/06/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Marketing
description: Cultural, legal, political, and economic factors affecting international marketing of products and services. Emphasis on differences in life styles, beliefs, attitudes, etc., and their influences upon marketing decisions.   FS: 04/06/2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Entrepreneurship
description: Develop a business plan for a global startup, integrate international strategy into the business model and financing strategy, analyze the costs of internationalization.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Information Systems
description: An examination of the challenges and opportunities associated with the development, management, and use of global information systems.

subject: IBUS
name: International Human Resource Management
description: This course examines how human resources are managed within a global context. It examines how human resources are managed within global firms as well as across different cultural settings.

subject: IBUS
name: Business Anthropology
description: Analyze the relevance of anthropological theory for business, diverse business cultures, and their impact on global business practices.   FS: 11/1/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Foreign Market Entry and Growth
description: International market selection, global market entry, and growth and regional expansion strategies. Topics covered through readings, case studies, and an international marketing simulation game.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Cross-Cultural Behavior and Negotiations
description: Understanding of cross-cultural differences and their effects on individual behavior and business practices in organizations.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Exporting and Importing
description: The conduct of international trade, including terms of sale (INCOTERMS), financing arrangements, means of payment, credit insurance, shipping and insurance issues, support services, and trade facilitation.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Competitive Strategies in Developing Countries
description: Strategies multinational companies use to compete in developing countries. Topics include management of political risk, impact of culture, and corporate responsibility and ethics.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Global Competitive Analysis
description: The course examines how to leverage the competitive advantage of the firm to another country, access comparative advantages of another location, and link these two to create cross-country advantages.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Global Stakeholder Management
description: Survey of the managerial, political, economic, sociological and psychological foundations of global stakeholder management and engagement through extant theory and case study examples of successful and failed stakeholder management strategies in various industries and multiple countries.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Islamic Economics and Finance
description: Introduction to Islamic economics and financial systems and their relationship to multinational corporations and international business.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Comparative Innovation Systems
description: To analyze how innovation is approached by firms in different institutional climates around the world.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Research in International Business
description: This seminar introduces students to research issues related to conducting studies in a cross-cultural setting. Students also develop an awareness of current international research programs.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Intercultural Competencies for Working in International Teams
description: How to recruit, lead, and collaborate more effectively in international teams by examining differences related to culture, work-values, economic climate, and career progression.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: The Business Case for Services Offshoring
description: How to formulate and present a professional judgment on a corporate initiative (like services offshoring) with a sound business case based on the elements of cost, benefit, risk, and strategic flexibility.   FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Economic Globalization: Leadership and the Transnational Mindset
description: Explore evolving and emerging issues facing international business leaders in the 21st century to develop a greater understanding of economic globalization and the intersection of the public, private, and non-profit sectors and their interrelationship with particular emphasis on security.   FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Social Networks and Global Leadership
description: Survey of social network theories and evidence, such that you are able to better identify, build, and navigate the social settings in which your career unfolds. Concepts are applied to several case studies of multinational enterprises to illustrate the network coordination challenges of global business.   FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Market Development and Global Strategy
description: Theoretical and comparative empirical perspectives on the roles of state and business in the development of emerging markets, sociopolitical frameworks of economic reform, and the impact of business strategies on development.    FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Risk Management and Security Strategies in International Business
description: An interdisciplinary understanding of how multinational enterprises interact with political, sociocultural and economic environments worldwide and the ability of leaders to develop effective strategies in navigating complex security risks.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: IBUS
name: Business in Latin America
description: Discussion of the contemporary business environment of and business practices in the countries of Latin America.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Business in Asia
description: Discussion of business environments and business practices in countries in Asia.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Business in Europe
description: Discussion of business environments and business practices in the countries from Western, Central, and Eastern Europe and Russia.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Business in Africa
description: Discussion of business environments and business practices in the countries of Africa.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Specialized Study in International Business
description: Topics in international business. Reading and research on selected topics in the practices in the international business environment. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Internship in International Business
description: Supervised work experience as approved by the department. Three hours of academic credit. Pass-Fail only. Not for major credit. Can be taken as audit as an alternate grade mode. Internship contract required.   FS: 02/01/2023.

subject: IBUS
name: International Financial Management
description: The financial management of a multinational business enterprise.   FS:  11/03/2021.

subject: IBUS
name: International Marketing
description: Cultural, legal, political, and economic factors affecting international marketing of products and services. Emphasis on differences in life styles, beliefs, attitudes, etc., and their influences upon marketing decisions.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: IBUS
name: International Entrepreneurship
description: Develop a business plan for a global startup, integrate international strategy into the business model and financing strategy, analyze the costs of internationalization. No prerequisite for MIB Graduate students.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: IBUS
name: Social Networks and Global Leadership
description: A survey of social network theories and evidence that provide theoretical, empirical and practical examples of how different social network configurations achieve different function goals. Concepts are applied to case studies of multinational enterprises to illustrate the network coordination challenges of global business.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Ethnographic Methods in International Marketing
description: Analyze the relevance of anthropological theory for business, diverse business cultures, and their impact on global business practices.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: IBUS
name: Comparative Innovation Systems
description: To analyze how innovation is approached by firms in different institutional climates around the world.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: IBUS
name: Business in Latin America
description: Discussion and analysis of business environments and business practices in the countries of Latin America.    FS: 09/11/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Business in Asia
description: Discussion and analysis of business environments and business practices in the countries of Asia.    FS: 09/11/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Business in Europe
description: Discussion and analysis of business environments and business practices in the countries of Europe.    FS:  09/11/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Business in Africa
description: Discussion and analysis of business environments and business practices in the countries of Africa.   FS: 09/11/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Specialized Study in International Business
description: Topics in international business. Reading and research on selected topics in the practices in the international business environment.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Financial Management
description: An intensive study of international financial management. Topics include investment analysis, financing decisions, taxation, foreign-exchange risk policies, joint ventures, transfer pricing, financing of trade, and financial control of international operations.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Marketing
description: Marketing management of the international operation stressing the viewpoint of the marketing manager who must recognize differences in market arrangements and in legal, cultural, and economic factors in different countries.

subject: IBUS
name: Comparative Corporate Governance
description: Systematically compare and contrast corporate governance systems across a variety of countries.   GC: 04/27/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Global Business Management
description: Examines the management of strategic, structural and informal processes within multinational corporations, and how to lead a global workforce.   GC: 12/11/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Nations States, Regional Networks and Global Markets
description: Introduces conceptual frameworks to understand globalization and the changes taking place in the international political economy, and the interactions of governments and global organizations.   GC: 04/27/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Business Legal Environments
description: Practical knowledge and skills to operate effectively and avoid unexpected losses when doing business in international markets under a foreign legal system.   GC: 04/27/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Global Corporate Valuation
description: Application of key corporate valuation models in evaluating different business situations facing multinational corporations.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Consulting and Organizational Development in MNCs
description: Restructuring and transformation initiatives within multinational organizations as internal consultants and/or change agents.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Entrepreneurship
description: Develop a business plan for a global startup, integrate international strategy into the business model and financing strategy, analyze the costs of internationalization.   GC: 11/28/2022.

subject: IBUS
name: East/West Business
description: International investment, joint venture, trade and technology transfer relationships between the advanced industrial systems of the U.S., the E.C.,    and Japan and socialist economies of the former Soviet Union, Eastern Europe, and China.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Business Negotiations
description: Examines how decision makers in business and government settings manage the process and outcomes of negotiations. Cross-cultural negotiations in a global business environment.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: International Business and Sustainable Development
description: An introduction to international environmental and social management issues that affect an organization’s sustainable development initiatives.

subject: IBUS
name: Data Analytics for International Business
description: Research issues related to conducting studies in a cross-cultural setting, to develop an awareness of current international research programs.   GC: 04/27/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: IBUS
name: Organizational Misconduct and Global Corruption
description: Broad survey of core conceptual frameworks and organizational theories that explain corporate misconduct in domestic markets as well as corruption in foreign markets.   GC: 11/22/2021.

subject: IDST
name: Introduction to Interdisciplinary Inquiry
description: A study of the history, philosophy, and theory of and modes of inquiry in interdisciplinary studies.

subject: INTL
name: Study Abroad – USC Exchange
description: Keeps a USC student active while on a pre-approved USC exchange program.

subject: INTL
name: Study Abroad–Non-USC Program
description: This course keeps a USC student active while on a pre-approved non-USC study abroad program.

subject: INTL
name: Study Abroad–Through Another U.S. Institution
description: This course keeps a USC student active while on a pre-approved non-USC study abroad program through another U.S. institution of higher education.

subject: ISCI
name: Introduction to Information Science
description: Major concepts, principles, theories, issues, and trends in the development of Information Science.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Introduction to Information Literacy and Technology
description: An introduction to the basic information technologies used in all types of information organizations and the essential concepts and skills needed for information literacy.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Using Information Resources
description: Introduction to information services and sources available in print and electronic format. Techniques for locating, evaluating, and using information resources basic to academic work.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Information Design
description: Overview of responsive website design, development and basic content management systems. Examine the current tools and standards and learn how they function together in a modern web environment. Emphasis on the myriad of viewing devices and specific reference to the unique needs of information intensive institutions.    FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Information Storage and Retrieval
description: Introduction to the concepts, issues, theories, and techniques of information storage and retrieval systems.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Research Methods in Information Science
description: Overview of major types of research methods and techniques within the field of information science. Methods of data analysis, evaluation of published research, and ethical principles.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Information Policy
description: Problems and ethical issues that arise in the development and implementation of information policies in Information Science.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Blockchain and Cryptocurrency
description: Introduces blockchain technology and its applications in various professional areas, businesses, and industries. No prior blockchain knowledge is required to be successful in this foundational course.   FS: 02/01/2023.

subject: ISCI
name: Blockchain, Privacy, and Decentralization
description: Introduces bitcoin, cryptocurrency, data privacy, self-sovereign identity, and other blockchain concepts and applications with in the context of professional areas, businesses, and industries. No prior blockchain knowledge is required to be successful in this foundational course.   FS: 02/01/2023.

subject: ISCI
name: Children’s Literature
description: A study of materials for children from birth through elementary school (age 13) with emphasis on the evaluation, selection, and use of those materials to meet the educational, cultural, and recreational needs of children.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Introduction to Computer Technology & Applications for Info Env
description: The basic information technology concepts and applications relevant to library and related information environments.   Unique information technology needs and applications of information-intensive organizations.    FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Cyber Security and Information Science
description: This course provides students with essential skills and training in information and cyber security leading to the option to complete the CCSA certification process through Check Point Software Technologies.   FS: 02/01/2023.

subject: ISCI
name: Special Topics in Information Science
description: Examination of selected current and emerging topics in the field of information science and data analytics. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Introduction to Management Within Information Environments
description: History, development, and implementation of theories and practices associated with managing information environments.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Knowledge Work as an Organizational Asset
description: Introduction to the background, principles, practices, and technologies of knowledge management for library and information professionals.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Social Informatics
description: Examines the design, uses, and effects of information and communication technologies (ICTs) from the standpoint that society and technology mutually shape one another.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Information and Communication Needs and Assessment
description: An overview of the communication models, major concepts, trends, and other related issues of information transfer with a focus on information seeking and use in digital age.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Information Management for Journalists
description: Online resources specific to mass communications, research strategies, organization and creation of digital information.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: User-Centered Information Architecture
description: Processes and techniques for designing user-centered information systems on the Web. Issues of needs analysis, content development, cognitive models, human-computer interaction, interface design, and usability testing.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Introduction to Knowledge Discovery
description: The students will review knowledge discovery basics concepts, techniques, tools, and applications. This course is project based and the students will develop new Wikipedia pages by reading papers in a selected domain.    FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Planning and Sustaining Digital Projects
description: Theoretical and technological foundations of building the digital information infrastructure. Emphasis on technical aspects of managing digital assets for Intranet and Internet use.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Competitive Intelligence
description: Strategies and techniques for locating competitive intelligence information.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Information Issues in Community Institutions
description: Problem of identifying or defining cultural heritage and the issues and problems in preserving, accessing, and managing cultural heritage information.  Issues such as copyright/ownership, technical problems of preservation and intellectual access, and the different ways in which libraries, archives, museums, zoos and other cultural heritage institutions operate.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Emerging Topics in Information Science
description: Examination of selected current and emerging topics in the field of information science. May be repeated once for credit as topics vary.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Independent Study in Information Science
description: Independent study in an area of information science relevant to the students professional goals. May be repeated once for credit as topics vary.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Internship in Information Science
description: Supervised field experience in an information agency relevant to students professional goals. Approval of the appropriate internship application must be submitted early in the semester preceding enrollment.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Teaching and Training in Distributed Environments
description: Knowledge and skills for applying complementary technologies for learning in distributed learning environments (Pre-K-lifelong) through lecture, demonstration, and discussion.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Materials for Early Childhood
description: Media resources and techniques for children from birth to 9 years. Reading interests and developmental needs of young children. Authors, illustrators, indexes, bibliographic tools, evaluation sources, and professional literature. Not open to students enrolled in M.L.I.S. program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Materials for Children
description: Media resources for children. Reading interests of children and their curricular and independent needs for information. Authors, illustrators, indexes, bibliographic tools, and sources of evaluation of materials for children. Techniques and literature for read-aloud programs and storytelling. Not open to students enrolled in M.L.I.S. program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Materials for Adolescents
description: Media resources for adolescents. Reading interests of adolescents and their curricular and independent information needs. Study of relationships of media to information needs and critical comparison between classic and contemporary materials for adolescents. Indexes, bibliographic tools, and sources of evaluation of materials. Not open to students enrolled in M.L.I.S. program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Special Topics in Library and Information Studies
description: Specific topics of current concern to the library, information, and media professions to be identified by title. Not open to students enrolled in M.L.I.S. program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Applications of Information Technology and the Infrastructure
description: Introductory knowledge for school library media specialists, teachers, administrators, parents, and other citizens interested in practical applications of information technology to support learning, decision making, and community building.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Knowledge Discovery Techniques
description: Knowledge discovery techniques and applications.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Information Visualization
description: Foster theoretical insights about data visualization. Prepare temporal, geospatial, and textual data for visual representations. In hands-on sessions, students practice data visualization techniques and apply them in a wide range of real-world scenarios.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Storytelling: Theory, Practice, and Development
description: Storytelling methods, techniques, and materials encompassing heritage, art, literature, and programming.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Information Behavior and Practices
description: Focuses on theories, models, and concepts of information behavior. Emphasizes information seeking and use practices and activities in relation particular communities, channels and barriers to information, and the impacts of technology. Provides an introduction to methods that can be used to study information needs, information seeking behavior, and related phenomena.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: News Literacy
description: Addresses the renewed phenomenon of fake news, misinformation/disinformation, and its related concepts; then focuses more explicitly on the affective information behaviors that influence our interactions with information and help us intellectually thrive in a post-truth society.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Ethics, Values, and Foundational Principles of Library and Information Science Professions
description: Introduction to the issues and core values of library and information professions, including equity of access, literacy and learning, information policy, collaboration, service, professional growth and development, and culturally responsive practice.   GC: 12/13/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Leadership in Information Organizations
description: Introduction to the nature, development, roles, and fundamental issues of leadership in library and information organizations.   GC: 12/13/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Research Design and Evaluation
description: Introduces the research process as applied to library and information science topics with an emphasis on research methods, critical evaluation, and the practical application of research.   GC: 12/13/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Fundamentals of Data and Digital Communications
description: A comprehensive overview of data science basics and applications for communications. Introduces basic concepts, applications, and tools of data science for communication purposes. Includes basic theories and approaches in communications.    GC: 03/22/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Design and Management of Databases
description: Databases used in libraries and other information agencies, including operational and functional design. Extensive hands-on evaluation of selected database software packages.   GC: 12/13/2021.

subject: ISCI
name: Internship in Library and Information Science
description: Supervised field experience in library, media center, or other information agency relevant to student’s professional goals.   GC: 04/25/2022.

subject: ISCI
name: Independent Study in Library and Information Science
description: Independent study in an area of library and information science relevant to the student’s professional goals.   GC: 04/25/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Elementary Italian
description: Grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Basic Proficiency in Italian
description: Practice and further development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Accelerated Basic Proficiency in Italian
description: Accelerated development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills to obtain the Basic Proficiency Level in Italian.  Credit may be received only for one of the following:  ITAL 121 and ITAL 122, or ITAL 130.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Intermediate Proficiency in Italian I
description: Practice and rapid development of accurate skills in speaking, listening, reading and writing. Features BBC television course.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Intermediate Proficiency in Italian II
description: Practice and further rapid development of accurate skills in speaking, listening, reading and writing. Features BBC television course.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Accelerated Intermediate Italian
description: Accelerated development of intermediate level listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills in Italian.  Credit may be received only for one of the following: ITAL 221 and ITAL 222, or ITAL 230.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Italian Conversation
description: Oral practice with advanced protocols of Italian conversation, focusing on perfecting rhythms and tonalities, and on a clear presentation of meaning.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Writing in Italian
description: Introduction to letter, short essay, and creative writing, and to newspaper reports and selected essays as models of self-expression.

subject: ITAL
name: TEATROMANIA: Italian Theater Practicum
description: Project work in the production of plays in Italian. Includes readings in and public performance of Italian theatre and related materials.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ITAL

description: Cultural analysis of the issues facing immigrants and their descendants in Italy, as well as the development of Italian American Culture in the United States. Through films, original texts, secondary literature, and contemporary media will be explored. Taught in English.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Advanced Italian Study Abroad
description: Intensive language practice, emphasizing oral proficiency skills and advanced conversational protocols. Classroom instruction by native speakers, extensive contact with native environment, field trips. May be repeated for credit by permission.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Survey of Italian Literature I (1200-1850)
description: Introductory course of Italian Literature that covers canonical authors and key literary, cultural, and historical movements in Italy from 1200-1850.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Survey of Italian Literature II: 19th-21st Centuries
description: Survey of significant writers, works, and cultural movements in Italian Literature from 1850 to the present day.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Selected Topics
description: Intensive study of selected literary and cinematic topics of the Italian world. May be repeated for credit as topic varies by title. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: ITAL
name: Contemporary Italian Civilization
description: Significant values in the Italian cultural heritage, as presented in native print and visual media.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Italian Food Culture: Adaptability and Sustainability in Italian and Global Food Systems
description: Italian Culture Course on Italian and Global Foodways as studied through the lens of climate change and sustainability.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Twentieth Century Italian Literature
description: Selected plays, short stories, novels and poems which characterize quality achievements by Italians, and which promote a better understanding of Italian life.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: The Italian Love Lyric
description: Italian love poetry, beginning with the "Dolce Stil Nuovo" of the late Middle Ages and ending with post-WWII avant-garde poetry.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Business Readings in Italian
description: Selected literature from the Italian business world, such as correspondence, brochures, specialized newspapers and magazines, biographies of businessmen, prospectuses, and annual reports.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Advanced Conversation and Composition
description: Prepares students for making lengthy formal reports in Italian, both written and oral, on topics of importance for success within an Italian environment.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Italian Literature in Translation
description: Italian writers, focusing on the works of Dante, Petrarch, and Boccaccio, with additional selections from later authors.

subject: ITAL
name: Post-World War II Italian Cinema
description: Italian films of high esthetic value that present major cultural concerns of post-WWII Italians. Skills in film criticism and analysis. Films are subtitled. Taught in English.

subject: ITAL
name: Senior Project
description: Directed independent research project, with a formal presentation and public discussion.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Machiavelli and Renaissance Florence
description: Italian political and literary history course focusing on Machiavelli’s major publications and their meanings with regard to the cultural and political goals of the Renaissance in Italy.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Cercasi Umore: Understanding Italy
description: Comparative Italian/American literature and culture course examining the differences between humoristic texts in Italian and American cultures.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: The Italian Novella
description: Italian literature seminar tracing the history of the short story from its Italian origins through the twentieth century.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: ITAL
name: Independent Studies in Italian Literature
description: Special topics in Italian literature.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITAL
name: Independent Studies in Italian Literature
description: Special topics in Italian literature.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Thriving in the Tech Age
description: Pervasive impact of computers on today's global society; skills and strategies for using technology.  How information technologies impact daily life and drive change.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: ITEC
name: Advanced Business Document Preparation
description: Emphasis on production and versatility in preparing business documents. Not for TSTM majors. For business teacher certification.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Program Design and Development
description: Fundamental algorithms and processes used in business information systems. Development and representation of programming logic. Introduction to implementation using a high-level programming language.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Introduction to Computer Hardware and Software
description: Understanding of current computer hardware and software through computer building, repairing, and troubleshooting.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Business Communications

subject: ITEC
name: Word Processing Concepts and Technology
description: Introduction to word processing concepts and applications.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Introduction to Networking

subject: ITEC
name: Computer Applications in Business I
description: Survey of core skills and techniques for spreadsheet design and analysis of business problems.   FS: 11/1/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Introduction to Databases
description: Fundamentals of modern database design and applications.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Records Control
description: Analysis and control of office records including creation, processing, maintenance, protection, and disposition.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Cybersecurity Operations
description: Operations in Security Operations Centers (SOC). Securing information systems by monitoring, analyzing, detecting, and responding to security events.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: ITEC
name: Professional Internship Seminar
description: Preparation for professional internship.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ITEC
name: Software Design
description: Survey of core software development principles, application development from pseudocode and flow charting through coding process.    FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Introduction to Web Systems

subject: ITEC
name: Database Systems in Information Technology
description: Survey of techniques for working with enterprise-level database systems.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Special Topics in Information Technology
description: Advanced concepts, issues, and trends in information technology. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be taken twice for credit.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Introduction to Human Computer Interaction
description: Human computer interaction:  human factors of interactive software, methods to develop and assess interfaces, interaction styles, and design considerations.   FS:  12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Advanced Networking
description: Advanced administration of client/server networks with major emphasis on network operating system software.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Management of Information Technology
description: Overview of current practices and trends in end-user technology and information system management.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Mainframe Systems
description: Introduction to the large scale computer systems used by businesses to support thousands of simultaneous users and process millions of transactions.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Job Control Language
description: Programming in job control language used to process batch jobs on mainframe computers.  Use of standard system utility programs.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Special Topics in Information Technology
description: Advanced concepts, issues, and trends in information technology. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. Satisfies IIT elective requirement. May be taken three times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: ITEC
name: Information Technology Security for Managers
description: Information technology security from a managerial perspective, including security awareness, risk assessment, and security policy development.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Professional Internship
description: Internship coordinated by a faculty member and supervised by an approved business supervisor. Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head is required for undergraduate students.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Emerging Information Technology Trends
description: Survey of emerging information technology (IT) trends, featuring IT industry professionals presenting disruptive and emerging information technologies being developed and/or adopted by businesses within South Carolina.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ITEC
name: Advanced Human Computer Interaction

FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: ITEC
name: Training Systems
description: Theory, design, and implementation of technology-based training systems, including hardware and software solutions.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Telecommunications
description: Telecommunications systems, applications, and equipment allowing for the global dissemination of information.    FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Linux Programming and Administration
description: Shell scripting and administration in the Linux operating system.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: ITEC
name: Project Management Methods
description: Project management principles and standard practices, including software applications for project management.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Advanced Web Support Systems
description: The development of advanced, dynamic, Web-based information systems, including the integration of back-end database-records management systems.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Capstone Project for Information Technology
description: Application of project management software, technologies, and practices to the design and implementation of real-world capstone projects.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Database Management and Administration
description: Introduction to database administration and implementation using an enterprise-level Relational Database Management System (RDBMS).   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Special Topics in Integrated Information Technology
description: Advanced concepts, issues, and trends in technology support and training management. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated twice for credit.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: ITEC
name: Management of Health Information Systems
description: Overview of health information technology, electronic health records (EHR) , and health information exchange (HIE), current practices, trends, and issues in health information systems management, and privacy and security of health information.

subject: JAPA
name: Elementary Japanese
description: Grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills. Assumes no prior experience in the language.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Basic Proficiency in Japanese
description: Practice and further development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills. Admission only by successful completion of Japanese 121.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Intermediate Japanese I
description: Review and continuation of fundamentals of the language; development of oral and reading skills.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: JAPA
name: Intermediate Japanese II
description: Review and continuation of fundamentals of the language; development of written and oral expression.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Reading and Writing Japanese
description: Acquisition and advancement of kanji literacy and writing skills. Development of foundational skills to review basic kanji and to aid in inferring the meaning of higher level kanji. Covers 250 kanji characters with complementary instruction through many mediums (brush writing, postcards, meishi).    FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Introduction to Japanese Culture
description: Introduction to Japanese culture through an examination of cultural elements such as traditions, arts, history, geography, people, society, and religion. Taught in English.

subject: JAPA
name: Advanced Japanese I
description: Improvement of skills in conversation and composition; advanced reading in modern Japanese materials.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: JAPA
name: Advanced Japanese II
description: Continuation of JAPA 321, with emphasis on strengthening proficiency in the use of Kanji.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Japanese for Business I
description: Development of language skills specific to the Japanese business world and its practices.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Japanese for Business II
description: This is a continuation of JAPA 331.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Introduction to Japanese Culture and Literature
description: Introduction to Japanese literature and its cultural background.  Conducted in English, but some background of Japanese is recommended.

subject: JAPA
name: Modern Japanese Literature
description: Survey of modern Japanese literature and its cultural background up to the present. Conducted in English, but some knowledge of Japanese is required.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Japanese Culture and Society through Film
description: Examination of Japanese culture and contemporary society using selected films. Taught in English.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: JAPA
name: Japanese Culture and Society through Theatre
description: Introduction to Japanese traditional theater and its influences on Japanese culture and society. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Japanese Culture and Society through Animation
description: Examination of Japanese culture and contemporary society through studying of popular animations. Taught in English.

subject: JAPA
name: Selected Topics
description: Intensive study of selected topics in Japanese literature and culture. May be repeated for credit as topic varies by title. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: JAPA
name: Advanced Japanese III
description: Development of proficiency in speaking, reading, and writing through advanced studies of authentic Japanese materials.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Advanced Japanese IV
description: Strengthening proficiency in writing and reading.   CL: 2020.

subject: JAPA
name: Japanese Language in Society
description: Japanese language and communication in its socio-cultural context; emphasis on comparison with American English. Taught in English.

subject: JOUR
name: Media and Society
description: Principles, history, philosophies, theories of the mass media and allied professions and their societal role and impact.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Principles of Public Relations
description: Methods used by business, government, consumer groups, minorities, environmentalists, and others to influence public attitudes toward their activities.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Principles of Advertising and Brand Communications
description: An introduction to the advertising and strategic communications industries.  Discussion of the structure and history of the business, social impacts and regulation, research, planning, creative, media planning, sales promotion, event promotion and the integrated nature of all promotional communication.

subject: JOUR
name: Principles of Visual Communications
description: Theory and history of visual communication in the mass media emphasizing informational and persuasive messages created by graphic, photographic, and multimedia processes.   FS: 4/12/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Principles of Journalism
description: Principles and foundations of journalism to reflect both how journalism serves communities and how its techniques are developed to effectively communicate to audiences.   FS: 03/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: History and Philosophy of the Mass Media
description: Development of the mass media in the United States from colonial times to the present. The effects of American social, cultural, political, and economic theory on the media.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Special Topics in Mass Communications
description: Readings, critical review, discussion and analysis addressing significant issues in mass communications. Topics may change from term to term. May be repeated for credit with different course topics.   FS: 06/03/2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Account Planning: Mining Insights
description: Topics include data mining from secondary sources, and use of primary research tools such as surveys, focus groups, ethnography and projective techniques.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Jobs in the Sports Media
description: Exploring different jobs in sports media with a focus on careers within the fields covered by the degree programs within the School of Journalism and Mass Communications.   FS: 06/07/2023.

subject: JOUR
name: Sports Activism and Media
description: Analysis of prominent sports activism cases and exploration of issues of access, economics, race, religion, gender, culture and nationality, through the lens of media coverage.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: JOUR
name: Special Topics in Sports Media
description: Topics addressing issues in the world of the sports media. Topics may change from term to term. May be repeated for credit with different topics.   FS: 06/03/2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Live Television Sports Production
description: This course is designed to introduce students to all aspects of live television production of various venue sporting events. Through readings, lectures and hands-on experience, students will learn how major broadcast networks produce live sports events.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Journalism Trends
description: Study and analysis of current and emerging issues in journalism philosophy and practice and how audiences perceive it. Emphases may change as practices evolve and issues emerge.   FS: 06/03/2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Social Media and Society
description: Analysis of major social media sites and the role they play in informative and persuasive communications.  Review of key platforms, what makes them successful as well as concerns about their impact and misuse.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: JOUR
name: Writing for Mass Communications
description: Basic writing skills for all areas of the mass media. Lecture-laboratory.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: JOUR
name: Law and Ethics of Mass Communications
description: Examination of First Amendment free speech and press guarantees and limitations, including commercial speech regulation, libel, privacy, copyright, trademark and open records and meetings, and related ethical principles for mass communications professionals.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Internet and Social Media Law
description: Examination of the origins and history of First Amendment and related law and ethics, with an emphasis on how they apply to the Internet and social media.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Theories of Mass Communications
description: Survey of predominant theories in mass communications including mass media uses, functions, and effects.

subject: JOUR
name: Media, Sports and Race
description: Exploration of the intersection of American media, sports and race.   FS: 12/01/201.

subject: JOUR
name: Media and Youth
description: An introduction to media uses and effects research, considering cognitive, affective, and social development as a framework for analyzing media effects on youth.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Hip Hop, Media and Society

subject: JOUR
name: Minorities, Women, and the Mass Media
description: The study of the relationship among persons of color, women, and the mass media in the United States.    FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: JOUR
name: Toolkit for Concept Development
description: Students will learn the theories and methods of applying consumer and brand insights to creative briefs and concepts.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Toolkit for Brand Communication: Creative Execution

subject: JOUR
name: A Focused Look at Brand Communications
description: Topics in advertising and strategic communications. Individual topics and prerequisites to be announced with title.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Advertising and Brand Communications Speakers Series
description: Advertising and brand communications industry experts share insights about industry trends, innovative campaigns and careers.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Social Media Marketing Strategy

subject: JOUR
name: Mass Communications Research
description: Fundamentals of mass communications research methods and applications. Survey, observational and experimental research; primary research data-gathering techniques; secondary research sources; data analysis; message, market, competitive and audience research measures.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Public Relations for Nonprofit Organizations
description: Theory and practice of developing public relations strategies and messaging for nonprofit organizations with a focus on audience research, donor relations, membership recruitment and fund raising.   FS: 02/02/2022.

subject: JOUR
name: Special Topics in Public Relations

subject: JOUR
name: Social Media for Sports Media
description: Effective social media use in the world of the sports media. Topics relating to advertising, journalism, public relations, visual communications, and mass communications will be discussed. Provides contextual background on various social media and uses exercises to develop best practices.   FS: 06/03/2020.

subject: JOUR

subject: JOUR
name: Gender, Sexuality, and Sports Media
description: How the sports media culture helps create and maintain, as well as challenge, inequalities based on gender and sexual identity. Students will learn how gender and sexuality are constructed through sports media and how they intersect with race, class, able-bodiedness and nationality.   FS: 11/04/2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Graphics for Visual Communications
description: The personal computer and software related to the design and production of graphic and photographic images for print and onscreen media.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Photography for Visual Communications
description: Introductory photography that includes digital SLR camera use, multiple lenses, lighting, editing and distribution for web and display. Emphasis is on storytelling images for publication in editorial and persuasive media.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Creative Thinking and Problem Solving
description: This course introduces the fundamental principles of creative behavior. Theoretical and practical methods of problem-solving as well as discovery, evaluation, and implementation of new ideas.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Introductory Reporting and Writing
description: Basics of news reporting: Story generation, critical thinking, story development, writing, shooting and editing broadcast stories, writing Web stories, using visual components of still pictures, graphics and video.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Introductory Reporting and Writing Lab
description: Basics of news reporting: Story generation, critical thinking, story development, writing, shooting and editing broadcast stories, writing Web stories, using visual components of still pictures, graphics and video.   FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Editing
description: Skills and techniques required in preparing stories for publication. Laboratory work includes editing various kinds of copy and writing headlines.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Social Media and Mobile Journalism
description: This course provides an introduction on how to use online social platforms and mobile tools following journalistic editorial guidelines. Students will get an overview of the digital-first mindset that informs and enriches their professional preparation.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Business Basics for Communications
description: Students will gain a fundamental understanding of business and how write about it. Students will learn how various aspects of business, finance and the economy relate to individuals, communities, companies, governments and world events and how to communicate that impact.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Professional Perspectives in Business Communications
description: These classes focus on specific areas of business communications to either deepen students’ understanding of the subject or improve their ability with a particular skill (reporting, writing, editing, videography, social media, etc.). These topics may change from term to term.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: JOUR
name: Social Media Planning
description: An introduction to social media planning and digital media analytic skills, includes survey and analysis of content and strategies based on social media insights.   FS: 02/03/2021.
