description: A comprehensive survey of the basic principles of management applicable to all forms of business. The course provides the student with a basis for thinking about complex business situations in the framework of analysis of the management process.

subject: MGMT
name: Entrepreneurship and New Venture Opportunities
description: A study of central issues in entrepreneurship with grounding in the entrepreneurial process. The course emphasizes the creation, recognition, and assessment of entrepreneurial opportunities, as well as the role of business models and resources in enabling the pursuit of such opportunities.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGMT
name: Strategic Human Resource Management
description: A survey of the major approaches used in managing human resources. Covers selection, compensation, legal compliance, discipline, organizational restructuring, TQM, motivation, labor relations, and performance management.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Employee Engagement
description: Introduction to human behavior in organizations. Emphasis on factors that contribute to the effectiveness of individuals and groups in organizations.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Negotiation and Conflict in the Workplace
description: This course is designed to improve students' knowledge and skills in the areas of workplace conflict resolution and negotiations.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Managing Teams in the Workplace
description: Team dynamics in organizational settings; basic concepts of interpersonal behavior, how to facilitate effective teamwork and create, motivate, and participate in effective teams based on concepts in team design and team process.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Leadership in Organizations
description: Reviews research and practice in organizational leadership; provides students with self-assessment, developmental exercises, and case studies to prepare students for leadership roles.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Compensation and Retention
description: An examination of how organizations use pay and other types of rewards (both intrinsic and extrinsic) to affect employee motivation and behavior.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Talent Management
description: An examination of how organizations can improve workforce quality by making effective use of recruiting and selection processes. Attention is also given to the training and development of new hires and to legal issues that surround the staffing process.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: International Human Resource Management
description: This course examines how human resources are managed within a global context. It examines how human resources are managed within global firms as well as across different cultural settings.

subject: MGMT
name: Corporate Social Responsibility and Stakeholder Management
description: This course examines the role of corporate social responsibility in managing organizations. Attention is given to the role of stakeholder management and ethics in organizational decision-making.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Diversity and Inclusion
description: An introduction to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Topics include the nature of workforce diversity and inclusion, practices that enhance diversity, inclusion, and effectiveness, and approaches for building inclusion.    FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Analytics for the Human Resources Professional
description: Metrics and measurements of HR concepts; processes through which knowledge is gained; tools and techniques for gathering and analyzing data; and critical thinking centered on whether findings are likely to be reproducible and trustworthy.    FS: 10/02/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Intercultural Competencies for Working in International Teams
description: How to recruit, lead, and collaborate more effectively in international teams by examining differences related to culture, work-values, economic climate, and career progression.   FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Entrepreneurship and Small Business
description: This course is an introduction to the ownership and management of small firms, emphasizing their role in the U.S. economy, their particular demands on owners, and the effects of newness and smallness on their managers' decisions.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Developing and Launching New Ventures
description: Explore business models and paths to commercialization for new ventures and concepts through experimentation; investigate strategies to develop and validate the business model; identify the resources needed to launch the venture and methods for acquiring those resources.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGMT
name: Executing Strategy in New Ventures
description: Influencing the performance of new ventures through the strategies, metrics, and resources needed for their development, monitoring, and funding.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGMT
name: Collective Bargaining
description: Practice and structure of collective bargaining, and administration of collective agreements, law of union-management relations, labor history, and bargaining theory and practice.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Strategic Management
description: A study of the formulation and application of functionally integrated business policy by top management. Emphasis is on decision making in the face of changing conditions.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Advanced Issues in Entrepreneurship
description: Through immersive projects, students apply entrepreneurial concepts, tools, and frameworks to advance a new or established venture.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGMT
name: Special Topics in Management
description: Current topics, issues and practices in various areas of Management.  Course may be repeated up to three (3) times as content varies by title.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Business Internship in Management
description: Supervised work experience as approved by department. Generally three hours of academic credit, but upon special request of supervising professor and approval of appropriate area director, an internship may carry a maximum of six hours credit, however, only three hours may apply towards major credit. Pass-Fail only. Internship contract required.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Special Topics in Management
description: Current topics, issues and practices in various areas of Management. Course may be repeated up to four (4) times as content varies by title.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Human Resources and the Global Firm
description: An analysis of human resources practices viewed from a comparative, cross-national perspective and the perspective of a multinational enterprise.     GC: 03/26/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGMT
name: Employment Relations Law
description: The law of employment relations. Policy and practice in areas such as equal employment, wages and hours, employee health and safety, pensions, and labor relations.

subject: MGMT
name: Human Resource Metrics and Research
description: Applied data analysis and research methods in human resources. Emphasis on research design, analytic strategies, measurement of human resource variables and outcomes, and presentation of written and oral information.

subject: MGMT
name: Competing Through People
description: Development of an understanding of behavioral concepts necessary for effective production management of organizations. Current literature, case studies, and other simulations to demonstrate applicability of concepts. Concepts studies include perception, motivation, leadership, and intergroup conflict.

subject: MGSC
name: Computer Information Systems in Business
description: An introduction to the effective use of information systems tools in day-to-day business communications, analysis, and decision making.

subject: MGSC
name: Applied Statistics for Business
description: Descriptive statistics, topics in probability, statistical inference and modeling. Emphasis on the collection, summarization, analysis, and reporting of numerical findings relevant to business decisions and economic analysis.   FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Program Design and Development
description: Fundamental algorithms and processes used in business information systems. Development and representation of programming logic. Introduction to implementation using a high-level programming language.   FS: 3/1/2017.    CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Business Information Systems
description: Introduction to the planning, development, and management of Business Information Systems (BIS) and related information technologies in organizations. Topics include hardware, software, database, telecommunications, and the Internet.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Applied Statistical Modeling
description: Multiple regression, ANOVA, forecasting, quality control, and nonparametric techniques. Emphasis is on the application of these statistical models in business decision making.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGSC
name: Quantitative Analysis for Business Decision Making
description: Quantitative approaches for managerial problem solving and decision making. Formulation, solution, analysis, and interpretation of spreadsheet-based models for common business decision-making situations. Optimization, simulation, decision analysis.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Advanced Management Science
description: Advanced topics in management science; stochastic models, nonlinear programming, dynamic programming, Markov processes, and multiple criteria decision models.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Data Analytics for Business
description: Extracting, transforming, visualizing, and analyzing data to support business intelligence and decision making. Business analytics, relational database management, principles and applications of data visualization.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Operations Management
description: Management of activities/resources that result in the production of competitive goods and services in the global market place. Integrates cross-functional concepts from marketing, finance, and management.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGSC
name: Applied Problem Solving and Programming
description: Systematic problem definition, solution formulation, and computer implementation for business and related areas. Internet and database applications. Programming exercises in a high-level programming language.

subject: MGSC
name: International Information Systems
description: An examination of the challenges and opportunities associated with the development, management, and use of global information systems.

subject: MGSC
name: Special Topics in Management Science
description: Current topics, issues and practices in various areas of Management Science. Course may be repeated up to three (3) times as content varies by title.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Business Process Management
description: Course entails learning and applying cutting-edge concepts and techniques of business process analyses to process improvement initiatives such as reengineering, lean, and six-sigma.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Service Operations Management
description: Course focuses on the management of service operations, with considerable attention paid to cutting-edge quantitative techniques. Topics covered include facility location, waiting line management, and revenue management, among others.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Global Sourcing Strategies and Application
description: Course covers skills necessary to pursue sourcing-related careers in manufacturing, services, retailing, and government agencies, including discussion of cutting-edge negotiation and global sourcing strategies pursued in exemplar firms.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Innovation and Design
description: Creation and launch of viable businesses using innovation tournaments. Development of problem solving and design skills. Application to real innovation and entrepreneurial hurdles.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGSC
name: Sustainable Operations & Supply Chain
description: This course explores how operations managers can analyze and make decisions regarding the interaction of operations activities on the environment.  Students will learn various tools to enable better decision making within the sustainable operations realm.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: MGSC
name: Information Systems Analysis and Design
description: Analysis and design of business information systems using modern tools, techniques, and methodologies.   FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Supply Chain Management
description: This course examines principles governing an integrated supply chain that includes the cross-functional processes of sourcing, inventory management, and logistics. Key tools for managing supply chains will also be discussed.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Logistics, Transportation and Distribution
description: This course is designed to provide a body of knowledge, technical know-how, and standards for those in the logistics, transportation and distribution industries.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGSC
name: Business Telecommunications
description: Identifies and explains the principal technologies, concepts, and techniques currently applied in the business data communications field. Current and future hardware and software technologies, networking, protocols, and the OSI Model are covered.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Supply Chain Planning and Execution
description: Managing the flow of materials from suppliers to customers; supply chain concepts, terminology, and relationships; processes used to develop operations plans.   FS: 06/01/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: GSCOM Capstone Project
description: Course entails executing projects that apply OSC concepts to solve significant operational or supply-chain problems at simulated or actual firms. Teams write recommendation reports and oversee sourcing strategies pursued in exemplar firms.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MGSC
name: Project Management for Business
description: An introduction to the qualitative and quantitative approaches to the management of projects as well as a review MS Project software.    FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Forecasting and Time Series
description: Time series analysis and forecasting using the multiple regression and Box-Jenkins approaches.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: MGSC
name: Statistical Quality Control
description: Statistical procedures for process control including CUSUM and Shewhart Control Charts, and lot acceptance sampling.   FS: 04/07/2021.

subject: MGSC
name: E-Commerce Concepts and Research Topics
description: Social, technological, commercial, marketing, and political implications of current and impending tends in E-Commerce.   FS: 11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Simulation of Business Systems
description: Theory and design of business simulation experiments, development and use of computer simulation models, and analysis of data generated by computer simulation experiments.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Analysis of Decisions Under Uncertainty
description: Theory and practice of making decisions in an environment of uncertainty; development of skill in the assessment of preferences and probability distributions.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Strategic Management of Information Systems
description: Strategic management and use of information systems in organizations.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Database Management for Business
description: Technology overview and principles of database design for business applications. Enterprise database administration and planning. Design exercises and projects using the latest database management systems software.

subject: MGSC
name: Quantitative Foundations for Business and Economics I
description: Calculus and classical optimization methods applied to problems in business and economic analysis; matrices, derivatives, and integrals in the analysis of both univariate and multivariate business and economic models.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Quantitative Foundations for Business and Economics II
description: Statistics and probability theory applied to problems of business and economic analysis.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Quantitative Methods I
description: Probability and statistics necessary for graduate study in economics and business administration; estimation, hypothesis testing, regression, analysis of variance, and nonparametric methods.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Quantitative Methods II
description: Decision models useful in business and economics; linear programming, sensitivity analysis and duality, network models, integer programming, dynamic programming, inventory and queuing, and simulation.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MGSC
name: Advanced Quantitative Methods in Business
description: Practical applications of statistical, optimization, heuristic, simulation, and other quantitative techniques for analyzing problems of contemporary business interest in the areas of manufacturing, services, and supply chain management.    GC: 05/10/2021.

subject: MGSC
name: Innovation and Design
description: Creation and launch of viable businesses using innovation tournaments.  Development of problem solving and design skills. Application to real innovation and entrepreneurial hurdles.   GC: 05/10/2021.

subject: MKTG
name: Principles of Marketing
description: Principles and concepts underlying marketing functions, including the conception, pricing, promotion, and distribution of products and services and the role of marketing in society.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Consumer Behavior
description: The consumer decision process, with emphasis on consumer decision making, satisfaction/dissatisfaction factors, perception, learning, group influences, and marketing strategy implications.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: MKTG
name: Principles of Marketing Research
description: Investigates the theory and practice of marketing research with emphasis on the problem-oriented nature of marketing research and how research activities are implemented by marketing researchers and used by managers.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: MKTG
name: Sales Strategy
description: Understand the fundamentals of the sales process and how to ensure client engagement.  Learn follow-up skills that will help you in every walk of life.  Learn the fundamentals of effective business communication (voicemail, email, and hand-written).     FS: 06/01/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Sales Automation and Customer Management
description: The context, tools and conceptual understanding of the technology-related and managerial expectations of an entry level sales representative.   FS: 06/01/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Pricing Strategy and Analytics
description: An in-depth understanding of the fundamentals of pricing strategy formulation and implementation.   FS:  06/01/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Data Science for Business Decision-Making
description: The conceptual, applied, and managerial elements of advanced data science methods for business decision-making.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Topics in Marketing
description: Reading and research on selected topics in marketing. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Marketing Practicum
description: Students form a working marketing agency and complete a real-world marketing campaign for a client. Working as a team, they apply marketing theory and concepts to a substantively important marketing problem.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Business-to-Business Marketing
description: Marketing strategy in marketing to other business and nonprofit organizations, emphasizing relationship building, alliances and partnerships, data interchange, power shifts in the channel and the impact of changing technology.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Marketing Communications and Strategy
description: Integration of advertising, sales promotion, point-of-purchase communications toward the goal of enhancing brand equity.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Sales Management
description: The Sales Management course is the study of building and leading high-performance sales teams to grow  revenue for organizations.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MKTG
name: Personal Selling and Sales Management
description: Examines fundamentals of personal selling and sales management and the development of communication and selling skills that yield desired sales results.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MKTG
name: Marketing Channels and Distribution
description: Marketing functions and channel flows used to develop distribution strategies that provide effective, efficient, and reliable delivery of products and services to end-user markets.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Product and Brand Management
description: The primary tasks involved in developing marketing strategies from a product and/or brand management perspective, including product policy, competitive analysis, pricing, brand equity management, marketing information systems management, sales forecasting and monitoring customer satisfaction.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Retailing Management
description: Studies retail institutions, relationships with other channel members, factors influencing patronage patterns, adapting to change in dynamic environments with emphasis on strategy implications for managers in retail organizations.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Marketing Strategy and Planning
description: Management of marketing organizations and integration of functions, with emphasis on planning and designing strategies and applying tools and techniques for problem solving and decision making.   For marketing majors only.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: New Product Development
description: The development of new products (products or services) is a cross-functional process inside any organization. This course explores this process and how new product development managers are responsible for leading an organization from identifying marketing opportunities or gaps through product commercialization.   This course is focused on how companies take ideas, prioritizes them and ultimately makes them a reality.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MKTG
name: Digital Marketing & Social Media Analytics
description: This course aims to prepare students to be effective leaders in marketing analytics, especially in the dynamic context of digital platforms and social media.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: MKTG
name: Business, Markets and Sustainability
description: Sustainability (environmental, social, and economic performance) is a top priority for CEOs and is increasingly embedded into business strategy, resulting in changing business models, product strategies and innovation, etc. This course explores the challenges and opportunities facing businesses through a sustainability lens. Through readings, speakers, discussions and critical thinking exercises, students will gain exposure to the key environmental and social issues facing businesses today and how they are reacting. Emphasis will be placed on understanding the tradeoffs between economic, environmental and social performance. Throughout the semester, students will analyze the complex tradeoffs and leverage various frameworks to understand how businesses determine their strategic priorities, measure performance, and communicate that to key stakeholders.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: MKTG
name: Consultative Selling with Certification
description: Understand and demonstrate benefit and solution-based sales processes. Create daily discipline to drive sales performance.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Social Media Marketing
description: An introduction to Marketing on the predominant social media platforms (e.g. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc).   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: MKTG
name: Sales Internship
description: Student will participate in a Sales Internship for the duration of the current semester.  The scope of the work for the internship must be agreed upon by the student, a representative of the DMBS undergrad advisement office, the professor and the internship coordinator for the company before the semester starts.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MKTG
name: Marketing Internship
description: Student will participate in a Marketing Internship for the duration of the current semester.  The scope of the work for the internship must be agreed upon by the student, a representative of the DMBS undergrad advisement office, the professor and the internship coordinator for the company before the semester starts.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MKTG
name: Marketing Communications
description: Advertising, sales promotions, marketing-oriented public relations, event and sponsorship marketing, point-of-purchase communications, and other aspects of integrated marketing communications.    CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Pricing Strategy and Analysis
description: Economics and behavioral foundations of pricing strategy formulation and implementation.   CL: 2020.

subject: MKTG
name: Social and Digital Media Strategies for Businesses
description: Develop a social and digital media plan/solution to present to a client. Business enterprises and even non-business organizations are demanding new marketing hires and their marketing agencies have an acute understanding of how to develop and utilize online and social media as part of their integrated marketing plans. Both business-to-consumer and business-to-business enterprises are migrating to social media as a primary form of communication with customers and partners.    GC: 02/24/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: The Ocean Environment
description: Origin and evolution of the oceans, plate tectonics, ocean circulation, waves and tides, seawater and sediment composition, and influences on biology. Three lecture and three laboratory hours per week. Scheduled field trips required.      CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: The Living Ocean
description: Origin, evolution, and diversity of marine life, biological production, trophic dynamics, nutrient cycles, marine resources, and environmental concerns. Three lecture and three laboratory hours per week. Scheduled field trips required.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Oceans and Society
description: A nontechnical introduction to human interactions with the marine environment: marine organisms, marine systems, and the physical and chemical characteristics of oceans and estuaries. Not available for marine science major credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Oceans and Society Laboratory
description: Experiments and exercises which illustrate how specific components of marine environments are structured, function, and can be measured. Two laboratory hours per week. Not available for marine science major credit. Attendance on designated field trips may be required.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Coastal Environments of the Southeastern US
description: Coastal zones of South Carolina and neighboring states, including geologic history, geomorphology, stratigraphy, hydrogeology, shoreline processes, environmental issues, and effect of man. Not available for geological science or marine science major credit. Three lecture hours each week plus optional field trips.    FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: MSCI
name: Coastal Environments of the Southeastern U.S. (Laboratory)
description: Exercises examining coastal ecology, geomorphology, hydrogeology, shoreline processes, environmental issues, and human impact. Two laboratory hours per week. Scheduled field trips required. Not available for marine science major credit.   FS: 04/07/2021.

subject: MSCI
name: Ocean Data Analysis
description: Instrumentation, oceanographic time series, spatial and directional data sets, and basic parametric modeling.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Biology of Marine Organisms
description: Biological concepts emphasizing adaptation to marine environments. Laboratory experiments emphasize principles and techniques of marine biological study. Three lecture and three laboratory hours per week. Scheduled field trips are required.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: The Chemistry of the Sea
description: Biogeochemical cycling, carbonate chemistry, climate change, hydrothermal vents, stable isotopes, trace metals, radioactive tracers, mass balance, and properties of sea water. Three lecture and three laboratory hours per week.   FS: 04/15/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Physical Oceanography
description: Properties of seawater, mass and momentum balances, circulation, mixing, waves and other processes in the marine environment.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Processes of Global Environmental Change
description: The science of global change, its relation to the hydrosphere, atmosphere, lithosphere, and biosphere. Global system science, biogeochemical cycles, paleoclimatology, glaciation, and eustacy.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: The Deep Sea
description: The Deep Sea is an interdisciplinary, scientific survey of the geology, biology, chemistry, and physical setting of the deep-sea (more than 1000 m depth).    FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Policy and Marine Science
description: Analysis of past and current issues in global and national marine policy.  Relationship between science and policymakers.   FS:  11/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: MSCI
name: Principles of Biological Oceanography
description: Principles and methods of measuring production in the sea. Emphasis on the ocean’s role in the global carbon budget. Three lecture hours per week. Scheduled field trips are required.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Field and Laboratory Investigations in Marine Science
description: Intensive inquiry-based investigations combining oceanographic field sampling with laboratory measurements of collected samples using modern analytical instrumentation, and with analysis and integration of data into a final research report. Most of the course is conducted in residence at a marine field site.    FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Internship in Marine Science
description: Internship experience that offers practical field or laboratory experience in oceanography and/or related marine sciences.  Course content varies and will be announced by title in schedule of courses.  Usually conducted off campus and student must be able to access internship on their own.    FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Undergraduate Research
description: Student research on problems of fundamental significance in collaboration with faculty mentors. Emphasis on critical thinking, problem solving, proposal development, scientific writing, and professional presentation. Nine hours of laboratory, field, or library work per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Undergraduate Research
description: Student research on problems of fundamental significance in collaboration with faculty mentors. Emphasis on critical thinking, problem solving, proposal development, scientific writing, and professional presentation. Nine hours of laboratory, field, or library work per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Undergraduate Research
description: Student research on problems of fundamental significance in collaboration with faculty mentors. Emphasis on critical thinking, problem solving, proposal development, scientific writing, and professional presentation. Nine hours of laboratory, field, or library work per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Undergraduate Research
description: Student research on problems of fundamental significance in collaboration with faculty mentors. Emphasis on critical thinking, problem solving, proposal development, scientific writing, and professional presentation. Nine hours of laboratory, field, or library work per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Principles of Geomorphology
description: The process of earth denudation with emphasis on chemistry of weathering, stream and erosion hydraulics, quantitative analysis of land form evolution.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Principles of Coastal Geomorphology
description: Geological and physical controls on the morphology, development, and stability of coastlines. Analysis of waves and erosional processes, and coastal zone morphodynamics. Several required field trips.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Environmental Microbiology
description: An overview of the microbial world including a survey of the distribution, functioning, and diversity of microorganisms in natural systems.  Discusses the crucial roles that microorganisms play in ecosystem function, biogeochemical cycles, and environmental quality.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Climate Geoengineering
description: This course will discuss the urgent need for deploying solar radiation and carbon dioxide removal approaches at scale, including potential benefits and risks of these options.  It will also discuss regulatory and governance considerations at both the national and international level and strategizes to incentivize large-scale adoption of these approaches.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MSCI
name: MATLAB-Based Data Analysis in Ocean Sciences
description: MATLAB-based course in processing, analysis, and visualization of large oceanographic data sets.  Includes scalar and vector time series measured at fixed locations as well as shipboard surveys of oceanographic characteristics varying both in 3-D and in time.  Methods and techniques are relevant to other geoscience disciplines.   FS: 09/09/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Invertebrate Zoology
description: Phylogenetic and comparative aspects of anatomy, physiology, reproduction, and embryology of the invertebrates.  Three lecture and one three-hour laboratory period per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Advanced Paleontology
description: Systematic, ecologic, biogeographic, and evolutionary aspects of paleontology; lectures, practical exercises, field trips.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Micropaleontology
description: Marine microfossils; distribution, ecology, paleoecology, and biostratigraphy; use of microfossils in marine sediments to study oceanographic history.   Three lectures and two laboratory hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Introduction to Geochemistry
description: Investigation of low temperature chemical reactions controlling the geochemistry of the earth’s surface. Emphasis on CO2, carbonates, oxidation reduction, thermodynamics, isotopes, biogeochemistry.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Environmental Radioisotope Geochemistry
description: Introduction to radioactivity and the use of radionuclides to study environmental processes, including age-dating and biogeochemical cycling in aquatic systems.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Plants
description: Diversity, distribution, physiology, ecology, evolution, and economic importance of marine algal, seagrass, and mangrove communities.   Three lecture and three laboratory hours per week. Scheduled field trips are required.     CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Fishery Management
description: Management and conservation of aquatic and marine resources, with emphasis on fisheries. Data procurement and analysis; commercial and recreational fisheries; sociological, political, legal, and environmental factors that affect fishery management; and fish biodiversity.   FS: 11/7/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Ichthyology
description: Phylogeny, morphology, behavior, and ecology of fishes.  Three lecture and 3 laboratory hours plus three field trips to be arranged.   FS: 11/7/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Aquaculture
description: Introduction to the practical and scientific aspects of the commercial culture of freshwater and marine organisms.  Three lecture hours per week. One all-day field trip required.    CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Behavior of Marine Organisms
description: The identification of behavioral adaptations of estuarine and marine organisms: their ecology, physiology, development, and evolutionary history; field observations.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Geological Oceanography
description: A comprehensive study of the origin and development of the major structural features of the ocean basins and the continental margins. Discussion of the techniques used in obtaining geologic data and the interpretation of sedimentary processes, vulcanism, and the stratigraphy of the ocean basins.   CL:  2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Sedimentary Simulations and Sequence Stratigraphy
description: Problems of sequence stratigraphy resolved with graphic computer simulations. Sedimentary fill of basins by carbonates and/or clastics tracked as a function of rate of sediment accumulation, tectonic behavior, and sea level. Includes laboratory.

subject: MSCI
name: Population Genetics
description: An introduction to the principles of population genetics, with emphasis on the origin, maintenance, and significance of genetic variation in natural populations.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Sediments
description: Marine sedimentary environments; physical/biological factors which control the formation and distribution of modern marine sediments.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Conservation and Health in Marine Systems
description: Introduces the field of conservation and explores the intersection between conservation and environmental health with a particular focus on coastal and marine case studies.

subject: MSCI
name: Coastal Processes
description: Physical and geological processes controlling the formation and evolution of beach, barrier, and nearshore environments, including discussion of coastal management issues.    FS: 11/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Ecosystem Analysis
description: The formulation and simulation of compartment models of marine and terrestrial ecosystems with complex nutrient cycling, food chains, and energy flow. Analog and digital simulation techniques. Ecosystem stability and sensitivity. Organization, structure, and diversity of an ecosystem.    CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Introduction to Micrometeorology
description: Small-scale processes in the atmospheric boundary layers, including energy budget, radiation, soil heat transfer, humidity, viscous flows, turbulence, momentum and heat exchanges, evaporation, and marine atmospheric boundary layer.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Conservation Biology
description: Exploration of how human activities affect marine natural populations, species, communities and ecosystems, including threats to biodiversity; approaches to marine conservation; and ecological and evolutionary responses to anthropogenic disturbance.   FS: 12/3/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Ecology
description: Structure, dynamics, and interactions between populations and communities in marine ecosystems.  Attendance at designated departmental seminars is required.  Three lecture hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Ecology Laboratory
description: Laboratory and field exercises in coastal environments. Three hours per week plus field trips.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Fisheries Ecology
description: Interdisciplinary examination of the distribution, reproduction, survival, and historical variation of the principal commercial marine fisheries.    FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Ecology of Coral Reefs
description: Structure, productivity, and biodiversity of coral reefs, emphasizing their sensitivity, stability, and sustainability. Taught as an extended field experience with daily lectures and guided research activities.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Physiological and Pollution Ecology of Marine Organisms
description: Functional adaptation of marine plants and animals to ecological stresses including pollution. Three lecture hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Air-Sea Interaction
description: The physical mechanism responsible for interaction between the ocean and the atmosphere and the influence of air-sea interaction on atmospheric and oceanic dynamics and thermodynamics on a wide variety of spatial/temporal scales.    CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Satellite Oceanography
description: This course provides knowledge of various techniques used in satellite remote sensing of the oceans. Key skills will be developed in satellite data processing, image analysis, and hands-on research.    CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Estuarine Oceanography
description: Estuarine kinematics and dynamics; classification of estuaries; estuarine circulation and mixing.  Scheduled field trips are required.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Hydrodynamics
description: Basic principles of fluid statics and dynamics. Conservation of mass, momentum, and energy; viscosity, vorticity, and boundary layers with examples from the marine environment. Applications to and analysis of ocean currents and waves.   FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: MSCI
name: Geology and Geochemistry of Salt Marshes
description: Geological and geochemical processes in salt marshes. Methods of geological research in marshes including instrumental techniques, sampling design, and data analysis. Two lectures per week plus four weekends of project oriented fieldwork and/or equivalent lab work. Scheduled field trips are required.

subject: MSCI
name: Coastal Tropical Oceanography
description: Descriptive oceanography of mangrove and coral reef coasts with emphasis on physical processes. Taught as an extended field experience with daily lectures and guided research activities.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Beach-Dune Interactions
description: Influence of wind on coastal systems, with emphasis on nearshore currents, sediment transport and bedforms, aeolian transport, and dunes.   Minimum Junior standing required.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Topics in Marine Science
description: Current developments in marine science selected to meet faculty and student interests. Course content varies and will be announced by title in schedule of courses.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Aquatic Chemistry
description: Study of the chemical reactions and processes affecting the distribution of chemical species in natural systems.  Three lecture hours per week.   CL: 2020.

subject: MSCI
name: Marine Phytoplankton
description: Examines the physiology and ecology of phytoplankton, including environmental controls on community composition, primary productivity, and detection and characterization of water quality (eutrophication) and harmful algal blooms.    FS: 11/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Strings
description: MUED 104A-violin; MUED 104B-viola; MUED 104C-cello; MUED 104D-string bass; MUED 104P-guitar. Fundamentals of playing and teaching string instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, tone production, bowing, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Strings-Violin
description: Secondary Strings-Violin. Fundamentals of playing and teaching string instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, tone production, bowing, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Strings-Viola
description: Secondary Strings-Viola. Fundamentals of playing and teaching string instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, tone production, bowing, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Strings-Cello
description: Secondary Strings-Cello. Fundamentals of playing and teaching string instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, tone production, bowing, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Strings-String Bass
description: Secondary Strings-String Bass. Fundamentals of playing and teaching string instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, tone production, bowing, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Strings-Guitar
description: Secondary Strings-Guitar. Fundamentals of playing and teaching string instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, tone production, bowing, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Woodwinds-Flute
description: Secondary Woodwinds - Flute. Fundamentals of playing and teaching woodwind instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Woodwinds-Oboe
description: Secondary Woodwinds - Oboe. Fundamentals of playing and teaching woodwind instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Woodwinds-Clarinet
description: Secondary Woodwinds - Clarinet. Fundamentals of playing and teaching woodwind instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Woodwinds-Bassoon
description: Secondary Woodwinds - Bassoon. Fundamentals of playing and teaching woodwind instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Woodwinds-Saxophone
description: Secondary Woodwinds - Saxophone. Fundamentals of playing and teaching woodwind instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Brass-Trumpet
description: Secondary Brass - Trumpet. Fundamentals of playing and teaching brass instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Brass-French Horn
description: Secondary Brass - French Horn. Fundamentals of playing and teaching brass instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Brass-Trombone
description: Secondary Brass - Trombone.  Fundamentals of playing and teaching brass instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Secondary Brass-Tuba Euphonium
description: Secondary Brass - Tuba Euphonium.  Fundamentals of playing and teaching brass instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Classroom Instruments
description: Class instruction in guitar, recorder, non-pitched and pitched percussion, with emphasis on the development of performance skills, the understanding of pedagogical techniques and materials, and the ability to play and teach these instruments in a group setting.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Group Piano
description: A course for beginning piano students meeting in groups. Emphasis on music reading and elementary techniques. Two meetings and two laboratory periods a week. Repeatable once for credit.

subject: MUED
name: Group Piano
description: A course for beginning piano students meeting in groups. Emphasis on music reading and elementary techniques. Two meetings and two laboratory periods a week. Repeatable once for credit.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Class Voice (Basic)
description: Elementary courses in singing in which both group and individual techniques are employed. Study of voice production and principles of singing.

subject: MUED
name: Class Voice (Basic)
description: Elementary courses in singing in which both group and individual techniques are employed. Study of voice production and principles of singing.

subject: MUED
name: Music Education Practicum
description: Practicum experiences in various types of public school music settings. Seminars and group discussions included. Pass-Fail credit.

subject: MUED
name: Class Voice (Intermediate)
description: Continued study of the principles of singing and song repertoire.

subject: MUED
name: Class Voice (Intermediate)
description: Continued study of the principles of singing and song repertoire.

subject: MUED
name: Choral Literature Lab I
description: Practical application of choral conducting skills and rehearsal techniques with choral literature.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Choral Literature Lab II
description: Continued application of choral conducting skills and rehearsal techniques with choral literature.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Advanced Group Piano
description: Group piano for music education students emphasizing choral music. Opportunities for accompanying instrumentalists, vocalists, and choral groups. Repeatable once for credit.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Advanced Group Piano
description: Group piano for music education students emphasizing choral music. Opportunities for accompanying instrumentalists, vocalists, and choral groups. Repeatable once for credit.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Wind Pedagogy I
description: Fundamentals of playing and teaching wind instruments in a heterogeneous class. Study of basic principles regarding embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, and teaching materials.

subject: MUED
name: Strings
description: Fundamentals of playing and teaching string instruments in a heterogeneous class. Problems unique to each instrument relating to care and repair, tone production, bowing, fingering, and teaching materials.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Instrumental Techniques for Choral Majors
description: Techniques for leading an instrumental or mixed choral/instrumental ensemble. Instrumental tone, maintenance, score-reading skills, transposition, and rehearsal methods. Not auditable.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Percussion Techniques
description: Fundamentals of playing and teaching percussion instruments. Special study of problems unique to each percussion instrument and related teaching materials.   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: MUED
name: Percussion Practicum
description: Practicum experiences teaching percussion in various types of school and community music settings.

subject: MUED
name: Music for Young Children
description: Examination and practical application of methods, techniques, and materials for teaching music, Pre-K to Grade 5.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Band Literature and Materials
description: A study of teaching materials, solo- and small-ensemble literature, and full band ensemble literature appropriate for grades 5-12.

subject: MUED
name: Jazz/Pop Styles and Improvisation
description: A study of the essential elements in jazz and popular music. Familiarization and practice with materials and methods of teaching improvisation and jazz performance.

subject: MUED
name: Technology for Music Teachers
description: Familiarization with computer software and hardware for the teaching of music and administration of music programs.

subject: MUED
name: General Music in Elementary Schools
description: Discussion of sequential music development; implementation of methods, techniques, and materials for teaching music in grades K-5.   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: MUED
name: Practicum in Elementary Music
description: Practical application of elementary methods and techniques studied in school settings.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: General Music in Secondary Schools
description: Middle-school and high-school general music education philosophy, teaching techniques, music objectives, curriculum development, administration, facilities, and equipment.

subject: MUED
name: Choral Methods and Materials
description: Procedures and materials for choral instruction applicable to elementary, middle-school, and high-school choruses; basic concepts of choral tone and vocal development.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Practicum in Choral Music
description: Practical application of choral methods and techniques in school settings. Not auditable.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Marching Band Techniques
description: Fundamentals of marching, maneuvering, and formations; special features such as drum majoring and auxiliary units; discussion and planning of halftime shows.

subject: MUED
name: Directed Teaching (Music)
description: A clinical field experience in the public school setting.     Note:  Prior to enrolling in MUED 477, students must complete the following:    1)   Admission to the Professional Program, and    2)   All MUED courses, and conducting courses are required for the student’s specific degree track.  Courses must be passed with Grade of “C” or better. Students are strongly encouraged to complete all MUSC courses prior to the student teaching semester for optimum preparation for the pre-service internship.    No additional course work may be taken during the Directed Teaching semester without permission of the School of Music Undergraduate Director.   Restricted to seniors.    Special Permissions:  Department   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: MUED
name: Methods for String Instruction I
description: Fundamentals of teaching orchestral stringed instruments in school string and orchestra classes. Emphasis on sequential instruction, materials, and classroom management.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Practicum in Methods of String Instruction I
description: Practical application of string methods and materials in public and community school settings. Not auditable.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Methods of String Instruction II
description: Continued study of methods, materials, and concepts of teaching orchestral stringed instruments in school string and orchestra classes. Emphasis on rehearsal techniques and curricula.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Practicum in Methods of String Instruction II
description: Practical application of string methods and materials in public and community school settings. Not auditable   FS: 03/02/2022.

subject: MUED
name: The Middle School Band
description: Study of teaching materials, methods, literature, and educational practices used in middle school band settings.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MUED
name: The High School Band
description: Study of teaching materials, methods, literature, and educational practices used in high school band settings.

subject: MUED
name: Workshop in Music Education
description: Selected topics in music education. May be repeated as the topic varies. Credits 1-3 per registration; 12 maximum.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Integrating Music into the Elementary Classroom
description: Develop activities and learning plans that integrate music into language arts, math, science, social studies, ELA, and learning for students with special needs. Apply those lessons in practicums with children.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: MUED
name: Wind Pedagogy II
description: Continued study of the issues in playing and teaching wind instruments in a heterogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to each woodwind and brass instrument regarding fingering and intonation.

subject: MUED
name: Arraning for the Marching Band
description: Instruction and practice in arranging music for the marching band.

subject: MUED
name: String Instrument Pedagogy
description: Principles and practices in teaching string instruments, including Suzuki and Rolland. Emphasis on teaching in the private studio.

subject: MUED
name: Specialized Elementary Music Methods
description: Advanced study of Orff, Kodaly, Dalcroze, and Gordon music learning theories as applied in elementary schools.

subject: MUED
name: Organization and Administration of Music Programs
description: Topics include materials and techniques of class teaching, equipment purchase, budgeting, recruiting, public relations, and the music library.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUED
name: Practicum in Instrumental Music
description: Practical application of instrumental methods and techniques in school settings. Not auditable.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUSC
name: Recital Class
description: Music Convocation gathers the School of Music community together for shared experiences regarding different aspects of Professional Skills and Entrepreneurship, Academic Integrity and Excellence, Wellness and Safety, Performance and Collaboration, and Global Engagement. Pass/Fail grading only.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: MUSC
name: Music Advocacy I: Understanding the Power of Your Music
description: An introduction to advocacy methods, techniques and experiences to understand the positive effects of music in American society.    Pass/Fail Grading.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUSC
name: Recital Class Laboratory

subject: MUSC
name: Music Theory II
description: A survey of the sound, harmony, melody, rhythm, and form of tonal music of a variety of styles, expanding the diatonic framework with chromaticism.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: Music Theory IV
description: A study of organization in music of the late 19th, 20th, and 21st centuries.

description: Continuation of MUSC 118.

subject: MUSC

subject: MUSC
name: Introduction to Beat Making and Digital Audio Production
description: Practice in basic audio production (signal-flow, digital audio workstations, plug-ins, virtual instruments, effects) and beat making (audio production in a digital workstation using samples, loops, and virtual instruments). Concepts of music production and prominent styles in beat-driven music.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: Introduction to Digital Music Creation
description: Research, analysis, and creation of digital music using techniques in commercial and production music including DAW, MIDI, samples, effects, and more. In each learning module, students will read about, listen to, and analyze model recordings in specific subgenres of commercial, production, and art music before creating their own short music track. At the end of the semester students will research, plan, and create a final project based on their interests. Topics include Introduction to DAW, MIDI & signal flow; Virtual instruments & samples; The studio as instrument, Notation; Rhythm, groove, micro-timing, & beats; Building full textures & Orchestration; Music for advertising; Underscoring for TV & film; Video game music, vamps, & cycles; Sound design; and Electro-acoustic mixture.   FS:12/01/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: Keyboard Harmony and Sight Reading Laboratory
description: Functional keyboard skills in sight reading, harmonization, transposition, and improvisation.

subject: MUSC
name: Beginning Piano Accompanying
description: Approaches to specific problems in vocal and instrumental accompanying; supervised accompanying in class.  Repeatable for credit.

subject: MUSC
name: Introduction to Singer's Diction
description: Techniques of pronunciation, phonetics, and international phonetic alphabet as applied to standard vocal repertory. Not auditable.

subject: MUSC
name: Supplemental Applied Focus
description: Applied study for advanced undergraduate performance majors with a focus in a supplemental area or concept.   FS: 06/07/2023.

subject: MUSC
name: Introduction to Music Industry Studies
description: An overview of the music industry. Students will explore a variety of music industry career paths in areas such as arts management, music products and merchandizing, public relations, music production and recording, publishing, online music distribution, and live music event organization.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: History of Western Music I
description: Western music from ca. 1500 through 1750, considering musical styles, genres and forms, and the contributions of composers through historical, analytical and musical perspectives. Subdiscipline: Music - History and Literature.   FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: History of Western Music II
description: Western music from ca. 1730 through ca. 1970, considering musical styles, genre and forms, and the contributions of composers through historical, analytical, and musical perspectives. Subdiscipline, Music - History and Literature.     FS: 11/03/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: An Introduction to Audio Recording Techniques
description: Basic acoustics; miking techniques; analog tape: recording, editing, mixing and duplication; signal processing.

subject: MUSC
name: Introduction to Teaching Artistry
description: This course will explore the widely held understanding of the term teaching artist. By examining examples from the Teaching Artist practice, students will identify the skills, places, and communities where teaching artists are called to work. Furthermore, students will examine the philosophies, beliefs, and values held in the Teaching Artist profession. Finally, students will investigate the necessary tensions and questions about the Teaching Artist profession within the larger music education landscape.   FS: 04/06/2022.

subject: MUSC
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor and department chair is required for undergraduate students. Not auditable.

subject: MUSC
name: Half Solo Recital
description: Performance of a 30-minute public recital in the student's primary performance area.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: Full Solo Recital
description: Performance of a 60-minute public recital in the student's primary performance area.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: Innovation Recital
description: Participation in the performance of a public Innovation Recital in the student's primary performance area, combined with elements of the student's concentration (Chamber Music, Entrepreneurship, Music Technology).   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: Vocal Coaching
description: A study of stylistic, linguistic, and other performance issues in solo operatic, oratorio, and recital repertoire for singers.  Not auditable.

name: Music Composition II
description: Intermediate level composition class.

subject: MUSC
name: Special Topics in Musicology and Ethnomusicology
description: An exploration of methodologies in music research, investigating any combination of historical inquiries, including archival research and score studies; ethnographic approaches; and modern techniques such as sound studies, field recordings, critical theory, and digital humanities.    FS: 10/06/2021.

subject: MUSC
name: Musical Theatre Workshop
description: Intensive musical theatre training in areas of song interpretation, musical theatre, dance, voice and acting.   CL: 2020.

subject: MUSC
name: History of Western Music III
description: Western music from ca. 1860 until the present time, considering musical styles, genre and forms, and the contributions of composers through historical, analytical, and musical perspectives.  Subdiscipline,  Music - History and Literature.

subject: MUSC
name: Music Industry Capstone
description: Culmination of Music Industry Studies with a focus on experiential learning or research, supervised by a faculty member. Studio Portfolio materials will be gathered to aid in matriculation to higher education or careers in the music industry.  Can be taken twice for a credit for a maximum of six credit hours.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: MUSC
name: Topics in Performance and Literature
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of course title.   FS: 04/03/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Secondary Applied Music
description: Courses consist of individual instruction including individualized assignments and regular private instruction and review.  Instruments are designated by suffix: 501A-flute/piccolo; 501B-oboe/English horn; 501C-clarinet; 501D-bassoon; 501E-saxophone; 501F-French horn; 501G-trumpet;    501H-trombone; 501I-euphonium; 501J-tuba; 501K-percussion; 501L-harpsichord; 501N-classical guitar; 501O-organ; 501P-piano; 501R-violin; 501S-viola; 501T-violoncello; 501U-double bass; 501V-voice; 501W-service playing; 501Y-conducting; 501Z-jazz. Repeatable for credit. Not auditable.    CL: 2020.
