FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SCHC
name: HNRS: State Government Program: Seminar
description: Extensive study of state government and various facets of public service in South Carolina for students enrolled in the South Carolina Honors College State Government Program.  Additional topics may be included as specific needs and interests dictate.  This is a required course for the South Carolina Honors College State Government Program.    FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: SCHC
name: HNRS: State Government Program: Internship
description: Supervised internship experience in state government/public service and related academic coursework for students enrolled in the South Carolina Honors College State Government Program. This is a required course for the South Carolina Honors College State Government Program.    FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: SCHC
name: HNRS: South Carolina Washington Semester Program: Contemporary Issues in Politics
description: Extensive study of contemporary issues in politics for students enrolled in the South Carolina Washington Semester Program and living in Washington D.C. Additional topics may be included as specific needs and interests dictate. This is a required course for the South Carolina Washington Semester Program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: SCHC
name: HNRS: South Carolina Washington Semester Program: Internship
description: Supervised, full-time internship experience, enrichment activities and related academic coursework for students enrolled in the South Carolina Washington Semester Program and living in Washington D.C. This is a required course for the South Carolina Washington Semester Program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: SCHC
name: HNRS: Honors Internship
description: Supervised internship experience and related academic coursework for students engaged in a short-term internship or micro-internship.  Course is offered for variable credits, requiring 50 hours of work at internship site per credit hour.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: SCHC
name: HNRS: Undergraduate Research
description: Student research supervised by a faculty member. Emphasis is on the development of critical thinking, appropriate research skills, and writing.   CL: 2020.

subject: SCHC
name: HNRS: Senior Thesis/Project
description: Required of all students graduating with honors from South Carolina Honors College.

subject: SMED
name: Life Science for Teachers I
description: Topics appropriate for elementary and middle-school curricula; phylogenetic organization of major kingdoms, characteristics of plants and animals, including humans; ecological principles; communities; energy needs, resources, flow and balance; heredity and adaptation.

subject: SMED
name: Energy, Motion, and Matter
description: Integrated study of the earth’s atmosphere for pre-service and in-service middle school teachers combining concepts from earth, life, and physical science leading to an understanding of the interaction of all systems.   CL: 2020.

subject: SMED
name: Interdependence of Living Systems
description: Integrated study of the biotic and abiotic environments combining life, earth, and physical science concepts to understand relationships in living systems. For pre-service and in-service middle school teachers.   CL: 2020.

subject: SMED
name: Origin and Evolution of Living and Non-Living Systems
description: Study of the earth system for pre-service and in-service middle school teachers, with emphasis on the origin, evolution, and interactions of the subsystems of the earth system.   CL: 2020.

subject: SMED
name: Data Analysis for Teachers
description: Introduction to statistics for elementary, middle, and high school teachers. The fundamentals of data collection, descriptive statistics, probability, and inference with special focus on methods of teaching statistical reasoning. For M.A.T. (excluding mathematics) / M.Ed. / M.T. and nondegree credit only.  For M.A.T. (excluding mathematics) / M.Ed. / M.T. and nondegree credit only.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Introductory Sociology
description: An introduction to sociological facts and principles: an analysis of group-making processes and products.   FS: 09/11/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Social Structures
description: Selected theoretical orientations, methodological procedures, and illustrative substantive data pertaining to social structures.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sex and Gender
description: Offers a sociological lens to develop critical ways of thinking about sex and gender as social processes in everyday lives. This course considers how sex and gender shape and affect the experiences of women, men, girls, boys, and individuals who live in the spaces in-between (those who are intersex or transgender) across a wide range of social institutions (family, work, education, politics, etc.).   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Race, Class, Gender, and Sexuality
description: Historical and contemporary power relationships in race, social class, gender, and sexual orientation.    CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Families
description: Sociological perspectives related to various aspects of family behaviors, roles, and values.    FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Religion
description: Sociological perspectives related to selected aspects of religious behavior. Includes references to non-Western religions.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Community Organization
description: An analysis of formal and informal organization, the interrelationships among public and private agencies, and means through which community action programs are initiated, coordinated, and maintained.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: An Introduction to Social Inequality
description: A sociological analysis of the distribution of wealth and income in selected societies.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Social Demography
description: Introduction to key areas of population studies. Methodological approaches, time trends, regional differences, and contemporary policy issues.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Ecology of Human Social Systems
description: Relationships among and changes in populations, social organization, technology, and the environment.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Bureaucracy and Modern Society
description: Bureaucracies in the public and private sector, their internal dynamics and relationship to the social environment.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Aging
description: Analysis of aging as a process of socialization and the status of older people in society, their roles in the community, demographic aspects of aging, and the impact of aging upon social institutions.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Global Population Issues
description: Overview of global population history, theory, statistics, and issues related to recent population trends.   FS: 02/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Reproductive Governance and Resistance
description: An examination of reproductive health and rights in a global context.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: SOCY
name: Individual and Society
description: Selected theoretical orientations, methodological procedures, and illustrative substantive data pertaining to the relations between the individual and society.

subject: SOCY

subject: SOCY

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Childhood
description: A consideration of the child in the family group, play group, school group, and community.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Adolescence
description: Sociological perspectives and research findings related to adolescence.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of the Paranormal
description: A critical examination of factors that lead to the widespread acceptance of paranormal claims.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Introduction to Social Problems
description: Contemporary social issues such as poverty, health, the criminal justice system, globalization and the environment, their causes and possible solutions.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Juvenile Delinquency
description: Social factors in the development, identification, and treatment of delinquents.   CL: 2020.

Attention is directed to the emergence of urbanism in the United States, with particular reference to the Southern region, and to institutions, problems, and city planning.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Crime
description: Social factors in the development, identification, and treatment of criminals.    FS: 12/04/2019.

subject: SOCY
name: Collective Behavior
description: An analysis of crowds, publics, social movements, and the mass society in terms of their institutional and social psychological consequences.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Race and Ethnic Relations
description: Theoretical and empirical approaches related to race/ethnicity and the current state of race relations in America, with some attention to global issues.   FS: 02/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociological Perspectives on Poverty in the U.S.
description: This is a course about the demographics, measurement, ideologies, and theories of U.S. poverty.    FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Education
description: Analysis of educational institutions, organizations, processes, and their effects in contemporary society.   FS: 11/07/2018.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Medicine and Health
description: Health and illness in relation to social institutions. The organization and professionalization of medicine and social barriers to medical care.   FS: 10/02/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Society through Visual Media

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Sport
description: Theories, methods, and substantive issues in the study of sport in contemporary societies.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociological Research Methods
description: Qualitative and quantitative methods of sociological research.    FS: 11/04/2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Elementary Statistics for Sociologists
description: An introduction to concepts and application of quantitative methods, including descriptive and inferential statistics. Emphasis on analysis of empirical sociological data.   FS: 09/14/2022.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociological Theory
description: Examination of key ideas from classical, modern, and contemporary sociological theories.   FS: 12/02/2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Topics in Sociology
description: Reading and research on selected sociological topics. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: SOCY
name: Social Networks
description: Analysis of personal, social and organizational networks, their structural patterns, practical consequences, and principles of formation and change.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Political Sociology
description: Theory and research concerning the interrelationship between the polity and social structures.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Family and Social Stratification
description: An analysis of the contemporary American family emphasizing social stratification, mobility, occupations, and urbanization.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Social Stratification
description: Theory and research in social stratification.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Social Structures in Communities
description: Interrelationships of major social structures within communities.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Social Organizations
description: Selected theoretical orientation, methodological procedures, and illustrative substantive issues pertaining to organizations.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Social Control

subject: SOCY

subject: SOCY
name: Life Course Demographics

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Mental Health
description: Social factors in the development, identification, and treatment of mental illness.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: SOCY
name: Internal and International Migration
description: A survey of methods of analysis and research findings with emphasis on the social and economic concomitants of internal migration. Cultural, economic, and historical aspects of international migration. Effects of governmental policies on immigration and emigration. Examination of selected countries.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Urbanization
description: Analysis of urbanization using contemporary and historical data from developing societies. The demographic components of metropolitan growth and the changing structure of metropolitan communities.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Scientific Methods and Sociological Inquiry
description: Introduction to methods used to answer theoretical, empirical, and practical sociological questions, including scientific inquiry and research design.   GC:  12/11/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Advanced Social Psychology
description: Advanced survey of social psychological perspectives and research on inequality, discrimination, power and status, cooperation and collective action, social norm and morality, networks and relationships.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Small Group Analysis
description: A behavioral analysis of small groups.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Power and Authority Structures in Groups
description: An exploration of theoretical perspectives, methodological approaches, and substantive issues in the study of interpersonal power and authority.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Social Processes of Deviance Control
description: A systematic analysis of the interrelation among the creation, involvement, recognition, and control of deviance.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Interpersonal Behavior in Families
description: Social psychological perspectives on family behavior.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Selves and Social Transaction
description: A systematic analysis of interrelationships among social acts, selves, roles, transactions, and language.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Law
description: Review of theoretical and empirical developments in the sociology of law, including classical and modern sociological theories of law and selected sociological themes of law in various social settings.   FS: 02/06/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY
name: Sociology of Science
description: Interrelationships among society, culture, and contemporary science.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOCY

subject: SOST

subject: SOST
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and program director is required for undergraduates.

subject: SOST
name: Topics in Southern Studies
description: Reading and research on selected topics in Southern studies. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOST
name: Topics in the American South
description: Selected topics related to the study of the American South. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Introduction to Social Work
description: This course introduces students to the history and contemporary context of the social work profession, including generalist practice and the role of advocacy.  It emphasizes responses to current needs and changing contexts.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: SOWK
name: Social Welfare Policies and Programs
description: This course introduces students to the historical and current context of social welfare policies and programs in the United States, including examination of social inequalities and the processes of social policy development.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: SOWK
name: Social Work With Children, Youth, and Families
description: This course introduces the context for social work with children, youth, and families as well as specific theories, policies, programs, and services.  Areas examined include antipoverty policies and programs, child welfare, education, behavioral health, healthcare, disabilities, and juvenile justice.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: SOWK
name: Social Work With Older Adults and Families
description: This course introduces students to the context for social work with older adults, as well as specific theories, policies, programs, and services.  Areas examined include the aging process, health and wellness, behavioral health, sexuality, work and retirement, bereavement, living arrangements and housing options, and social programs and policies targeting older adults.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: SOWK
name: Gender, Race and Social Justice
description: This course introduces anti-oppressive theoretical and applied approaches to understand and address intersections of gender and racial inequality. Social welfare policies and services available to women in contexts such as criminal justice, behavioral health, child welfare, and the military are examined.    FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: SOWK
name: Global Inequalities and Social Justice
description: This course introduces students to global dimensions of social inequality, beginning with the historical roots of global social inequality and moving through contemporary themes relevant to international social work practice from an anti-colonial perspective.  Topics examined include human rights, gender-based violence, global health, climate change, and immigration/displacement.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: SOWK
name: Life Transitions: Loss and Grief
description: This course will examine the grief and loss process that is part of everyday life. This course surveys the knowledge and skills of human service practice with people as they cope with life transitions.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Foundations of Social Work Practice
description: This course introduces students to the context and mission of social work. It emphasizes the interactions between personal and professional values, ethical and professional behavior, and beginning engagement and interpersonal skills.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Social Work Practice with Individuals and Families
description: This course introduces students to engagement, assessment, intervention, and evaluation with individuals and families. It includes specific models and techniques of practice with an emphasis on managing barriers to change, client strengths, and understanding diversity and difference in practice.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Social Policy Analysis
description: Knowledge, values, and skills for social work practitioners to analyze the political and ideological factors and outcomes of policy development, implementation, evaluation, and advocacy.    CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Diversity and Social Justice in Contemporary Society
description: Builds cultural competency through awareness, understanding, and skill necessary for proactive functioning in our diverse society with populations considered vulnerable and oppressed.

subject: SOWK
name: Theories for Understanding Individuals, Families, and Groups
description: This course focuses on theories for understanding individual, family, and group behavior to better serve clients across settings. It emphasizes diversity, difference, and the advancement of human rights and social, economic, and environmental justice.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Social Work and Scientific Inquiry
description: Foundational knowledge and skills for scientific inquiry and the use of quantitative and qualitative research to inform evidence-based practice.    CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Refuge and Refugees
description: This course provides students with foundational knowledge about forced migration and the institutions of humanitarian aid that address forced migration.  Students will learn about global theories of forced migration, humanitarian aid policy, empirical studies of humanitarian aid, refugee resettlement, and displacement, and evaluate biographies and literature on forced migration.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Special Topics in Social Work
description: An in-depth study of selected issues and social concerns related to being a generalist social worker.  Content varies by title.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Introduction to Field Education
description: An initial application of generalist social work skills and theories taught in a controlled and planned classroom setting.   FS: 12/01/2021.

subject: SOWK
name: Independent Study
description: Requires permission of the department.

subject: SOWK
name: Current Issues in Social Welfare
description: A project-type study of selected issues, social concerns, and applications of behavioral implications for practice. May be repeated for credit when the topics covered or subject matter is different.

subject: SOWK
name: Social Work Practice with Groups
description: This course introduces students to engagement, assessment, intervention, and evaluation with treatment and task groups.  It includes specific models and techniques of practice with an emphasis on group practice with diverse populations across practice settings.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Social Work Practice with Organizations and Communities
description: This course introduces students to engagement, assessment, intervention, and evaluation with organizations and communities.  It includes specific models and techniques of practice with an emphasis on diversity, difference, and the advancement of human rights and social, economic, and environmental justice.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Advocacy for Social and Economic Justice
description: Knowledge and skills embedded in values of social and economic justice for all people across systems of all sizes that are essential in generalist practice.    CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Theories for Understanding Organizations and Communities
description: This course focuses on theories for understanding large social systems to better serve clients across settings. It emphasizes diversity, difference, and the advancement of human rights and social, economic, and environmental justice.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Practicum I: Field Education
description: Application of skills and theories taught in the classroom in a controlled and planned setting.    CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Practicum II: Field Education
description: Further application of the generalist social work skills and theories taught in the classroom in a controlled and planned setting.    CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Practicum Seminar
description: Taken with the field practicum, this seminar facilitates student's integration of generalist practice knowledge with practice in a field agency.    CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Capstone
description: Competent generalist social work practice demands integration of a wide range of theories, knowledge, skills, and values. This course is designed to draw on all previous courses and to engage students in integrating and applying all that they have learned.    FS: 03/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Special Topics in Social Work
description: Study of special populations, settings, and/or problems encountered by social workers and other human service professionals, and interventions and skills for dealing with them.  May be repeated as content varies by title.    CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Transforming Health Care for the Future
description: Foundation for beginning health professions students to gain an understanding of the complexities of the health care system through experiential activities conducted in interprofessional teams and the importance of interprofessional collaboration in order to improve the system.   GC/FS: 06/19/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: SOWK
name: Addressing Childhood Obesity through Community Approaches
description: Approaches for prevention of childhood obesity, using perspectives from public health, social work, exercise science, pharmacy, medicine, and behavioral nutrition.  Training to teach diet/physical activity lessons in elementary school settings.   GC/FS: 06/19/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN

Restricted to those who have never studied Spanish or placed by examination into SPAN 109.  Credit may be received only for one of the following: SPAN 109, SPAN 110; SPAN 111;   or SPAN 121.    FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Beginning Spanish II
description: Introduction to grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills.   Restricted to those who have completed    SPAN 109. Credit may be received only for one of the following: SPAN 109, SPAN 110; SPAN 111; or SPAN 121.    FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 220.

subject: SPAN
name: Intensive Beginning Spanish
description: Intensive introduction to grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills.  Admission only to highly motivated beginning students who obtain the permission of the department. Credit may be received only for one of the following: SPAN 109, SPAN 110,    SPAN 111, or SPAN 121.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Elementary Spanish
description: Grammar and vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills.  Assumes prior experience in Spanish. Admission only by proficiency examination. Credit may be received for only one of the following: SPAN 109, SPAN 110, SPAN 111, or SPAN 121.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Basic Proficiency in Spanish

subject: SPAN
name: Intermediate Spanish I

subject: SPAN
name: Intermediate Spanish II

subject: SPAN
name: Intensive Intermediate Spanish
description: Further development of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Designed for highly motivated students. Credit not awarded for both    SPAN 209-SPAN 210 and SPAN 211.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Selected Works of Hispanic Literature in English Translation

subject: SPAN
name: Service Learning in Spanish

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN
name: Introduction to Reading Hispanic Literary Texts

subject: SPAN
name: Business Spanish
description: Commercial organizations and business in Spanish-speaking countries, business correspondence, terminology, and techniques in commercial transactions. Standardized examinations available such as the Certificado de la Camara de Comercio de Madrid.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Spanish Phonetics and Pronunciation
description: Analysis of and practice in pronunciation, listening comprehension, and dialect recognition based on study of the speech sounds, combinations, patterns, and processes of Spanish phonetics and phonology. Department permission required for transfer students.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Spanish Language Study Abroad
description: Intensive language practice in native environment with emphasis on oral skills. Instruction by native speakers; community contact, and home stay. May be repeated once for credit. Restricted to participants of the USC Spanish Summer Global Classroom Program.   FS: 03/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Spanish for Healthcare Professionals

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN
name: Special Topics in Hispanic Language and Culture

subject: SPAN
name: The Cinema of Spain

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN
name: Special Topics in Hispanic Studies

subject: SPAN
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students. Department permission required for transfer students.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN
name: Latin American Culture

subject: SPAN

subject: SPAN

description: A survey of literature, such as novels, short stories and poems, from Latin America.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
