description: Vocabulary, concepts, and oral/written skills necessary to communicate effectively in the social, cultural, or economic infrastructure of Hispanic countries. Introduction to the use of technology for the acquisition and processing of materials relevant to students’ professional goals.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Advanced Special Topics in Hispanic Literature
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated as content varies by title.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Advanced Special Topics in Hispanic Language and Culture
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated as content varies by title. This course will be taught in Spanish.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Advanced Special Topics in Hispanic Studies
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated as content varies by title. Taught in English.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Senior Seminar
description: A special seminar devoted to the in-depth study of selected subjects in Hispanic literature, culture, or language. Required for the intensive major in Spanish.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Contemporary Spain
description: Analysis and discussion of 20th-century Spanish history and the sociocultural forces that have contributed to define this country’s national identity. Taught in Spanish.   FS:  12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Contemporary Latin America
description: Analysis and discussion of contemporary Latin American history and the sociocultural forces that have contributed to define this area's national identities. Taught in Spanish.   FS: 06/03/2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Introduction to Professional and Technical Translation
description: Introduction to translation and practice of skills required for professional and technical Spanish/English translation.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Introduction to Spanish Linguistics
description: Phonology, morphology, and syntax of modern Spanish.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: SPAN
name: The Structure of Modern Spanish
description: Description of the grammatical structures of Modern Spanish. Intensive study of the theory and practice of word formation and sentence structure of Spanish.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Contrastive English-Spanish Phonetics and Phonology
description: Introduction to the study of phonetics and phonology and their application to the sounds and sound systems of English and Spanish. Includes transcription practice and discussion of relevance to teaching.

subject: SPAN
name: Introduction to Spanish Medieval Literature
description: Survey of Spanish literature from its first manifestations to La Celestina. Introduction; early works; the epic; 13th- through 15th-century prose and verse; Berceo, Alfonso X, Juan Ruiz, Marques de Santillana; others.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Renaissance and Golden Age Literature
description: Survey of the works of Garcilaso, the Spanish mystics, Lope, Quevedo, Tirso, Calderon, Gongora and others.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Nineteenth-Century Spanish Literature
description: Survey of the works of the major literary figures of the period.   FS: 03/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Twentieth-Century Spanish Literature
description: Survey of major peninsular writers from the Generation of ‘98 to the present.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Colonial Spanish-American Literature to Neoclassicism
description: Survey of pre-Columbian poetry and of texts dating from the time of Columbus to the end of the Colonial period.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Spanish-American Literature from the Independence Through Modernism
description: Survey of the most significant works of the Independence through Modernism.   FS: 04/15/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Advanced Language Study Abroad
description: Intensive language practice in native environment with special emphasis on oral skills. Instruction by native speakers; extensive community contact and home stay. Prior placement test required.

subject: SPAN
name: Spanish-American Literature from Modernism Through 1960
description: Survey of the most significant works of this period.   FS: 03/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Contemporary Spanish-American Literature
description: Survey of the most significant works from 1960 to the present.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Special Topics in Spanish
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated as content varies by title.    FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPAN
name: Intensive Readings in Spanish
description: Intensive reading for non-majors. Graduate students fulfill their foreign-language requirement with successful completion of the course. Undergraduates may take the course as an elective only by permission.    CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Public Communication
description: Introduction to theory and practice of oral communication in public, social, and institutional contexts. Includes foundational and cumulative training in the invention, performance, and critical analysis of oral communication, with emphasis on argumentation, persuasion, audience analysis, delivery, and ethical forms of engagement.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Online Public Communication
description: Introduction to theory and practice of live and recorded online spoken communication in public, social, and institutional contexts. Training in invention, performance, and critical analysis of online spoken communication, including audience analysis, persuasion, delivery, and ethical engagement. Includes significant practice in preparing and presenting live online public communication.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Public Speaking Anxiety Reduction
description: Exercises and techniques to reduce and manage public speaking anxiety. Ideally taken concurrently with any course that requires multiple presentations.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: SPCH
name: Popular Communication and Public Culture
description: Examination of historical and popular communication conflicts, texts, and events. Offers an introduction to critical concepts and analysis of public speech, rhetoric, and cultural discourse.

subject: SPCH
name: Communicating Moral Issues
description: Moral issues confronting men and women in contemporary society and the challenges of communicating effectively about them. Topics will vary but may include access to health care, euthanasia, abortion, same sex marriage and the moral and environmental consequences of eating animals.   FS: 04/06/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Business and Professional Speaking
description: Fundamentals of oral communication within business and professional settings. Includes performance.

subject: SPCH
name: Argumentation and Debate
description: Preparing and delivering the debate. Academic debate serves as a model.

subject: SPCH
name: Small Group Communication
description: The development of the skills and methods of effective participation in teams, committees, and other small groups.

subject: SPCH
name: Organizational Communication
description: Examines communication behavior and networks within organizations through the study of major theories of organizational communication, identifies and defines primary concepts, and applies them to organizational scenarios and case studies.

subject: SPCH
name: Literature and Performance
description: Introduction to the study of literature through performance; reading, analysis, and performance of prose, poetry, nonfiction, and drama.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Persuasive Communication
description: Analysis of the process and functions of persuasive communication.

subject: SPCH
name: Introduction to Rhetoric
description: Theories of human communication useful for understanding and informing the everyday work of writers. Emphasis on intensive analysis and writing.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Independent Study and Research
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: SPCH
name: Arguments in Cultural Studies
description: The study of texts and discourse from contemporary culture drawing from concepts such as politics, television, music, and other popular culture and entertainment.

subject: SPCH
name: Rhetorical Criticism
description: Interpretation and evaluation of communication texts and events such as speeches, media, and social movements. Employs a variety of critical methods and approaches.

subject: SPCH
name: Contemporary Political Rhetoric
description: Analysis and evaluation of speeches, political campaigns and controversies over political representation and recognition. Focus on case studies that illustrate the role of speech-making in political campaigns. Offered only in fall semesters in which national elections are held.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Great Debates
description: A study of debates at the Constitutional Convention, Lincoln-Douglas debates (1858), vice presidential and presidential debates, and other national debates.

subject: SPCH
name: Speechwriting
description: An exploration of the process of advanced policy advocacy emphasizing speechwriting strategies, issues management, and systematic advocacy campaigns.

subject: SPCH
name: Rhetoric of Science and Technology
description: Rhetorical study of science and technology in contemporary culture, emphasizing the ways scientific texts and technologies make their persuasive appeals.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Rhetoric and the Ancient Roots of Modern Life
description: Classical rhetoric and its ongoing influence in the modern world, emphasizing how the study and use of language in ancient Greece and Rome continue to shape modern communication.

subject: SPCH
name: Rhetoric and Popular Culture
description: Rhetorical study of popular culture, using the methods and theories of cultural analysis to examine how various popular cultural forms work as persuasion.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Women’s Rhetoric
description: Study of rhetoric by and about women as manifested in speeches, essays, and other rhetorical artifacts.   FS: 02/06/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: African-American Rhetoric
description: African-American rhetoric as manifested in speeches, essays, and other rhetorical artifacts.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Special Topics in Speech
description: Reading and research on selected topics. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated once as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPCH
name: Communication, Law, and Society
description: Examines the role of communication in legal and judicial contexts. Focus on case studies that illustrate the theoretical and practical significance of rhetoric in the work of the courts, lawyers, and public advocacy groups.

subject: SPTE
name: The Student-Athlete Experience
description: Examination of the functions and resources the university provides for students transitioning to college and the problems common to the first-year student-athlete experience.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and Entertainment in American Life
description: The American sport and entertainment enterprise: background, influences, and trends; collegiate and professional sport organizations; ownership and unionization; media portrayals.    CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and Entertainment Careers
description: Introduction of networking, interviewing, and career planning in the sport and entertainment industry.   FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Introduction to Sport Management
description: Introduction to sport management industry career fields.   FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Introduction to Live Entertainment Management
description: The study of underlying themes in entertainment management and its application to music, family shows, and other live entertainment business venues.

subject: SPTE
name: Introduction to Event and Venue Management
description: An overview of the history, impact, types, and trends of events and venues, the principles of event planning, the role of venues, and career options in each field.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Business Law
description: Formation of contracts and their operation as they apply to business; promissory notes and checks; agency and employment.

subject: SPTE
name: Computer Applications in Hospitality, Retail, and Sport Management
description: Administrative tasks for computer usage, including software and hardware selection, applications, and solutions.   FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Internship I in Sport and Entertainment Management
description: Supervised work experience in a sport or entertainment management area selected by the student with approval of advisor. Contract approved by advisor or department chair is required for undergraduate students.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: SPTE
name: Artist Representation and Management
description: This course focuses on the role of the manager in the entertainment industry and his or her relationships with artists, agents, buyers and industry executives.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Live Entertainment Tour Management
description: This course puts a fine point on performance tour management logistics, including booking, scheduling, shipping, budgeting, movement of equipment, and artist management challenges, including entertainment production.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: The Business of NASCAR
description: The course is designed to present an overall view of the NASCAR industry through a series of guest speakers, who are subject matter experts in their respective NASCAR-related fields.

subject: SPTE
name: Collegiate Athletics
description: Students are provided with an overview of college athletics. Though the course will cover the NJCAA and NAIA, it will particularly focus upon the NCAA, and more specifically, upon the business of “Big-Time” intercollegiate athletics.

subject: SPTE
name: NCAA Compliance
description: Students will gain a basic understanding of NCAA Division I rules and regulations while learning how the rules are applied to member institution. An overview of the operations of an NCAA Division I compliance office and coaching regulations will be provided as well.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and the Law
description: Laws and regulatory bodies affecting the management of sport personnel, facilities, and events.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Resort and Club Recreation Programming
description: Management of club and resort sport complexes.

subject: SPTE
name: The Summer Olympic Games
description: Examination of the Summer Olympic Games and its impact on sport, entertainment, hospitality, tourism and the host community.   FS:10/06/2021.

subject: SPTE
name: The Business of Baseball
description: Overall view of the sport of baseball from a business perspective.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: The Sporting Goods Industry
description: Principles of manufacturing and retailing applied to the sporting goods industry.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and Entertainment Contracts and Negotiations
description: The formation and negotiation of contracts in Sport and Entertainment Management.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Risk Management in Sport and Entertainment
description: Theoretical and practical approaches to managing risk in Sport and Entertainment venues and events.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and Entertainment Marketing
description: Marketing theory and practice and how it relates and applies to sport and entertainment.   FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Ethics in Sport and Entertainment Business
description: The objective of this course is to familiarize students with the ethical issues that exist in the business of sport and entertainment. Students will learn theories of ethics and how they relate to issues faced by managers in the sport and entertainment industry. Ethical theories and philosophies – deontology, utilitarianism, and virtue - will be driving the discussions and understandings of ethical decision-making in this class.   FS:  11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Independent Study
description: Students will have an opportunity to explore a specific area of sport and entertainment management. Individual students will indentify an area of study related to sport and entertainment management and complete a research paper on this topic under the guidance of the instructor.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Entertainment and the Law
description: Performing arts and entertainment industries’ social, economic, and legal issues, in addition to the development and role of entertainment in society, will be analyzed–from its roots to the present.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Promoting Entertainment Events
description: This course should provide students with an understanding of various methods of promotion and approaches to the application of advertising and publicity in the broad spectrum of modern media.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and Entertainment in Popular Culture
description: Investigation of sport and entertainment as critical facets of American society.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport in Film
description: This class invites students to consider a variety of classic and contemporary, international and domestic sports films featuring heroes and villains from baseball, basketball, boxing, football, soccer and other sports stages. Students will develop a rhetorical analysis of socially significant sport films after exposure to numerous critical perspectives.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and Entertainment Services Marketing
description: Basic principles required to promote a service marketing strategy in sport and entertainment.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Spectator Facilities Management
description: Programming, marketing, public relations, fiscal considerations, operation, labor relations, personnel, and event management for spectator sports and entertainment events.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and Entertainment Business and Finance
description: Economic and finance theories applied to the management of sport and entertainment organizations.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sports and Entertainment Event Management
description: Application of management principles to sports and entertainment events.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sales in Sport and Entertainment Business
description: Students will be provided with an overview of the sales process and learn how the sales process applies to sport and entertainment while using hands on exercises to perpetuate the understanding of the importance of sales.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Special Topics in Sport and Entertainment Management
description: Current topics and trends in sport, live entertainment, and venue management. Content varies by title. May be repeated once.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Internship II in Sport and Entertainment Management
description: Placement with a sport or entertainment organization for a supervised learning experience in the student’s career specialization area.   FS: 06/02/2021.

subject: SPTE
name: Research Experience
description: Working with a faculty mentor, students develop a research project and related research skills.   FS: 06/04/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Senior Thesis
description: A senior thesis related to one of the advanced courses in the major program.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Trends and Issues in Sport and Entertainment Management
description: Trends and Issues in Sport and Entertainment Management.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Managing Part-Time Employees and Volunteers
description: Recruiting, hiring, training, and retaining part-time employees and volunteers in sport and entertainment.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: The Business of Esports
description: This course is designed to provide students with an overview of the business of esports. It will focus on the history of video games from creation to the present and will also cover the various business elements of the modern, competitive esports environment.    FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Performing Arts Management and Leadership
description: The study of performing arts management as it relates to nonprofits and organizational structure.    FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Business of Broadway
description: The study of the management of Broadway productions from script to play, including the creative process, business ventures, production houses, and investor relations.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Special Topics in Global Sport
description: This course examines a variety of global sport and entertainment management issues. The emphasis will be on an understanding of the concepts related to the sport and entertainment management in an international setting. Content varies by title. May be repeated once.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Business Principles in Sport Management.
description: Business principles in the management of public and private sector sport programs.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sports Economics
description: This course focuses on issues relevant to sport, entertainment, and related industries. The goal of the class will be for students to understand both basic and complex concepts within economics in a sport and entertainment context, in order to grasp the importance of economic decision-making.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Special Topics in Live Entertainment and Sport
description: Investigation of Special topics pertinent to the sport and entertainment management industry. Content varies by title. May be repeated twice.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Sport and Entertainment Event Development
description: Business concepts needed to develop sport and entertainment special events.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Venue Management: Principles and Practices
description: Managing public assembly facilities and venues.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Integrated Marketing Communication in Sport and Entertainment
description: Use of integrated marketing communication concepts, theories, and strategies in sport and entertainment.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Social Media in Live Entertainment and Sport
description: In-depth investigation of social networks, digital platforms, and online marketing for the live entertainment and sport industries.   FS: 11/2/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: SPTE
name: Advanced Sport and the Law
description: Advanced knowledge of the legal issues that frequently arise in the context of sport will be covered. The focus of the course is law as it applies to sport as well as how the law affects participants, spectators, sport organizations, and facility managers, among others.   GC: 10/26/2020.

subject: STAT
name: Introduction to Statistical Reasoning
description: A course in statistical literacy. Topics include data sources and sampling, concepts of experimental design, graphical and numerical data description, measuring association for continuous and categorical variables, introduction to probability and statistical inference, and use of appropriate software.  Credit given only for STAT 110 or STAT 112.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Statistics and the Media
description: Statistics and the Media. (3) Statistical and information literacy.  Experimental and survey design; descriptive statistics; basic probability; simple confidence intervals and hypothesis tests; statistical software; collection, management, and evaluation of information; and presentation of statistics in the media.  Credit given for only STAT 110 or STAT 112.   FS: 11/1/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Elementary Statistics
description: Introduction to the fundamentals of modern statistical methods, including descriptive statistics, probability, random sampling, simple linear regression, correlation, tests of hypotheses, and estimation.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Elementary Statistics for the Biological and Life Sciences
description: Introduction to fundamental statistical methods with applications in the biological and life sciences. Includes descriptive statistics; probability; one and two-sample models for population means; contingency tables (including relative risk, odds ratios, case-control studies, and estimation of sensitivity and specificity); linear regression; logistic regression; aspects of survival analysis, and ANOVA.   FS: 06/06/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Elementary Statistics for Business
description: Fundamental statistical methods with applications in business. Includes descriptive statistics, graphical methods, probability, distributions, sampling, inference, contingency tables, and linear regression.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Statistical Methods for Data Analytics
description: A second course in statistical methods. Multiple linear regression, model building and regularization, one-way ANOVA, multiple comparisons, and introductions to the ideas of experimental design and generalized linear models. Focused on choosing correct methods, conceptual understanding, using statistical software, checking assumptions, and practical implications. May not be taken concurrently with or after STAT 516.   FS: 06/07/2023.

subject: STAT
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: STAT
name: Introduction to Experimental Design
description: Techniques of experimentation based on statistical principles with application to quality improvement and other fields. Full and fractional factorial designs for factors at two levels; dispersion effects; related topics.   FS: 12/02/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Statistics for Engineers
description: Basic probability and statistics with applications and examples in engineering. Elementary probability, random variables and their distribution, random processes, statistical inference, linear regression, correlation and basic design of experiments with application to quality assurance, reliability, and life testing. May not be taken concurrently with or after STAT 513, STAT 515, or STAT 516. Not for C.A.S., M.A.S., or Ph.D credit in Statistics.    FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Probability
description: Probability and independence; discrete and continuous random variables; joint, marginal, and conditional densities; moment generating functions; laws of large numbers; binomial, Poisson, gamma, univariate and bivariate normal distributions.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Mathematical Statistics
description: Functions of random variables, order statistics, sampling distributions, central limit theorem, quality of estimators, interval estimation, sufficient statistics, minimum-variance unbiased estimator, maximum likelihood, large-sample theory, introduction to hypothesis testing.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Theory of Statistical Inference
description: Hypothesis testing, Neyman-Pearson lemma, likelihood ratio tests, power, the theory of linear models including multiple linear regression and ANOVA, the Chi-square goodness-of-fit test, Chi-square inference for contingency tables, Bayesian inference, and advanced topics including survival analysis (only if time permits).   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Statistical Methods I
description: Applications and principles of elementary probability, essential discrete and continuous probability distributions, sampling distributions, estimation, and hypothesis testing. Inference for means, variances, proportions, one-way ANOVA, simple linear regression, and contingency tables. Statistical packages such as SAS or R.  May not be taken concurrently with or after STAT 509, STAT 513, or STAT 516. Not for CAS, MAS, MS, or PhD credit in Statistics.    FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Statistical Methods II
description: Applications and principles of linear models. Simple and multiple linear regression, analysis of variance for basic designs, multiple comparisons, random effects, and analysis of covariance. Statistical packages such as SAS. Not for CAS, MAS, MS, or PhD credit in Statistics.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Advanced Statistical Models
description: Theory and applications of advanced statistical models. Includes implementation and assessment of generalized linear, nonlinear and nonparametric regression, mixed effect, repeated measures, multivariate regression, and spatial models.    FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Nonparametric Statistical Methods
description: Applications and principles of nonparametric statistics. Classical rank-based methods, and selected categorical data analysis and modern nonparametric methods. Statistical packages such as R.   FS: 10/06/2021.

subject: STAT
name: Sampling
description: Techniques of statistical sampling in finite populations with applications in the analysis of sample survey data. Topics include simple random sampling for means and proportions, stratified sampling, cluster sampling, ratio estimates, and two-stage sampling.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Forecasting and Time Series
description: Time series analysis and forecasting using the multiple regression and Box-Jenkins approaches.   FS: 11/02/2022.

subject: STAT
name: Applied Stochastic Processes
description: An introduction to stochastic processes, including conditional probability, Markov chains, Poisson processes, and Brownian motion. Incorporates simulation and applications to actuarial science.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Financial Mathematics I
description: Probability spaces. Random variables. Mean and variance. Geometric Brownian Motion and stock price dynamics. Interest rates and present value analysis. Pricing via arbitrage arguments. Options pricing and the Black-Scholes formula.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Financial Mathematics II
description: Convex sets. Separating Hyperplane Theorem. Fundamental Theorem of Asset Pricing. Risk and expected return. Minimum variance portfolios. Capital Asset Pricing Model. Martingales and options pricing. Optimization models and dynamic programming.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Statistical Quality Control
description: Statistical procedures for process control including CUSUM and Shewhart Control Charts, and lot-acceptance sampling.   FS: 04/07/2021.

subject: STAT
name: Environmental Statistics
description: Statistical analysis of environmental data. Review of multiple regression and ANOVA, nonlinear regression models and generalized linear models, analyses for temporally and spatially correlated data, and methods of environmental sampling.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Applied Multivariate Statistics and Data Mining
description: Introduction to fundamentals of multivariate statistics and data mining.  Principal  components and factor analysis; multidimensional scaling and cluster  analysis; MANOVA and discriminant analysis; decision trees; and support vector machines.  Use of appropriate software.    FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Introduction to Bayesian Data Analysis
description: Principles of Bayesian statistics, including: one- and multi-sample analyses; Bayesian linear models; Monte Carlo approaches; prior elicitation; hypothesis testing and model selection; hierarchical models; selected advanced models; statistical packages such as WinBUGS and R.   FS: 10/05/2022.

subject: STAT
name: Computing in Statistics
description: An introduction to statistical packages such as R and SAS with special focus on data management and computing procedures such as Monte Carlo simulation.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Advanced SAS Programming
description: Advanced programming techniques in SAS, including database management, macro language, and efficient programming practices.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Computing for Data Science
description: Techniques for data visualization and graphics including interactive graphics, data wrangling and cleaning, data ethics, database querying and administration.   FS: 06/07/2023.

subject: STAT
name: Bayesian Networks and Decision Graphs
description: Normative approaches to uncertainty in artificial intelligence. Probabilistic and causal modeling with Bayesian networks and influence diagrams. Applications in decision analysis and support. Algorithms for probability update in graphical models.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Big Data Analytics
description: Foundational techniques and tools required for data science and big data analytics. Concepts, principles, and techniques applicable to any technology or industry for establishing a baseline that can be enhanced by future study.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Genomic Data Science
description: This course focuses on quantitative knowledge for interdisciplinary applications in genetics as well as hands-on experience in analyzing genetic data. In this course, students will have programming exercises in using analysis tools to conduct genome-wide analysis, annotation, and interpretation of genetic data using R/Bioconductor packages.    FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Data Analysis for Teachers
description: Introduction to statistics for elementary, middle, and high school teachers. The fundamentals of data collection, descriptive statistics, probability, and inference with special focus on methods of teaching statistical reasoning. For M.A.T. (excluding mathematics) / M.Ed. / M.T. and nondegree credit only.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Topics in Statistics
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Statistics for Applied Management
description: Introduction to data collection, descriptive statistics, and statistical inference with examples from hospitality, retail, sport, and entertainment management. Focus on selecting, implementing, and interpreting the appropriate statistical methods using software such as Excel and SPSS.   Not for minor or degree credit in Mathematics or Statistics. Does not prepare students for STAT 516, STAT 518, STAT 519 or STAT 525.   FS: 03/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: AP Statistics for Teachers
description: A thorough study of the topics covered on the AP Statistics Examination. A non-calculus-based introduction, including descriptive and inferential one- and two-variable statistics, and emphasizing activities illustrating statistical thinking.  Current secondary high school teacher certification in mathematics.  For I.M.A./M.A.T. (excluding mathematics)/M.Ed./M.T. and nondegree credit only. Restricted to graduate students.   CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Data Analysis I
description: Primarily for graduate students in statistics and the mathematical sciences. Probability concepts, inferences for normal parameters, regression, correlation, use of computer statistical packages.    CL: 2020.

subject: STAT
name: Mathematical Statistics I
description: Sample spaces, probability and conditional probability, independence, random variables, expectation, distribution theory, sampling distributions, laws of large numbers and asymptotic theory, order statistics, and estimation.   CL: 2020.

subject: STEM
name: Concepts and Connections: An Introduction to Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics
description: This course introduces concepts, connections, and evolving relationships among the sciences engineering and mathematics to strengthen understanding of current ideas and applications of advancing technologies.

subject: SVAD
name: School of Visual Art and Design Internship
description: Supervised experience in a professional environment within the fields of visual art, design, and media. Undergraduate internship contract required with approval of instructor, advisor, and department head before registration.   FS: 06/07/2023.

subject: SVAD
name: Design Studio
description: A faculty-led, student-run, digital and print design agency that will provide experiential learning  opportunities, foster beyond the classroom engagement, and bring community visibility to the  work of students who will create design solutions for real clients in the community.   FS: 06/07/2023.

subject: SWAH
name: Elementary Swahili
description: Grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills. Assumes no prior experience in the language.     Offered only in fall.   CL: 2020.

subject: SWAH
name: Basic Proficiency in Swahili
description: Practice and further development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills. Offered in spring and summer II semesters.   CL: 2020.

subject: SWAH
name: Intermediate Swahili
description: Development of reading, speaking, listening, and writing skills; introduction of East African culture. SWAH 201 offered in fall, SWAH 202 offered in spring.   CL: 2020.

subject: SWAH
name: Intermediate Swahili
description: Development of reading, speaking, listening, and writing skills; introduction of East African culture. SWAH 201 offered in fall, SWAH 202 offered in spring.   CL: 2020.

subject: SWAH
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: THEA
name: Laboratory Theatre Production
description: Procedures for implementation of processes involved in the Laboratory Theatre Production Program. Supervised preparation of all performance and production elements involved in the collaborative process of theatre production. Course content varies according to season production program.   Permission of Instructor or by audition. May be repeated for credit.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Theatre Running Crew Laboratory.
description: Procedures and processes of running crews for the Mainstage Theatre Production Program.  Collaborative teamwork through supervised participation in various theatre production running crews (management, scenic, lighting, sound, costumes and makeup). Course content varies according to season production program. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Theatre Performance Laboratory
description: Preparation and procedures of the rehearsal and performance processes for the Mainstage Theatre Production Program. Collaborative teamwork through supervised participation in an acting company. Course content varies according to season production program. By audition only. May be repeated for credit.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Theatre Production Studio
description: Procedures and processes for the Mainstage Theatre Production Program. Collaborative teamwork through supervised participation in various theatre production student crews (scenic, lighting, sound, costume, makeup, and promotions). Course content varies according to season production program.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Fundamentals of Acting
description: Introduction to the art and craft of acting.  Practical exploration through improvisation and scripted scene work. Includes a brief history of the development of modern acting techniques.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Basic Stage Makeup
description: The study and application of the principles of the art of makeup for the theatre.

subject: THEA
name: Shakespeare in Performance
description: Introduction to Shakespeare’s works on page, stage, and screen. Emphasis placed on performances of scripts. History of Shakespeare’s works/productions, stage/screen technique. Viewings of film adaptations required.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Understanding and Appreciation of Theatre
description: An introduction to the understanding and appreciation of theatrical experience. Attendance at theatrical performances required.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Introduction to Theatre Studies
description: Introduction to methods of analyzing and interpreting drama, with emphasis on play structure, genre, and style. Designed for the theatre major in preparation for theatre scholarship, performance, production, and design.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Stage Management Laboratory
description: Supervised participation in theatre stage management. May be repeated once for credit.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Introduction to Stage Management
description: An introduction to the roles of the stage manager throughout theatrical productions that include pre-production planning, oversight of the rehearsal process, running technical rehearsals and performances, and completing post-production duties.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Make-up Design for Theatre and Film
description: Theory and practice of make-up design for theatre and film. The application of analytical and research skills in the visual development of the character.   FS: 09/09/2020.

subject: THEA
name: Beginning Voice and Speech
description: Study and practical application of voice and speech fundamentals in performance. Emphasis on speaking with ease, power and clarity to impact an audience.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Voice and Speech Studio
description: Training in vocal skills needed by actors such as dialect, verse speaking and voice for a variety of media. Maybe repeated for credit.    FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Stage Costume Construction
description: An introductory course in the principles and practice of costume construction.

subject: THEA
name: Stagecraft
description: A beginning course in the principles and practice of scenic technology.

subject: THEA
name: Beginning Acting
description: An exploration of the acting process through scene study. Focus will be on developing the actor’s personal technique, emphasizing emotional truthfulness and authenticity.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Elements of Design for Theatre Production
description: Foundational application of design principles and vocabulary as applied to the creative process in production design for theatre. Play analysis, creative and visual thinking, and graphic representation.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Introduction to Theatre Sound Design
description: Introduces the students to the basic principles of sound design and technology. Related topics include physics of sound, use and maintenance of equipment, script analysis, and creative thinking.

subject: THEA
name: Introduction to Stage Lighting
description: Principles and practices of theatrical lighting design.

subject: THEA
name: Cosplay Production and Design
description: Production Design and History of Cosplay.  Students will examine the history of cosplay and the practical construction and fabrication of common cosplay crafts and their application in theatrical and film productions. The course will culminate in an original design that is conceptualized from historical research and text.   FS: 06/07/2023.

subject: THEA
name: Literature and Performance
description: Introduction to the study of literature through performance; reading, analysis, and performance of prose, poetry, nonfiction, and drama.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Theatrical Imagery
description: The theory and application of visual imagery in theatrical design; identification and selection of historical motifs.

subject: THEA
name: Japanese Culture and Society through Theatre
description: Introduction to Japanese traditional theatre and its influences on Japanese culture and society. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Intermediate Acting
description: Development of acting skills through study of acting techniques emphasizing emotional truthfulness and authenticity. Application to scene study, monologues and auditions. Intensive script analysis for character development.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Acting from a Physical Point of View
description: Development of physical acting skills related to modern acting techniques emphasizing emotional truthfulness and authenticity. Promoting the experience of full body awareness and expressiveness in character development and storytelling. Includes performative states of relaxation, balance and presence and ensemble work.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Movement Laboratory
description: Training in specific physical skills for actors: stage combat, mime, folk dance, tap dance, etc. May be repeated for credit.

subject: THEA
name: Inner Mastery Thought Movement
description: A mind/body integration course designed for performing artists.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Production Design for Theatre
description: Principles of production design in scenery, costumes, lighting and sound. Play analysis, periods styles, creative and visual thinking and graphic representation.    FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Beginning Acting for the Camera
description: This course will explore a range of techniques that actors need to successfully perform on camera, such as script analysis, scene work, auditioning, understanding type, shooting self-tapes, and what to expect on set. It will also provide knowledge about filmmaking that will help the actor better fit into the industry.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: THEA
name: Independent Study and Research
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Stage Management
description: Delving deeper into the role of the stage manager in theatrical productions that includes problem solving, adapting to challenging situations, and distinguishing the various responsibilities of production assistants, assistant stage managers, and production stage managers and their collaborative contributions.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Voice and Speech for the Actor.
description: Advanced vocal techniques as applied to performance. Specific skills covered may include vocal flexibility and range, vocal dynamics, dialects, and voice-over technique.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Accents and Dialects for the Actor
description: Study and practical application of major accents and dialects used by actors in performance. Emphasis on acquiring the skills necessary for independent learning of an accent or dialect.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Voice Over and Voice Acting
description: Principles and practice of a wide range of voice-over including commercial and narrative styles. Development of character voice as applied to animation, gaming and/or other audio storytelling. Focus is on practical skills necessary for the profession.     FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Musical Theatre Workshop
description: Intensive musical theatre training in areas of song interpretation, musical theatre, dance, voice and acting.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Special Topics in Costume Technology
description: A specialty skills course for advanced students of theatrical costume design and technology. Topics will include tailoring, fabric modification, needle arts, millinery, etc. Course may be repeated as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Computer Aided Drafting for Theatre
description: Develop basic and intermediate skills in using computer aided drafting programs for theatrical designs and technical drawings.

subject: THEA
name: History of Cinema II
description: Survey of the international cinema from 1945 to the present.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Introduction to Costume Design
description: Introduction to the basic principles and elements of design as they apply to the costume designer. Script and character analysis, costume rendering, and production unity.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Theatre Capstone Course
description: Principles, procedures and practice of the creative and collaborative process. Aspects of the discipline with focus on creative and effective collaboration and communication skills among theatre artists, scholars and technicians. Practical and planning skills for professional success after graduation.   FS: 12/04/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Selected Topics in Theatre
description: A series of courses, each lasting one-third of a semester. Topics and prerequisites are announced in the class schedule for each semester.

subject: THEA
name: Rendering Techniques for the Theatre
description: Rendering techniques for the communication of concepts and mood in the design process.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Playwright’s Workshop
description: Principles and practice of playwriting. Writing, adapting, and revising plays. May be repeated with consent of department chair.

subject: THEA
name: Drama in Education
description: Comprehensive review of drama strategies, methods and pedagogical practices to be applied to non-drama learning contexts. Practical experience with the necessary skills, philosophies and techniques of drama in education.   FS: 12/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Children’s Theatre
description: Special problems in producing plays for child audiences.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Applied Theatre Arts
description: Principles and practices of theatre-making within community contexts to address local issues and to provide aesthetic strategies for creative problem solving through theatre.   FS: 12/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Theatre Management
description: Problems involved in organizing, administering, and promoting the non-professional theatre.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Period Styles for Wig and Hair Design
description: Research and execution of period styles for wigs, hair, and facial pieces as related to theatrical and media design.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Theatre Graphics
description: Specialized graphic techniques used in the preparation of a theatrical production. Practice in the execution and interpretation of working drawings, perspective sketches, color renderings, scale models, etc.

subject: THEA
name: Voice and Movement: Practice and Performance
description: A variety of vocal and movement techniques that apply to acting and coaching with special emphasis on the physical and vocal processes in performance.   FS: 06/07/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Global/Contextual Issues in Theatre Education Practice and Performance
description: Survey and analysis of current drama teacher practice across international contexts in relationship to global, social and educational change.    FS: 09/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: History of Costume
description: A survey of clothing through the ages with emphasis on the dress of the actor in significant periods of theatrical activity. From ancient times to present day.   FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: THEA
name: Stage Costume Pattern Drafting and Drawing
description: The principles of pattern making for costume construction using flat-pattern and draping techniques.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Stagecraft
description: Advanced principles and practices of stagecraft.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Performing Arts Safety
description: Study of health and safety hazards for actors, technicians, and audience members.

subject: THEA
name: Scene Painting for the Stage
description: Techniques of scene painting. Application of principles of painting to the stage.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Stage Design
description: Survey of the history and principles of scene design. Assignments will involve drawings, watercolor sketches, and scale models.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Scenic Design
description: Advanced procedures and techniques of scenic design.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Draping for the Modern Silhouette
description: Apparel design through basic draping techniques on industry standard dress forms. Analysis of fit and design, problem solving and interaction of fabric characteristics with style features.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Introductory Methods for K-12 Theatre Certification
description: Developmental approaches to drama instruction in K-12 classroom settings.   FS: 06/07/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: History of the Theatre I
description: A survey of plays, playwrights, actors, production, and the physical development of theatres from the time of the Greeks to 1660; reading of representative plays required.

subject: THEA
name: History of the Theatre II
description: A survey of plays, playwrights, actors, production, and the physical development of theatres from 1660 to the present; reading of representative plays required.

subject: THEA
name: History of Modern Theatre
description: History of Western Theatre since the early 20th century. Students will be introduced to major figures, plays, and movements and explore influences from the broader culture on theatrical expression.

subject: THEA
name: African American Theatre
description: The major movements, figures, plays, and critical strategies that have marked the development of African American theatre in the 19th, 20th, and 21st centuries.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Dramatic Theory I
description: A survey of the major works of dramatic theory and criticism, with emphasis on theories of theatrical performance. from Aristotle through 18th-century neo-classicism.

subject: THEA
name: Dramatic Theory II
description: A survey of the major works of dramatic theory and criticism, with emphasis on theories of theatrical performance from the 18th century to the present.

subject: THEA
name: Dramaturgy
description: A study of dramatic structure as it relates to theatrical production. Emphasis on script reading and analysis. Production and new-works dramaturgy will be covered.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Acting I
description: Theory and practice in the development of a role and an understanding of the psychology of the audience-actor relationship.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Acting II
description: Technique of performing play scripts with heightened language and styles other than naturalism/realism. Some examples of genres that may be taught are Classical Greek, Elizabethan, absurdist.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Makeup for Theatre and Film
description: Makeup design for specific character types, prosthetics and three-dimensional makeup effects. Special attention to the process of sculpting and modeling for makeup prosthetics.    FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Rehearsal and Performance
description: An intensive laboratory course in theatrical and media performances.

subject: THEA
name: Rehearsal and Performance
description: An intensive laboratory course in repertory theatre.

subject: THEA
name: Special Topics in Physical Theatre
description: Research and performance training in selected topics related to physical theatre. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Play Direction I
description: A study of the principles, procedures and practice of stage direction, with the selection, analysis, casting, and rehearsal of a one-act play to be presented in the laboratory theatre.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Play Direction II
description: A continuation of THEA 578.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Film as Performance
description: Study and analysis of film production, performance, and aesthetics.

subject: THEA
name: Costume Design
description: Theory and practice in the design of theatre costumes.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Practice in Sound Design
description: Advanced study in sound, production and design. Emphasis will be on mounting designs and refining design skills for Theatre, Music, and Media Arts students.

subject: THEA
name: Design for Communications Media Production
description: The study and application of techniques in theatrical stagecraft, design, lighting, costuming, and makeup applicable to specialized fields of communication media.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: The Articulate Body
description: Theoretical and experimental exploration of the major body systems and developmental movements to bring more articulation to the body and more awareness and physical ease in performance.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Film and Television Acting
description: Theory and practice of film and television acting.   CL: 2020.

subject: THEA
name: Stage Light Design I
description: The interrelationship of stage lighting and other production elements. Design techniques, equipment, and script analysis. Laboratory work on department productions. Restricted to theatre majors or those having special permission of instructor.

subject: THEA
name: Adv. Stage Lighting Des. II
description: Stage lighting equipment and design techniques. Laboratory work on departmental productions.

subject: THEA
name: Advanced Acting for the Camera
description: This course explores a range of techniques that actors need for a successful career acting on camera, such as script analysis, building a reel, collaboration on set, and creating original content. It also provides knowledge about filmmaking that will help the actor better fit into the industry.   FS: 02/03/2021.

subject: THEA
name: Special Topics in Theatre
description: Reading and research on selected topics. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated once as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

subject: UCAM
name: Careers in Education
description: Role of the teacher and profession of teaching; observation and activities within cooperating schools are involved. Designed to assist students in the career decision-making process.   Note: This course might not apply toward associate degrees or Columbia baccalaureate degrees.

subject: UCAM
name: Effective Reading
description: Techniques for reading comprehension and their application through assignments in varied genres and in parallel reading. Class discussions and compositions.   Note: May not be used for credit toward any baccalaureate degree.

subject: UNIV
name: The Student in the University
description: The purposes of higher education and potential roles of the student within the university. Open to freshmen. Also open to other undergraduate students in their first semester of enrollment.   CL: 2020.

subject: UNIV
name: Transfer Student Seminar
description: The purpose of University 102 is to help transfer students make a successful transition to the University of South Carolina, both academically and personally.  This course aims to foster a sense of belonging, promote engagement in the curricular and co-curricular life of the university, and help students discover and connect with the university.   FS: 02/01/2023.

subject: UNIV
name: The International Student in the University I
description: Building skills and strategies for success in the USA and at USC for international students during their first full credit-bearing semester in the International Accelerator Program.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: UNIV
name: The International Student in the University II
description: Building skills and strategies for success in the USA and at USC for international students in their final semester of the International Accelerator Program.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: UNIV
name: Fundamentals of Integrative Learning
description: Integrates concrete experience with theoretical foundations by reflecting and applying information. Includes a focus on one more experiential pathways such as community service, diversity and social advocacy, global learning, professional/civic engagement, or research.   FS: 03/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: UNIV
name: Special Topics in the Residential College
description: Interdisciplinary discussions for residential college students.  Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.  May be repeated three times as topics vary.    FS:  11/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

subject: UNIV
name: Senior Capstone Experience
description: Integration of major program of study and general education; issues of transition into graduate school and/or employment; group project, intensive writing/speaking.   FS: 06/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Introduction to Women's and Gender Studies
description: A social science perspective of women in psychological, sociological, historical, anthropological, economic, and political contexts; the changing roles, images, and institutions.   FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Women's Health
description: Basic functioning of the female body; effects of society on processes of health and disease. Not for natural sciences credit.   FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Gender and Culture
description: Anthropological study of gender, with emphasis on cross-cultural investigation of the interaction of biological, cultural, and environmental factors including intersections of race, social class, and sexuality as influences gender behavior.   FS: 11/2/2016.   ACAF 2.03: 07/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Human Life Cycles in Different Cultures
description: Childhood, maturity, old age, and gender socialization within the family.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Issues in Women's and Gender Studies
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title. May be repeated as content varies by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Women's and Gender Studies Internship for Non-Majors
description: Supervised experience addressing a community organization’s needs and allowing the student to explore an aspect of the community related to women’s and gender studies issues. Contract approval by advisor required.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Sex and Gender
description: Offers a sociological lens to develop critical ways of thinking about sex and gender as social processes in everyday lives. This course considers how sex and gender shape and affect the experiences of women, men, girls, boys, and individuals who live in the spaces in-between (those who are intersex or transgender) across a wide range of social institutions (family, work, education, politics, etc.).   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Psychology of Marriage
description: The psychological, physiological, and social characteristics of marriage.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Race, Class, Gender, and Sexuality
description: Historical and contemporary power relationships in race, social class, gender, and sexual orientation.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Sociology of Families
description: Sociological perspectives related to various aspects of family behaviors, roles, and values.   FS: 12/07/2016.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Gender, Race and Social Justice
description: This course introduces anti-oppressive theoretical and applied approaches to understand and address intersections of gender and racial inequality. Social welfare policies and services available to women in contexts such as criminal justice, behavioral health, child welfare, and the military are examined.    FS: 03/03/2021.

subject: WGST
name: Feminist Theory
description: Historical development of feminist theory and contemporary debates within feminism.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: African-American Feminist Theory
description: An interdisciplinary survey of the contributions of African-American women to feminist theory.

subject: WGST
name: LGBTQ+ Studies
description: Overview of theories, history, literature, politics, legal, health, and social issues connected to sexualities, including the intersections of gender, race, and social class.   FS: 04/15/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Psychology of Women
description: Women’s experiences: childhood and adolescence, work, family, cultural images, adjustment and social change.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Minorities, Women, and the Mass Media
description: The study of the relationship among persons of color, women, and the mass media in the United States.    FS: 06/01/2022.

subject: WGST
name: Sexuality and Gender in Ancient Greece
description: Gender roles, standards of sexual behavior, evidence for women’s lives, as manifested in ancient Greek literary and archaeological evidence; attitudes toward homosexuality; the modern media’s representation of famous Greeks.   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: WGST
name: Sexuality, Gender, and Power in Ancient Rome
description: Sexuality as a social construct exemplified in standards of sexual behavior in ancient Rome and their reinforcement of the ruling ideology; feminine virtue, definitions of manliness, attitudes toward homosexuality.   FS: 12/05/2018.

subject: WGST
name: Sex, Gender, and Religion
description: Gender and sexuality in the shaping of social and individual identity in religious contexts.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Feminist Philosophy
description: Introduces feminist philosophy and applications to philosophical problems.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Women in China
description: Introduces the connection between gender and the Chinese national imagination. Readings include cultural and historical documents that purport to explain the experience of women in China. Readings in English. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: The Family in Cross-Cultural Perspective
description: Kinship, systems of descent, marriage, and domestic organization in different cultures. Variations in childrearing practices, gender, and other aspects of social relations in kin groups.   Cross-listed Course: ANTH 351

subject: WGST
name: Gender and Politics
description: Impact of gender on the distribution of power in society; foundations for intersections of gender, race, social class, and sexuality and their economic, social, and political concomitants.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Holy Women
description: Holy women from various periods and religious traditions, and how they demonstrate the different ways communities understand ideas of holiness, from piety, martyrdom, monasticism and mysticism to social action.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Women in Modern Europe
description: Survey of women in European history from the eighteenth to the twenty-first century. Focus on women’s citizenship beginning with Enlightenment idea of rights through developments in modern feminism.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Gender and Globalization
description: Examines the dialectic between globalization and the social construction of gender. Topics include the global assembly line, transnational markets for domestic labor and sex workers, and global feminist alliances.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Cultures, Pregnancy, and Birth
description: Anthropological study of pregnancy and birth with a cross-cultural focus comparing the United States to other nations.  Examination of cultural factors such as prenatal care, dietary practices, taboos, birth location, practitioners, and birthing styles.

subject: WGST
name: Global Women's Health
description: This course examines health concerns important in the lives of women around the world through an overview of contemporary issues and challenges in the field of global health, broadly construed.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Special Topics in Women's and Gender Studies
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title. May be repeated as content varies by title.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and director of women’s studies required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Topics in Women's Studies
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Women's Studies Workshop
description: Selected small action-research project on selected issue(s) in women’s studies.

subject: WGST
name: Men and Masculinities
description: This course provides an overview of psychological, social, physical, and emotional issues related to men’s lives. Major topics include: gender construction, men and work, men and health, men in relationships, male sexualities, men in families, and masculinities in the media and popular culture.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Women Writers
description: Representative works written by women.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: LGTBQ+ Literature
description: This course will examine  LGBTQ+ (lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, queer, and other nonnormative sexual identities) literatures and cultures.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: LGBTQ History in the United States
description: Exploration of LGBTQ history and communities in America from the Colonial Era to the present, using lenses of gender and sexuality to understand historical events.   FS: 09/08/2021.

subject: WGST
name: Women and the Law
description: Constitutional and statutory case law dealing with gender equality issues. Topics include abortion, affirmative action, pornography, sexual harassment, fetal protection policies, employment discrimination, and women in the military.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: History of American Women
description: The social, political, and economic roles and changing status of women in America.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Women’s Rhetoric
description: Study of rhetoric by and about women as manifested in speeches, essays, and other rhetorical artifacts.    FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Black Women Writers
description: An examination of literature by and about black women, including fiction, poetry, drama, and autobiography. This study will focus on issues that emerge from the creative representations of black women and the intersections of race, gender, sexuality, and class that interrogate what is both particular and universal experiences.    FS: 09/11/2019.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Community Service Internship
description: Supervised experience addressing a community organization's needs and allowing the student to explore an aspect of the community related to women's and gender studies issues. Contract approval by advisor required.    FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Race, Gender, and Graphic Novels
description: Representations of race and gender in comics with a special emphasis on the experiences of African Americans.   FS: 12/07/2022.

subject: WGST
name: Ecofeminism
description: An exploration of the connections between oppression of women and oppression of nature.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Issues in Women's Health
description: An exploration of women’s health and health care concerns from multiple perspectives.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Adolescent Mentoring
description: Application of skills and theories of adolescent mentoring taught in the classroom to a supervised, structured mentoring field experience.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Women and Crime
description: Impact of gender-based relations on crime and the criminal justice system.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Language and Gender
description: Approaches to gender and language emphasizing the social grounding of both; how language reflects sociocultural values and is a tool for constructing different types of social organization.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Special Topics in Women's & Gender Studies
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title. May be repeated as content varies by title.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Maternal and Child Health
description: Public health issues, social and behavioral science, policies, programs, and services related to maternal and child health in the United States and other countries.   CL: 2020.

subject: WGST
name: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender (LGBT) Health
description: Health status and concerns of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender communities. Includes an examination of measurement issues and methodological considerations in research, as well as intervention efforts targeting LGBT populations.   FS: 09/08/2021.
